loans.name: Abla

texts.en:
Abla Z. has been married for 13 years to a taxi driver, and they have four children. She is practically a professional when it comes to producing and marketing cassava flour and tapioca. She has derived a great deal of experience from this business of hers, which she had before getting married. And she has proved herself to be a good manager. Yet she is no longer able to meet the expectations of her customers due to a lack of capital funds and thus is always short on inventory. This situation might create a crisis of trust with her customers if she cannot gain financial support.

To avoid this problem, Ms. Z. is requesting a loan of $550 to buy fields of cassava plants (the source of both cassava flour and tapioca) in order to develop her business, which she calls «Le Pétit Grain» (The Little Bead) and extend it to Lomé, the capitol. The loan will allow her to augment her income to better ensure the welfare of her family.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Madame Z. Abla s’est mariée depuis 13 ans à un conducteur de taxi. De leur union, sont nés quatre (04) enfants. Elle est une véritable professionnelle dans la production et la commercialisation du gari et de tapioca. Cette activité qu’elle exerce avant son mariage lui procure une large expérience et elle fait preuve d’une bonne gestionnaire. Toutefois, elle n’arrive plus à satisfaire les demandes de sa clientèle elle est toujours en rupture de stock à cause de l’insuffisance de son capital. Cette situation risque de créer une crise de confiance avec ses clients si elle ne bénéficie pas d’un appui financier.

Pour ce faire, Madame Z. Abla sollicite un crédit de $550 pour acheter des champs de manioc (matières de premières de base à la production du gari et de tapioca) en vue d’accroître ses activités et diriger son commerce ver Lomé. Ce qui lui permettra d’augmenter ses revenus afin de mieux assurer le bien-être de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy cassava fields an to produce cassava flour and tapioca.

loans.name: Bayramova

texts.en: U. is an Internally Displaced Person from the Armenian-occupied Fizuli region of Azerbaijan. She is 29 and she is settled in Beylagan together with her family. She has four children. She has been engaged in cattle breeding and selling since 2004. It is traditional and profitable business in rural areas. She borrowed three loans from Normicro Beylagan branch, first for $300 and finally $700. She needs $1000 to buy ten calves, raise them and sell them.

loans.use: To buy ten calves

loans.name: Josephat

texts.en: Josephat O. sells used mats and babies’ toys for a living. Having completed a high school education, he intends to use his loan to expand his business of selling of high quality cloths to increase his profit, in order care for his family's needs.

loans.use: Intends to use the loan to expand and diversify the business

loans.name: Rafiqa

texts.en:
Rafiqa Q. is a 51-year-old married woman. She was born and lives in Otuzik village near Imishli town, situated in the southern part of Azerbaijan. She started her business in 2002 when economic conditions in her family were very bad.

Rafiqa has three children and to cover their needs she purchased one milk cow. Later, she started to sell milk and yoghurt to local people. These milk products are in very high demand in her region. Rafiqa improved her family's living conditions to some extent, and now she has applied for a loan of US$ 900 to purchase another cow for $700 to $750. She plans to use the rest of the money on cattle fodder for the winter.

loans.use: purchase one cow and cattle fodder for winter

loans.name: Juan Nicador

texts.es:
Juan is a young man who has watched over his mother’s well-being for the past 20 years. Day by day he works in his small piece of land sowing potatoes, with the aim of bettering the quality of life at home. Currently he is 32 years old and his dear mother 82. In spite of being able to count on the immense affection and company of his mother, Juan never stops longing to begin his own family and have children who will enjoy his infinite love. This dream led him to formalize his engagement and plan a timely wedding. Nothing is more beautiful than seeing a couple in love with dreams of starting their own family. However, Juan’s dreams could be frustrated by the lack of a solid income. In order to increase his income and offer the best to members of his future family, he needs a sum of $150 dollars in order to invest in the purchase of manure and other fertilizers with the hope of improving his products and in a short time realizing his longed for dream. Let’s make the dreams of this young couple become reality.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Juan, es un joven hijo que ha velado por el bienestar de su madre desde hace 20 años y día a día trabaja en su pequeña tierra sembrando papa, con el propósito de incrementar la calidad de vida de su hogar.Actualmente tiene 32 años y su querida progenitora 82.A pesar de contar con el inmenso cariño y compañía de su madre, no deja de anhelar constituir su propia familia y tener hijos para gozar de su infinito amor. Este sueño lo llevó a consolidar su noviazgo y planear una pronta boda.Nada es más hermoso que ver a una pareja de enamorados con muchas ilusiones de formar un hogar. Sin embargo sus sueños pueden frustrarse por falta de una sólida economía. Con el propósito de incrementar sus ganancias y ofrecerle lo mejor a los miembros de su futura familia, requiere la suma de 150 dólares para invertirlos en la compra de abonos y fertilizantes con el afán de mejorar sus productos y en poco tiempo realizar su anhelado sueño. Hagamos que los sueños de esta pareja joven puedan hacerse realidad.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers for cropland

loans.name: Maria Antonieta

texts.es:
Maria is a hard-working woman that works most of the day as secretary in a company which is open from 9:00 am. to 5:00 pm. Mondays through Wednesdays, and then apart from this work, sells fine jewelry to customers from pictures and catalogues. In order to comply with her customers' orders, she travels bi-weekly to the city of Lima (where she purchases her jewelry items for sale). During her travels, this selfless mother still manages to take care of her home and her family, as well as care for her very elderly mother and her needs. This is the reason she is asking for your help in order to grow her inventory and meet the requests of her clients, with the hope of increasing her income and standard of living. Do not be indifferent to Maria's needs, and let us work with her to help her continue to care for her own mother who requires greater care and treatment.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

María, es una dama muy trabajadora que ocupa el mayor tiempo del día a su labor de secretaria en un grifo en el que trabaja desde las 9:00 am. hasta las 5:00 pm. de lunes a miércoles y muy aparte a esta labor vende prendas de vestir a las personas que realizan los pedidos de sus ofertas por medio de fotos y/o catálogos.Ella trae su mercadería de la ciudad de Lima para poder cumplir con sus pedidos, razón por la cual viaja quincenalmente a la capital para realizar sus compras. Durante sus viajes su abnegada madre cuida su hogar y por ser su único familiar, María vela también por el bienestar de su madre quién es ya de gran avanzada edad.A raíz de este hecho pide le ayudemos a conseguir la cantidad que necesita para aumentar su mercadería a fin de satisfacer los pedidos de las personas con el objetivo de incrementar sus ingresos económicos y nivel de vida familiar.No seamos indiferentes ante la necesidad de Maria y colaboremos con ella y su anciana madre quién requiere de mayores cuidados y tratamientos

loans.use: To consolidate the second occupation of this incredible and selfless mother and daughter. (Inyección de capital para consolidar la segunda ocupación de esta increíble y abnegada madre e hija.)

loans.name: Kay

texts.en:
Mrs. Kay P., 37, is a market vendor running a butcher stand selling pork, beef and chicken. She makes on average around $4 per day in revenue. Her husband is a broker who purchases oxen and raises and sells them.

Mrs. Kay P. has two children, and they are students. Currently, she has requested a loan to repair her butcher stand and buy more cows and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To repair her butcher stand and add more cows and reinvest in her business

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia has a “ventorrillo”, a business selling chicken, salad, vegetables and ripe fruits in Chácaro, in the community of Yamasá. Vegetables and fruits are commonly consumed by people of that community. Therefore, her products are in high demand.

Currently, Cecilia has a weekly profit of USD 60.00. She is forty-six years old; she and her husband have three school-going sons. Her husband works for a construction company. For more than fifteen years, she has been running her business, which is the principal source of income of the family.

Cecilia would like to give her family a better standard of living. With her loan, she will purchase more products to replenish her small store.

loans.use: To make the purchases of vegetables and fruits to replenish a small store.

loans.name: Modupe

texts.en: Modupe Ayinka is a widow with four children. She is 46 years old and hails from Okoko in Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells smoked fish. She has been in business since 1991 and needs the loan amount of $450 to enable her buy more cartons of fish to smoke for re-sale.

loans.use: To buy cartons of  fish to smoke for re-sale

loans.name: Kamuli Rd Village C (Ii) Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Ruth N.. She is currently in the business of selling used shoes and is requesting a loan to enlarge her business buy adding more stock. Ruth is 37 years old and is married. She has 4 children ranging from ages 3 to 18 and her children go to school. Each week, Ruth makes approximately UGX 140000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to meet personal needs. Ruth has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 300000 in order to use in her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Ruth is joined in her small group by Jalia N. and Beth K.. Jalia N. has a business selling second hand shoes and wants to add capital stock. Beth K. is currently operating a retail shop business and wants a loan to expand to wholesale selling.

loans.use: To boost and expand shoe business to increase profits

loans.name: Behka

texts.en: Behka was born in 1972 and lives with her husband in Lukavica, a small village near the town of Živinice. Her husband is a self-employed mechanic who paints cars for a living. They earn a little more than $1,000 a month. Behka contributes to the family's income by raising and selling poultry. This is her first loan from MCO WWI, and she plans to use it to buy a cow and feed for it to eat.  She plans to raise her family's income by selling the cow's milk.

loans.use: To buy a cow and feed for it to eat.

loans.name: Antonio Gomes

texts.en:
Antonio is 31 years old and originally from Monte Puez, in the Cabo Delgado Province. Antonio is divorced and has a 4-year-old boy. His wife got sick in Boane (a village in the Province of Maputo, 30 km away from the capital) and decided to have a traditional treatment at her parents’ house in Cabo Delgado. She decided not to come back and to keep the boy, even though Antonio really wanted to take care of his son.

When Antonio was finishing 7th grade in Cabo Delgado, his mother passed away and he failed in school. The following difficult financial situation didn’t allow him to continue his studies. In 1999 Antonio moved to Cuamba to work as a guard and construction worker at the house his sister was building, and he had the opportunity to attend 8th, 9th, and 10th grades. As Antonio is a very dedicated student, he learned English very well and had the opportunity to work at a South African company that built roads. In 2004 Antonio moved to Boane to live with another sister and work at her small stand selling used clothes.

Soon after, his sister moved to Beira and left him in Boane to take care of the stand. After a small amount of marketing research, Antonio decided to close his sister’s stand and open a stand at the bus and mini-bus final stop selling used shoes and socks. He was the first person to sell socks in Boane and therefore built a very strong customer base. Antonio buys the merchandise in a large warehouse in Maputo every other week. He buys closed packages that contain between 90 to 120 pairs of shoes. There are 3 types of packages: mixed shoes (MTn 2,700), sports shoes (MTn 7,000), and female shoes (MTn 2,500). Antonio cannot see what is inside each package, but lately he has been quite lucky. If he can get a good sport pair of shoes size 8/9, he can sell them easily for MTn 700. And demand is high!

Sometimes Antonio gets shoes that are too old and not in a condition to resell. Antonio makes at least MTn 1,000 per day, and during the end of the month he makes up to MTn 6,000 in a single day. He has a small safe at his house where he deposits at least MTn 100 every day. That is a way of saving and making sure he has money to pay his duties. Antonio’s expenses are small: he rents a small room for MTn 250 per month and pays for energy and his food, besides sending money to his kid.

This will be Antonio’s fourth loan with Hluvuku. The first MTn 5,000 was used to buy merchandise, and he repaid it in just 2 months. The second MTn 8,000 he used to buy a refrigerator and a sofa and paid it back in 4 months. With the third MTn 11,000 Antonio had to change his plan of only buying merchandise and used part of the money to pay his uncle’s medication expenses in Cabo Delgado, as he got very sick. This MTn 15,000 will be used to buy merchandise and repair his secondhand motorcycle that is not working. Antonio wants to increase his stand inventory and attract more clients.

In the future Antonio would like to go back to school and at least finish his secondary degree. He loves studying and dreams of one day going to university. Antonio would also like to expand his business and build a proper store where he would be able to employ people who have the same difficulties in life that he faced. He would like to sell food as well, guaranteeing steady sales during the whole month, and not only big sales at the end of the months. With his hardworking attitude and good business sense, Antonio will definitely succeed in his business and life.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Fotima

texts.en: K. Fotima was born in 1968 in the Asht region of Tajikistan. She is married and has 3 children. Mrs. K. has been trained as a midwife, but is currently engaged in her family's business in trading livestock at the local animal bazaar. It is the family's only source of income, and Mrs. Kurbpnnazarova likes the work she is doing. She is now applying for a loan of US$625 for a 5-month term, which she will use to open a trade outlet. Mrs. K. thanks KIVA for its important work and the support it provides to small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: Opening of a trade outlet

loans.name: Seeran's Group

texts.en:
Seeran baji, the wife of K. M., has lived in Chichawatni, Pakistan for the last 50 years. She owns a five room brick house and is the mother of eight children. Her first two sons are in 7th standard (grade). She recently completed her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan), using the funds to buy a vehicle. She is now applying for a new one on behalf of her husband, a driver by profession, who wants to repair his truck.

She is joined in her loan group by four members: Khursheed baji wants a loan to purchase car seat covers to resell; Nasreen baji, Bashiran baji and Hafizan baji each want a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members guarantee one another's loans, so if one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses.

loans.name: Rukia's Group

texts.en:
Rukia H., 32, is a widow with five children (ages 17, 16, 11, 6, and 20). She has a beauty salon which she started eight years ago. She works from 7am to 9pm daily and is able to make a monthly profit of about $43.

Rukia has taken out three previous loans from Tujijenge Tanzania to expand her business and pay school fees. She hopes for a new loan to increase her business capital. Rukia will share this loan with her subgroup members selling soft drinks, food, and alcoholic drinks.

In the photo, Rukia is second from the left.

loans.use: to increase her business capital

loans.name: Koeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Koeun C., 39, and her husband, Mr. Khorn Khom, 54, who live in a small village across Mekong River about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh, have been married for twenty years and have three sons. All of them study in the local school.

Mrs. Koeun has been a silk weaver for ten years, a skill she learned from her sister. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh. Her husband has been fishing since he was young. The couple also grow rice.

Koeun is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase fishing nets for her husband and to buy a water pumping machine for growing rice.

loans.use: To purchase fishing nets and a water pumping machine.

loans.name: Adrian Antonio

texts.es: El Sr. Adrián tiene 27 años de edad, habita en un barrio de la capital de Managua que se llama Hialeah II etapa, su esposa le tiene un hijo de 6 años que esta estudiando la primaria, su esposa trabaja en servicio de domestico, la mama le ayuda a cuidar a su hijo ya que los dos trabajan para salir adelante y poder terminar de construir su casa ya que es muy sencilla es de tabla  e insegura . Don Adrián trabaja desempeñándose como auxiliar de bodega desde hace cuatro años. Con la solicitud de préstamo es para infraestructura en la construcción de paredes de concreto de su vivienda. A largo plazo es ascender de puesto y obtener un mejor ingreso, y ayudar a su hijo con los estudios.
texts.en:
Adrián is 27 yeears old, lives in the Hialeah II neighborhood in the capital city Managua. He and his wife have a 6 year old son who is in primary school. His wife works as a domestic employee, his wife’s mother helps take care of their son as both he and his wife work in order to get ahead and be able to finish building their home. Adrián has worked as an assistant in a grocery store for 4 years. The loan is for the infrastructure of concrete walls for his home. In the long term he hopes to move up in his job and obtain a better income, and help his son with his studies.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair and construction of concrete walls of his home

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria O. is 30 years old and married with four children. She sells clothes at the Uselu market in Benin City in Edo State, Nigeria. She sells women's clothing only.

Gloria is a hardworking woman and she is determined to lift her family above poverty. She needs the loan for N52,000 to purchase more clothes to sell. She says a big thank you to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Natalya

texts.en:
Natalya sells food items, e.g. candy and sweets, in the grocery section of her local marketplace. She has been in this trade for two years. One of the significant factors that motivated her to start her own business was a need to provide for her family. Currently, Natalya has about 20,000 Grivnas in inventory. Her turnover capital amounts to 8,000 Grivnas and net profit is about 3,384 Grivnas a month.

Natalya’s business has grown to be self-sustainable. It has passed different formation stages, as well as survival, growth and stable consistency in sales. Today she is seeking a loan for 5,000 Grivnas to re-stock her merchandise for the winter season. Natalya is hoping to generate additional income with new grocery products and increased sales.

loans.use: To re-stock her merchandise for the winter season

loans.name: Sophat

texts.en: Mrs. Sophat N. was born in 1971 and she now lives in Trapaing Ampil village in Kampong Cham province. She and her husband have three children two of whom are attending the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study because that child is on the age of a year. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where she cultivates rice. Her husband, Mr. Vann Sophat, is a palm juice collector who gathers juice to process into palm sugar or wine. In this business, he now faces a problem because he does not have enough bamboo to tie to the palm tree to climb up to gather juice. In order to deal with this problem, Mrs. Sophat N. decided to ask for a loan of $500 to buy more bamboo for her husband's business. Her husband appears on the left of photo.

loans.use: To buy more bamboo for her husband's  business.

loans.name: Suon

texts.en: Suon C., 25, is married, has two young children, and lives with her husband in Prey Veng province, Cambodia. Since 1999, she has been running a grocery store selling various goods. With her business, she is able to make US$20 in revenue each day. Suon C.'s husband, Keng Vicheth, 26, operates a motor-taxi and earns about US$2 per day. Suon C. is currently asking for a loan of US$500 to increase the grocery inventory at her store.

loans.use: Purchase of groceries for a store

loans.name: Bendicion 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
The Bendicion (Blessing) Bank of Hope has 2 groups of five entrepreneurs, with a total of 10 members. They all live in San Pedro D. Macoris, in the southwest Dominican Republic. This is their first loan with Esperanza International.

Celeste D. L. S. is the Group 1 coordinator. She has 6 children, ages 21,18,16,14,11 and 10. The younger three still live with her. She is very concerned about providing well for them and making sure they have the best education possible.

Celeste's business is a small sandwich/coffee shop. She will use her loan money to purchase more sandwich provisions (bread, ham, cheese, tomatoes), in order to serve a larger clientele. She believes this first loan will take her closer to her goal of a larger cafeteria.

Thank you for supporting these entrepreneurs!

loans.use: Purchasing merchandise to restock business

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.es:
En el municipio de Somotillo de la ciudad de Chinandega, la señora Ernestina M. se dedica con mucho esfuerzo a su negocio con el propósito de llevar a cabo la remodelación de su vivienda por la cual requiere de los materiales de construcción para así realizar su tarea y seguir adelante en el negocio.

Con gran esfuerzo ha logrado salir adelante y hoy en día ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de los materiales ya que requiere mejorara sus condiciones y brindarle un techo digno a sus tres pequeños hijos. Con este crédito logrará continuar con la obra ya que iniciará con la puesta del techo de la vivienda y así continuará poco a poco hasta finalizar.
texts.en:
Hailing from Chinandega, Somotillo, Ernestina Martinez is a hard-working woman who is very interested in improving the lives of her children and the success of her business by remodeling the home out of which she runs her store. It is only with great effort that she has been able to get to where she currently is, and today she is coming to Ceprodel in search of a loan to cover the cost of the materials necessary to put a roof on her house, an improvement that she believes will push her business forward and finally allow her to offer a fitting home to her three young children.

Translated from Spanish by Cyrus Maher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials

loans.name: Iluminada

texts.es:
La Sra. Iluminada C. tiene 64 años,  esta casada con el Sr. Antonio Gomez Cabrera que tiene 71 años. Ellos tienen cuatro hijos, todos  mayores y con sus familias respectivas.

La Sra. Iluminada tiene su merceria desde el año 1978 que está ubicada sobre una de las avenidas mas importantes de la zona. Las mercaderías que más vende son las prendas de vestir para damas y caballeros  y los calzados de dama.

El crédito que solicita actualmente desea destinarla a la compra de pantalones, camisas, polleras y calzados para uniforme colegial teniendo en cuenta que se están iniciando las clases en las instituciones educativas y que tiene una gran cantidad de pedidos de dicha mercaderias.
texts.en:
Mrs Iluminada C. is 64 years old and married to Mr. Antonio Gomez Cabrera who is 71 years old. They have four children, all of whom are grown and have their own families. Mrs. Iluminada has had a store for since 1978 that is located on one of the most important avenues of the zone. The products she sells the most of are men's and women's clothing and women's shoes. She desires to use the loan she is requesting to buy pants, shirts, skirts and shoes for school uniforms since classes are starting and there is a high demand for such merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pants, shirts, skirts, and footwear for school uniforms

loans.name: Khanifa

texts.en:
A. Khanifa is 50 years old. She is married and uses all the money she makes to care for her 4 children and provide for their education. Khanifa has an experience of 5 years in preparing and selling dried apricots. She always makes very productive use of her capital, adding inventory to her supply in a way that allows her to meet her customers' needs. She is also very polite and considerate, and her customers are always very happy with the service they receive from her. Because her business is doing so well, she is increasing her net worth month by month.

Today Khanifa requests 800 USD for a term of 9 months. She is going to spend the loan purchasing dried apricots with the purpose of processing them in order increase the range of her goods. Khanifa expresses her gratitude for everyone supporting her and promises to repay her loan in a timely manner.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing dried apricots in order to increase the range of goods

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort A. is a 45-year-old married mother of four children – one son and three daughters. One of her children is learning a trade while the others are in senior high or junior high school. Comfort lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in the farming/commercial town of Takorase, near Akim Oda, in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Her husband is a farmer, and she works to support him in providing for the family.

Comfort cooks and sells rice and stew in the local government school compound. She has been in business for over 20 years. She purchases bags of rice and other ingredients from nearby supermarkets, and she is requesting a loan to buy rice in bulk. She hopes to give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice in bulk

loans.name: Kwabena

texts.en:
Kwabena D. is a 45-year-old married father of six children. Presently all of the kids are attending school.  Kwabena lives with his family in Dorma which is in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana.  Kwabena thinks Dorma Ahenkro is a community you would love to visit because of its serene atmosphere and the unity that exists among the people who live there.  It is a farming area and the common thing that can found there, apart from the food crops they cultivate, is the use of bicycles.  Almost everyone owns a bicycle which they ride to the farm, to school - almost everywhere. Kwabena is a professional bicycle repairer and he also sells bicycle parts.  He has been in this business for the past 20 years and this is how he supports his family. 

He travels to the nearby town of Kumasi to purchase his bicycle parts. He will use the loan to buy more bicycle parts so he can better stock his inventory to avoid traveling everyday, and have more parts on hand to service his clients.  With the support of a loan he believes he can better provide a quality education for his children. He belongs to a village bank called ‘‘Hwe die Nyame Aye’ which means See What the Lord Has Done.

loans.use: To buy more spare bicycle parts for his repair shop.

loans.name: Rustam

texts.en:
B. Rustam is 45 years old. He is married and has 5 children. Rustam sells foodstuff in his grocery. He has been in this business already for 12 years. This activity generates the main income for Rustam's family. Rustam is very popular in his community for providing fresh products daily for sale. He tries to maintain a wide range of goods. Thus, today Rustam requests 7000 Somoni for expanding the range of foodstuff in his grocery.   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing inventory for food market.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose M. is married and has four dependents. She has received schooling through junior high. Rose sells clothing and fabric at Kotokoraba in Cape Coast, which she has done since 1984. Her husband is on pension. 

Rose uses her income to help her husband pay school fees for the children and also pay the rent and utility bills. Rose will use the loan to purchase clothing and fabric in large quantities for resale. With the new profit from her expanded business, Rose plans to support her husband in saving towards a house they want to build for the family.

loans.use: To purchase clothing and fabric in large quantities for resale.

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en: Christiana produces polythene bags and plastics. She has been in the business for the past 20 years. She is 48 years old and married with three children. She lives in Lagos State, Nigeria, and she is requesting NGN 150,000 to purchase more polythene in bulk so that she can make them in to bags to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more polythene for production

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
La señora Rosario vive en casa propia con su esposo en la calle Manuel Jofre de la zona de Tacagua de la ciudad de La Paz, el esposo trabaja como mecánico  y ella tiene una tienda de abarrotes en la misma casa; con los ingresos que tienen de ambas actividades pueden cubrir sus mas mínimas necesidades. El crédito que solicitan es para surtir su tienda y poder tener mayor clientela de esta manera estabilizar sus ingresos ya que ellos son personas de la tercera edad y no tienen mas actividades.

Son clientes de Impro y pagaron muy bien por lo tanto pueden acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Rosario lives with her husband in her own house on Manuel Josfre Street in the Tacagua zone in the city of La Paz. Her husband works as a mechanic. She has a grocery store in her house. With both incomes they can cover their barest necessities. The loan she is asking for is to stock her store in order to have more customers. This will stabilize her income. They are in their old age, and they do not have other income producing activities. They are clients of Impro. They make their payments very well, so they qualify for a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy general merchandise for her store

loans.name: Marlene Guadalupe

texts.es: Marlene Guadalupe P. vive en el municipio de Colon ubicado en el departamento de La Libertad. Con 32 años de Marlene es una mujer de familia muy trabadora y responsable actualmente vive  con su esposo y sus dos hijos menores de edad y estudiantes. Marlene  ha apoyado a su esposo con la ayuda de su negocio en el transcurso de 10 años consecutivos, posee una venta de ropa, cosméticos y perfumes, el crédito que solicita en esta oportunidad Marlene es para invertir en mercadería para su negocio lo que le ayudara a incrementar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Marlene Guadalupe P. lives in the municipality of Colon, located in the department of La Libertad. At 32 years of age, Marlene is a very hard-working and responsible family woman. She currently lives with her husband and two school age children. Marlene has helped out her husband with her business for 10 consecutive years. She sells clothing, cosmetics, and perfume. The loan that Marlene is requesting at this time will be invested in purchasing merchandise, which will boost profits.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: ESTUDIOS UNIVERSITARIOS

loans.name: Ama

texts.fr: Résidente du quartier d’agoè-atsanvé, cette femme dynamique a commencé en 2006, le commerce d’huiles de palme, son ancienneté dans ce commerce a fait qu’elle en a la parfaite maîtrise, mariée et mère de 03 enfants, c’est avec le revenu de ce commerce qu’elle subvient aux charges de la famille. Faisant face actuellement à une baisse de son stock, elle souhaite se réapprovisionner et sollicite par conséquent de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 15 bidons d’huiles de palme.
texts.en:
A resident of the neighborhood of Agoè-Atsanvé, this dynamic woman started her palm oil business in 2006. WIth her experience in this business, she has attained perfect mastery. She is married and the mother of 3 children. Income from this business enables her to provides for her family's needs. Her stock has decreased and she wishes to restock it - as such, she is requesting a loan from WAGES (a micro-finance organization), in order to buy 15 cans of palm oil.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cans of palm oil

loans.name: Colita

texts.en: Colita H. is from the village of Mantic Tangub City. She is 45 years old. Colita is married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Colita owns & operates a business operating a specialized "sari-sari" retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products and dried goods in the local community. Colita has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2009, Colita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Colita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Colita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Ung

texts.en: Ung C., 27, is married with two young children living at home in the Phnom Penh. She works in a grocery store, typically making US$2 each day.  Her husband, Sam Si, typically makes about US$4 each day working in a local organization. Ung C. would like a loan of US$600 to expand her grocery inventory to meet her customers' demands.

loans.use: To expand her inventory

loans.name: Manuel De Jesús

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Managua, el señor Manuel R. ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de materiales de construcción porque requiere invertir en su vivienda porque ha estado maltratada a raíz que los años han transcurrido y por tal razón anhela brindarle a su familia las condiciones necesarias para vivir.

Es por esto que muy sabiamente al haber solicitado el crédito espera que sea otorgado para a lo inmediato comprar los materiales de construcción y de esta manera mejorar su vivienda para beneficio propio y de su familia amada.
texts.en:
In the city of Managua, Manuel has turned to the microfinance organization Ceprodel to request a loan to buy construction materials. He needs to invest in his home because it has been battered as the years have passed and Manuel longs to offer his family the conditions necessary for a good life.

That is why he has very wisely requested this loan and hopes that it will be granted so that he can immediately buy the construction materials and improve his home to benefit himself and his beloved family.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Elisapeta

texts.en:
Elisapeta K. is a 44-year-old woman living in the town of Asaga. She is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Elisapeta owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. Elisapeta has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 120 WST a month from these activities.

In 2009, Elisapeta joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elisapeta is now requesting a loan of 750 WST which will be used to purchase harvesting equipment. This will be the 1st loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD. Elisapeta plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About SPBD:

SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment

loans.name: Leng

texts.en: Leng Y., 48, is married with four children. She resides in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia with her husband and children. To make a living, she is engaged in a business of selling soups, porridge, and groceries, earning a gross income of about US $30 per day. Her husband is a motorbike repairman, earning an income of US $5 per day. The family is also assisted by three of her children who are currently employed at different workplace. These sources of income from Y., her husband, and the children help cover the family expenses especially for one of her children's education. Y. and her husband are seeking to improve their standard of living and generate a better income. Therefore, Y. is asking for a loan of US $1000 to purchase groceries and food to expand the business.

loans.use: To buy more groceries and food for sale

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel B. is from the village of Brgy. Baresbes, Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 59 years old. Daniel is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Daniel owns & operates a business raising pigs for sale. Daniel has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Daniel joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Daniel is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase feed & other supplies. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Daniel from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase feed & other supplies

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is forty-six years old. She is divorced and has four children who are all still in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a community where the major occupation is trading.

Janet works very hard to be able to provide for her family. She runs a provision store by the roadside in her community, procuring her goods from Accra. Janet has been in business for fifteen years and wants a loan to buy provisions in bulk to increase her stock.

loans.use: To buy provisions in bulk

loans.name: Silvia Marcela

texts.es: La señora Silvia Marcela H. G., tiene 29 años de edad vive en el Barrio Medardo Andino, vive acomcompañada por su novio y es madre de dos niños pequeños y dentro de sus planes estan la remodelación de su vivienda ella se dedica desde hace 3 años a vender frescos naturales y dentro de sus planes tambien esta la ampliacion del local de venta y la diversificacion de los productos  que ofrece, ella en estos momentos atraviesa por problemas familiares debido a que perdio a su madre quien era la que le apoyaba economicamente y a supervisarle a sus niños mientras estaba en la universidad, tras esto dejo de estudiar para dedicarse a tiempo completo a la venta y a sus hijos, ahora ella solicita este prestamo para comprar materiales de construcción para la ampliacion y compuesta del techado de su casa.
texts.en:
Silvia Marcela H. G., 29, lives in the Medardo Andino neighborhood. She lives with her boyfriend, and she has two small children. Part of her plan is to remodel her house. For three years she has been selling natural cold drinks. Another part of her plan is to expand her place of sales and to diversify the products she offers. She is now experiencing family problems because she lost her mother. Her mother supported her economically, and she watched the children while Silvia was at the university. Because of this she stopped her studies in order to devote all of her time to selling and to her children. She is asking for this loan to buy construction materials to expand and build the roof on her house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials

loans.name: Anastase

texts.en:
Anastase is 29 years old and is married with two children, 3 and 5 years old. He also takes care of one dependent. He lives in Rulindo, a region situated in the Northern Province of Rwanda.

Anastase has been a driver of a motorbike for a long time and he starts driving from early in the morning until late in the evening hours.

Anastase needs to purchase one more motorbike in order to increase his daily revenue. To this end, he is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company. With this loan, after purchasing his second motorbike, which he has dreamed of, he will hopefully earn more profits.

These profits will be used for an investment in a bakery business as another source of income. With this new business, Anastase will create more jobs for the people of his community.

loans.use: The purchase one more motorbike

loans.name: Erwin

texts.en:
Erwin G. is from the village of Malagana, Claveria Misamis Oriental. He is 29 years old. Erwin is married and has 2 infant-aged children. To make a living, Erwin owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling green bananas in the local community. Erwin has been engaged in his business for over 4 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Erwin joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erwin is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Erwin from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ada Zila

texts.es: Ada Zila es una mujer joven. Esta no es la primera experiencia que ha obtenido con financiamientos. Su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 16 años que se dedica a este negocio. por lo que tiene 2 hijos que mantener, Doña Ada sale a vender todos los días en su único medio de transporte que es una bicicleta, por lo que busca la forma de mejorar su negocio es así ofreciendo sus productos de manera personal y en su bicicleta. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de materia prima. Su deseo es mejorar cada día con su negocio.
texts.en:
Ada Zila is a young woman. This is not her first experience with obtaining a loan. Her economic activity is the sale of general goods. She has been in this business for more than 16 years as she has 2 children to support. Every day Doña Ada goes out to sell using her only means of transportation, her bicycle. She looks for ways to improve her business by offering her products both personally and from her bicycle. The loan she is requesting is for working capital to buy merchandise. Her wish is to improve her business every day.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Senyi Tusitukirewamu Group 2, Lugazi

texts.en:
Meet S. Robert, a 32-year-old father of three. Shown in the photo with hand raised, he is the leader of his lending group.

Robert’s journey into business began with a few savings from his farming activities in the village of Kiwungi in Lugazi. From his small savings this determined man began a retail shop in 2005. This has since then been his only source of income for his family.

From his growing business, Robert has painstakingly catered for his family’s welfare. His success calling card in his business, he says, has been that close acquaintance chord he has developed with his clients. At present his business draws him close to 100,000 shillings a week.

With this loan, Robert reckons on a revamping spree for his business - that is, buying more stock for his shop. He is such a strong and delightful man.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, maize flour, soap and so on

loans.name: Honest Group

texts.en:
This group is named “Honest Group.” The members are all local entrepreneurs in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. This will be their first Kiva loan through SMT.  With the help of this loan, they will be able to add more goods into their businesses, make more sales, and consequently improve their standard of living. They are, therefore, requesting a loan of SLL 500,000 for each member of the group to buy more goods to add to their businesses.

Their leader is 26-year-old Fatmata S. (on the right in the photo) who sells market-food – pepper, salt, magi (used to give sauce a sweet taste, like boullion cubes), rice, sugar, etc. for four years. Fatmata intends to invest her share of the loan in her business by buying the above mentioned items in wholesale quantities. This entrepreneur was born in Makeni. She is married to a diamond miner and they have two children who attend primary school.

loans.use: Buy pepper, salt, magi, rice, sugar, etc. wholesale to add to her business

loans.name: Marilou's Group

texts.en:
Marilou G. is from the village of Padul, Solana, Cagayan. She is 28 years old. Marilou is the group leader of a 9-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Marilou is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Marilou owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Marilou has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Marilou joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marilou has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. Marilou is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Marilou from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Maria Dominga

texts.es: La señora Maria Dominga, ella tiene 56 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijas, las cuales ya todas son mayores de edad y le ayudan a trabajar en el negocio. La señora tiene un negocio de venta de comida, el cual está localizado en el mercado, generalmente aquí lo que elabora principalmente son desayunos y almuerzos, a las 3 de la tarde la señora viaja a su casa a preparar el trabajo del día siguiente. Ella ya tiene 30 años de dedicarse a este negocio, empezó en ese tiempo debido a que su mama era la que vendía tortillas y fue ella  la que empezó a vender enchiladas, tacos gallo pinto. Después el negocio pasó bajo la administración de Maria Dominga. Ella está solicitando este crédito para invertirlo en la compra de maíz, arroz y granos básicos utilizados para la elaboración de comida. Su sueño siempre ha sido llegar a establecer un restaurante grande ubicado en un local muy bonito y que pueda expandirse más su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria is 56 years old. She is married and has three adult daughters who help her with her business. She sells breakfast and lunch from a location in the market. She finishes by 3:00pm and returns home to prepare for the next day. She’s been doing this for 30 years and she started because her mother used to sell tortillas, and Maria began selling enchiladas and tacos. The business eventually passed to Maria. She is asking for this loan in order to buy corn, rice, and basic grains that she uses to prepare her dishes. She has always wanted to open her own restaurant in a nice location so that she can expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Irène

texts.fr: à 33 ans cette femme reste une femme très dynamique, elle est marié et mère d'un enfant,elle vit avec sa famille dans le quartier d'anfame qui est un quartier périphérique de la ville de Lomé. elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de détail de cadre photo pour les décorations et s'approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé. son stock actuel de marchandises est en baisse, pour se réapprovisionner elle sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour l'achat de 40 cadres photos de décoration. avec le revenu de son activité elle contribue aux charges financières de son foyer.
texts.en:
This woman of 33 is still very dynamic; she is married and the mother of one child, and she lives with her family in the Anfame neighborhood, an outlying district of the town of Lome. She retails decorative picture frames to earn a living and buys her inventory at the big open-air market of Lomé. Her present stock of merchandise is low, and in order to replenish it, she is asking WAGES for her first loan to buy 40 decorative picture frames. With the income from her business, she contributes to supporting her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of 40 decorative picture frames for resale

loans.name: Samin's Group

texts.en:
In Kandaol Village in Takeo Province, four people have formed a loan group. Mrs. Samin O. was selected by the other members to be the group leader. Each member of the group will use their portiO. of the loan for a different purpose.

Mrs. Samin O. and her husband, Mr. Ven Vey, are farmers who own a 1.4-hectare (~ 3.5-acre) plot of land where they grow crops to sell so they can  support their family. Now, their problem is that it is time to plow their field, but they do not have enough money to pay for plowing. So, to improve productiO., Mrs. Samin O. is applying for a loan to rent a plow to plow her field. She is the mother of a child who attends the local public school.

loans.use: To rent a plow

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en: To make a living, Letecia L. plants and harvests rice for sale. She is 39 years old, married and has two school-age children. They are from the village of Villaramos. Letecia has been in her business for many years and earns approximately 2,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2009, Letecia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Letecia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for rice production. This will be her fourth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for rice production

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Graciela es socia del Banco Comunal Milagros, Graciela es casada y tiene 4 hijos de los cuales solo la ultima esta estudiando en el colegio, Graciela viaja a los diferentes pueblos en donde compra cereales de los productores, viaja los días miércoles y regresa los días sábados, sus productos los comercializa en los molinos.
Graciela solicita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de quinua, trigo, cebada.
Graciela sueña con comprar un carro para transportar sus productos y ayudar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Graciela is a member of the Community Bank Milagros. Graciela is married and she has 4 children, only one of whom is still in school. Graciela travels to different villages where she purchases cereals from farmers. She travels on wednesdays and she comes back on saturdays. She sells her products to different mills. Graciela requests a loan in the amount of 3000 soles, funds that will be invested in the purchae of quinoa grains, wheat, and oatmeal. Graciela's dream is to pruchae a car to transport products and help her children.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase quinoa grains, wheat, and oatmeal.

loans.name: Jeep Group

texts.en:
Bitrosy C., 23 years old, is single. He has operated a business selling tomatoes for 5 years. He is really a hardworking young boy. He travels upcountry to collect and buy tomatoes and then sells them in different markets in the city center.  He works from 5 a.m. to 6 p.m. and is able to make a monthly profit of about $197.

This will be Bitrosy’s first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He  hopes for a loan so that he may travel further for a good stock of tomatoes for his business. Bitrosy will share this loan with his loan group, Jeep. The 16 members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back the loan. 
	
In the picture, Bitrosy is 3rd from the left in the front row, wearing a fabric shirt.

loans.use: To buy more stock of tomatoes

loans.name: Prossy

texts.en:
Prossy is 37 years old, married with six children aged 8 to 18 years old. Her spouse is a teacher and her family responsibility is to look after her family. She has no other dependents. She lives in a rented home in Masindi, Uganda. She has a bar business and has been doing that for eight years.

She started with a small bar but now it’s big with a pool table and entertainment. She has no hardship in her business and she expects it to grow into a guest house. She wants the loan to buy a pool table for her pub business.

loans.use: To buy a pool table for her pub

loans.name: Rebecca Gannaban Group

texts.en:
Rebecca G., age 41, is from the village of Arcon and is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by ASKI.  In a group loan, each member receives an individual loan, but they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Rebecca G..

Rebecca is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Rebecca has a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Rebecca has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2300 PHP a month.  Rebecca recently joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting her first loan, for 5000 PHP, to purchase additional products to sell.

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy inventory for her general store.

loans.name: Vanesa Guisela

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Banco del Desarrollo”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Wanchaq, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.


La socia es la Srta. Vanesa Guisela; ella tiene 25 años de edad y es soltera; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de ropa, ella tiene una tienda de ropa en el centro comercial Cusco, ella vende ropa para damas dese las 9:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m, la socia quiere mejorar y ampliar su negocio. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería como blusas, pantalones, chompas y casacas para mujeres.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the the community bank "Development Bank". The bank is located in the Wanchaq district of the province and department of Cusco.
The member is Vanesa; she is 25 years old and single. She combines her daily chores with running a business selling clothes. She has a clothes store in the commercial center of Cusco. She sells women's clothing from 9:00am until 8:00pm. She wants to improve and grow her business. She is requesting a loan to buy merchandise such as blouses, pants, sweaters, and jackets for women.
She is grateful to the people who are part of this dream through this loan and promises to complete her repayments according to the established timeframe.

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as blouses, pants, sweaters, and jackets for women

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita V., age 55, is from the village of Binuangan. She and her husband have four children. To make a living, Nenita makes and sells clothing products to local businesses and community members. Nenita has been engaged in his business for over 35 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Nenita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services. She hoped to help improve his living situation and increase his ability to engage in business activities. Nenita is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Nenita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to manufacture additional clothing products

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie N., an 18-year-old resident of Seeta in the Mukono region of Uganda, is single and has no children. For less than a year, she has operated a business selling fish.

To help expand her business, Winnie has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda to purchase another retail shop. With the help of the loan, she hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself. In the future, she hopes to own two businesses. Winnie is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to become independent.

loans.use: To purchase another retail shop

loans.name: Mirian Maritza

texts.es:
Mirian es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Mensajeras” ubicado en el distrito de Juliaca, provincia San Román, departamento de Puno, tiene 24 años de edad, de estado civil soltera y no tiene hijos, tiene estudios de educación secundaria.

Mirian viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 03 años, con un préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que  utilizó para incrementar el capital de su negocio de confección.

La señorita solicitará un nuevo préstamo de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, dinero con el que comprará rollos de tela para la confección de polos.
	
Su sueño es crecer más con el negocio. Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal son las reuniones, charlas y las orientaciones.
texts.en:
Mirian is a member of the Las Mensajeras, or Messengers, Community Bank in the district of Juliaca in San Román province, in the department of Puno. She is 24 years old and is single with no children. She completed her high school education.

Mirian has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for three years. Her original loan was for 300 new soles, which she used to raise capital for her seamstress business.

She is applying for a new loan of 1,000 new soles, money which she will use to buy rolls of fabric to make polo shirts. 

Her dream is to grow along with her business. The things she likes most about the Community Bank are the meetings, workshops, and training sessions.

loans.use: Purchase of fabric to make polo shirts

loans.name: Yahaira Alejandra

texts.es: La Sra,Yahaira A. es una persona muy emprendedora y trabajadora, ella labora en una oficina como auxiliar contable y aparte tiene su negocio de ventas de articulos de marcas reconocidas como lentes, cintos, bolsas, cachuchas etc. las ventas las hace con su conocidos y por medio de encargos, en este momento solicita el credito debido a que con las fiestas navideñas incrementan sus pedidos y quiere surtir todos los encargos para la mejora de su negocio y apliar su cartera de clientes. Siempre preocupada para darle mejor nivel de vida a sus hijos ya que ellos son su razon de ser y crecimiento continuo.
texts.en: Yahaira A. is a very enterprising and hard-working person. She works in an office as an accounting assistant, and she also has a business selling items from recognized brands, such as sunglasses, belts, handbags, baseball caps, etc. She sells to people she knows and also in response to orders. She is requesting a loan at this time because the Christmas holidays increase her sales, and she would like to stock up on all the orders to improve her business and broaden her customer base. She is always concerned with expanding her business and providing a better quality of life to her children, since they are her reason for being.

loans.use: Buying merchandise for her business

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth, de 40 años,  en una madre de familia muy trabajadora y preocupada por el desarrollo de su barrio, vive en su casa,  propia junto a su esposo y sus 3 hijos menores. La actividad cotidiana al que se dedica Elizabeth, es la preparación de papa y pollo fritos, comúnmente llamado (salchipapas), platillos que vender al igual que las gaseosas. Desde entonces su trabajo consiste en pelar la papa la cantidad de 6 a 8 kilos diariamente, para tenerlas lista para la fritura; además de sazonar el pollo. De esta manera lleva más de 7 años realizando esta labor, en la puerta de su casa,  siendo sus clientes sus vecinos de su barrio, quienes gustan de su sazón y de la atención. Para Elizabeth es muy importante éste trabajo, ya que se genera ingresos para su familia, por tanto procura siempre ser cordial con sus clientes. En adelante, continuará trabajando con su negocio para construir su casa, de ese modo mejorará su calidad de vida y la de sus hijos. Es su primer crédito que tiene Elizabeth, y hace compromiso de pagar puntual sus cuotas. Desea asimismo contribuir por el bienestar y organización de su grupo comunal. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará insumos para la elaboración de comida rápida, de ese modo seguir atendiendo a sus clientes.
texts.en: Elizabeth is 40 years old.  She is the mother of a very hardworking family, and is concerned with the development of her  neighborhood.  She lives in her own home with her husband and their three small children.  The daily activity that Elizabeth works at is the preparation of potatoes and and fried chicken, commonly called salchipapas, plates that  she sells along with soda pops.  Typically, her work consists of peeling potatoes in the quantity of 6 to 8 kilograms daily in order to have them ready for the  food stall; also she seasons the chicken.  In this way she has spent more than 7 years doing this work in the door of her home.  Her clients are her neighbors in the neighborhood, who like her seasonings and the attention.  For Elizabeth this work is very important, as it generates income for her family.  As such she tries to always be pleasant with her clients.  In the future, she will continue working wit her business in order to construct her house, and in this way she will improve her quality of life and that of her children.  This is the first loan that Elizabeth has taken, and she has promised to make her payments punctually.  She also wants to contribute to the wellbeing and organization of her communal group.  With the loan that she is asking for, she will buy ingredients to make fast food, and in this way continue to attend to her clients.

loans.use: To buy non-perishable products to make fast food

loans.name: Mujeres Alegres Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formó gracias a Lis Jorgelina N. G., que vive en la cuidad de Potrero Melgarejo Loma. Encantados aceptaron conformar el Comité de mujeres rurales nombrando al Comité Mujeres Alegres.
 La señora Jorgelina es la presidenta del grupo, ella es una mejer muy trabajadora quien se dedica a la elaboración de artesanía. 
Esta actividad es muy común entre las mujeres de la zona y producen en gran cantidad y con mucha calidad sus prendas y las mismas son muy admirados por los clientes. 
En ocasiones cuando reciben muchos pedidos trabajan todas juntas para cumplir con los pedidos.
En esta ocasiones ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de telas y colorantes para la telas. 

   Las integrantes del comité se dedican al  comercio, cría de cerdos, artesanía  etc. 

  Con la ayuda que le ofreció la Fundación Paraguaya, este comité logro mejorar sus ingresos y  también mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
This communal bank was founded by Lis Jorgelina Nunez G., who lives in the town of Potrero Melgarejo Loma. The members of the communal bank are female farmers, who named it "Comité Mujeres Alegres" ("Cheerful Women Committee"). 

Jorgelina is the group's president. She is very hard-working and makes handicrafts. This is a very common activity amongst women in the area, who produce a great quantity of high quality garments that are very much admired by customers. Sometimes, when they receive large orders, they join up to work together in order to fulfil them. 

On this occasion she is requesting a loan to buy fabrics and fabric dyes.Communal bank members work in commerce, pig farming, handicrafts and other. With the help offered by Fundacion Paraguaya the communal bank members have managed to improve their income and their living conditions.

loans.use: Buy fabrics and fabric dyes.

loans.name: Ramiz

texts.ru:
Ramiz G. rodilsya v 1955 qodu. On jenat i imeyet 2 detey , odin iz kotorix uchitsya v kolledje. Ramiz jivet v qorode Baku vmeste so svoyey jenoy i detmi. 
Ramiz uje 17 let zanimayetsya etim biznessom. eto uje vtoraya ssuda Ramiza , posle pervoy ssudi on pochinil svoyu mashinu i prodav yeyo kupil druquyu mashinu. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit zapchasti dlya svoyey mashini.

http://www.kiva.org/lend/67095
texts.en:
Ramiz G. was born in 1955. He is married and has two children, one of whom is studying in college. Ramiz lives in the city of Baku together with his wife and children.

Ramiz has been in this business for seventeen years. This is the second loan for Ramiz, and after the first one he repaired his vehicle and sold it and bought a new car. Right now he needs 2000 AZN to buy spare parts for his vehicle.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for vehicle

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba A. is married and has one child. She sells rice and 'Fante kenkey' (balls of fermented maize dough) at Abura. Her husband is a mason. Aba uses her income to assist her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.

 Aba will use the loan to purchase more maize to expand her business. With the new profits from her expanded business, Aba plans to reinvest back into her business.

In her hand is a 'Fante kenkey' ball. The bowl close to her is full of corn dough.

loans.use: purchase more maize to expand her business

loans.name: Luis Javier

texts.es:
El señor Luis R. labora en el Municipio de Masaya, del Departamento de Masaya como Operador de Pozo desde hace 11 años, posee un núcleo familiar de 4 personas en el que se encuentran tres menores de edad.
En estos momento se ha acercado a las oficinas de CEPRODEL a solicitar un crédito para realizar mejoramiento de su vivienda. 

Es importante destacar que el crédito será utilizado para la compra de los materiales de construcción para la mejora de su vivienda. Él está claro que al realizar estos cambios en su vivienda y así está contribuyendo al bienestar de su familia ya que en la época de invierno no se le filtrará el agua y estará protegida su familia.
texts.en:
R. C. has worked as a well operator for the company ENACAL, in the town of Masaya, in Masaya department, for 11 years.  He has four people in his immediate family, including three dependent children.

This gentleman has approached CEPRODEL's offices to request a loan so that he can improve his home.  He is certain that carrying out this work on his home will improve his family's well-being since, in the winter season, water won't enter his house and his family will be protected.

loans.use: To improve his home

loans.name: Rina Alexandra

texts.es:
Rina  de 35 años de edad  se caso a los 14 años.  Hace 3 años atrás su cuñado le enseño el negocio  y desde trabajo en su propio taller de ebanistería  elaborando  juegos de comedor, mesas, sillas de madera. 

Unas de las dificultades es el hecho que por ser mujer enfrente mayores obstáculos  en su negocio, sin embargo ya tiene clientes fijos a los cuales les entrega su mercadería.  Su esposo se dedica a la telecomunicación. Tienen 4 Hijos de 16, 12, 4 y 1 años. Con el préstamo que va hacer quiere  comprar madera, goma y mejorar su vivienda. Sus metas es tener establecido su producto en el mercado, que su negocio Prospere. Tener su propio almacén y más personal.
texts.en:
Rina is 35 years old and she married at age 14.  Three years ago, her brother-in-law taught her the business and she has since worked in her own carpentry workshop making dining sets, tables, and wooden chairs.

One of the difficulties she faces is the fact that women face more obstacles in the business.  Nevertheless, she already has regular customers to whom she delivers her goods.  Her husband works in telecommunications.  They have 4 children, ages 16, 12, 4, and 1.  With the loan, she wants to buy wood and rubber to improve their housing.  Her goal is to establish her products in the market, so that her business thrives.  She would like her own store so it will be more personal.

loans.use: For wood and glue.

loans.name: The Joy Of Cancun Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama “Alegría de Cancún” porque somos  mujeres que radicamos en Cancún con una actitud alegre como la ciudad. Está ubicado en Quintana Roo, en México. La señora Carla Elianora P. Sánchez es integrante del grupo. Tiene 26 años y estudio una carrera técnica en música. Es maestra de música. Ella se dedica a la venta de plantas de ornato. Solicita el préstamo para la compra de tierra, plantas, semillas para  el crecimiento del negocio. Sus clientes opinan que  las plantas que ella vende están bien cuidadas; su atención es amable y  piensan que la venta de plantas es una actividad generosa  con el medio ambiente. Al solicitar este préstamo se siente muy contenta por poder contribuir con los gastos de su familia y así salir adelante para llevar una vida más estable. También espera que  la gente se anime más en la compra de plantas para ayudar al medio ambiente y así tener  un mayor ingreso para apoyar a sus papas y  continuar preparándose en la música.
