texts.en: The name of this group is "The Joy of Cancun" and it was named because they are a group of women who live in Cancun and who have a happy attitude, like the city. It is located in the Quintana Roo, in Mexico. Mrs. Carla Elianora P. S. is a member of the group. She is 26 years old and she studied music. She is a music teacher. She sells ornamental plants. She requests a loan to purchase potting soil, plants, and seeds to develop her business. Her clients comment that the plants that she sells are always well cared-for. Her customer service is very kind and they think that the sale of plans is a generous activity for the environment. When she requested the loan she felt very happy to be able to contribute to the family's expenses and to support herself, to have a more stable lifestyle. She also hopes that the population will increasingly seek to buy plants to help the environment. She will have a better income to help her parents and to continue studying her career in music.

loans.use: to purchase potting soil, plants, and seeds for the development of her business

loans.name: Amour Divin Group

texts.fr:
Ronald est le coordinateur  de son groupe Amour Divin.
 

Ronald habite dans la ville de Trou-Du-Nord  d’Haïti où de l’électricité est rare  et l’eau est très limitée.

Ronald  a dirigé son commerce de bonbon, divin; l’huile  pendant les dernières 5 années. Avant de commencer ce commerce, Ronald  était un élève

Ronald  voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir au commerce du bonbon et de vint
Ronald  peut utilise ses emprunt a l’aidera a réalisé un plus  gros bisness

Des autres membres de Amour divin ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tells  commerces comme boisson, vêtements et produits alimentaire.

Celons Ronald  ses défis  principal c’est manquement d’argent pour être un grand commerçant.

Ronald dit que son but principal  est possédé un gros biseness il veut considérer comme un leader  de la communauté.
texts.en:
Ronald is the coordinator of the group Amour Divin (“Divine Love”). He lives in the city Trou-Du-Nord in Haïti, where electricity is scarce and water supplies are very limited.

For the past five years, Ronald has been running a store selling candy, wine and oil. Prior to this occupation, Ronald was a student.

Ronald wants to use this loan to invest in his business. He expects the credit to help increase his profits.

Other members of Amour Divin require a loan for such activities as the sale of beverages, clothing and food items.

According to Ronald, the main challenge is the lack of money to become an important businessman. His main goal is to own a large business and be considered a community leader.

loans.use: to sell clothing and food products

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is a 47-year-old married woman with four children. The oldest child is 25 years old.

Elma owns a business making toilet bowls. She has had this business for four years. She earns about 3000 PHP per month. She plans to use her loan to purchase additional materials for making toilet bowls.

Elma works hard to support her family. She hopes for her business to grow.

loans.use: to purchase materials for making toilet bowls

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es:
Ricardo tiene la edad de 53 años, con su propio negocio de lubricantes, el cual tiene 6 años de haber establecido su negocio, el cual inicio con ahorros de su trabajo anterior, ocupando parte de su vivienda para ampliar su venta de lubricante y todo para vehículo.
Su esposa lo apoya y sus dos hijos con el negocio. Lo que quiere hacer es mejorar la infraestructura del negocio repellar paredes, embaldosar y comprar puertas, logrando una mejor imagen, que ayude a atraer clientes. Todo esto lo hará mediante el préstamo que Afodenic está otorgando por medio del financiamiento, el cual es de mucho beneficio en su negocio.
texts.en:
Ricardo is 53 years old and he runs his own lubricants shop. He opened it 6 years ago, something he was able to do thanks to his saving form his previous job. His lubricants and car accessories shop occupies a part of his house.
His wife and their two children help him with the shop. What he wants to do is to improve the infrastructure of his shop buy whitewashing and tiling the walls, and by buying doors, thus getting a better look that will help him attract customers. He will achieve this goal thanks to the loan that Afodenic is being granting through the funding, which is a great benefit for his shop.

loans.use: To buy materials to whitewash and tile the walls of his shop and to buy doors in order to improve the look of his shop.

loans.name: Victoriano Candelario

texts.es:
Victoriano, reside en Usulután, se dedica a la siembra de maíz y frijol, vive en casa propia, vive con su esposa y una hija de 5 años de edad, él trabaja la tierra desde hace 6 años y aprendió de su padre.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para pagar el alquiler del terreno y compra de abono y fertilizantes, este préstamo le ayudara a tener las herramientas y todo lo necesario para la siembra.
El sueña con algún día cultivar sus propias tierras, piensa que con trabajo y mucho esfuerzo lograra realizarlo.
texts.en:
Victoriano lives in Usulután and grows corn and beans for a living. He owns a home and lives with his wife and 5-year-old daughter. He has been working the land, a skill he learned from his father, for 6 years. He is currently requesting this loan to pay rent for the farm land and to purchase both chemical and organic fertilizers. This loan will help him to obtain the tools and everything he needs for sowing.

He dreams of one day cultivating his own crop fields, and he thinks that with hard work and much effort, he will be able to achieve that dream.

loans.use: to pay rent for farm land and to purchase both chemical and organic fertilizers.

loans.name: El Cerrito Group

texts.es:
El siguiente grupo que presento se llama "El Cerrito", el grupo se encuentra en la comunidad de "San Miguel La Labor", aquí en la comunidad hay muchas necesidades y es donde hay mayor pobreza, la gente necesita tener trabajo, algo a que dedicarse para ganar dinero, los hombres por lo regular no tienen un trabajo y solo se dedican a ser albañiles y las mujeres se casan muy chicas, este grupo esta cerca de las oficinas de vision mundial, y los hijos de las señoras estan patrocinados por vision mundial, el grupo lo integran 8 mujeres y 1 hombre, El señor Alfredo es el representante de este grupo y el nos comenta como le va con su negocio.
Don Alfredo se dedica a la ganaderia, cria y engorda de borregos, tiene 20 años dedicandose al negocio de los animales y lo mas dificil ha sido que los animales se enfermen, ya que eso representa mucho gasto para poder salvar la vida de un borrego, por ahorita don Alfredo nos dice que no ha vuelto pasar por esos percanses y que al comprarlos el solo quiere que tengan crias y se espera hasta que la cria crezca para poderlos vender y no dejar que los borregos se hagan grandes de edad. El prestamo va beneficiar mucho a la familia del señor Alfredo porque ya vendiendo el borrego hay una ganancia y eso ayuda para que pueda llevar comida a su casa, Las metas que tiene en mente son no darse por vencido para que le vaya mejor e ir luchando para que sus hijos les toque una mejor vida y una mejor educación, mejores oportunidades de trabajo y sentirse orgulloso de sus hijos, don Alfredo tiene 8 hijos, los hijos que dependen de el son solo 2, pero el quiere que sigan la escuela y no la dejen por falta de dinero, el señor Alfredo va cumplir 18 años de casado, vive en casa propia y su esposa se dedica al hogar. 

Los demas integrantes del grupo son las siguentes personas:
1.-Tomasa, ella se dedica a criar borregos
2.-Maria Guadalupe, se dedica a criar borregos
3.-Francisca, se dedica a criar borregos
4.-Natalia, se dedica a criar borregos y puercos
5.-Victoria, se dedica a criar borregos
6.-Manuela, se dedica a criar borregos y pollos
7.-Marcela, se dedica a criar pollos y guajolotes
8.-Leticia, se dedica a cuidar puercos.
texts.en:
The following group is called "El Cerrito" [The Little Hill], located in the community of San Miguel La Labor. Here in the community there are many needs and a great deal of poverty. The people need work, something to which they may apply themselves in order to earn some money. The men in general do not have work and only offer themselves as construction workers. The women get married very young. This group is near the offices of Vision Mundial [World Vision] and the women's children are sponsored by Vision Mundial. The group is made up of eight women and one man. 

Señor Alfredo is the group's representative and tells us how things are going in his business. Don Alfredo earns a living raising livestock, he raises and fattens sheep. He has been in the business for twenty years and the most difficult aspect has been when the animals get sick as that represents quite a bit of expense to be able to save the life of a sheep. For now Don Alfredo tells us, he has not had to deal with those mishaps, and when he buys them he only hopes they will bear young and he waits until the lambs are grown to be able to sell them and does not let the sheep get very large. The loan will be of great benefit to Señor Alfredo's family since there is a profit when selling the sheep and that helps him be able to bring home food to his family. 

The goals he has in mind are not to give up so that things may get getter and to keep struggling so that his children may have a better life and a better education, better work opportunities and to feel proud of his children. Don Alfredo has eight children of whom only two depend on him, but he wants them to stay in school and not leave school on account of no money. Señor Alfredo will soon celebrate his 18th wedding anniversary. He lives in his own home and his wife works in the home. 

The other members of the group are the following persons: 

1.-Tomsa, she raises sheep
2.-Maria Guadalupe, she raises sheep
3.-Francisca, she raises sheep
4.-Natalia, she raises sheep and pigs
5.-Victoria, she raises sheep
6.-Manuela, she raises sheep and chickens
7.-Marcela, she raises chicken and turkeys
8.-Leticia, she raises pigs.

loans.use: to purchase sheep to raise and fatten.

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is a married woman with four children. Two are adults while two attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For over 10 years, she has operated a food market, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of delayed payments by those who purchase on credit and fail to pay. She dreams of establishing a restaurant in the future.

With the Kshs 15,000 she wants to purchase bales of wheat flour, sugar and beans. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance to get instructed about various products and access funds to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase bales of wheat flour, sugar and beans.

loans.name: Sarita Colonia Del Progreso Group

texts.es: La señora Martha tiene 55 años D. edad es casada y tiene 07 hijos D. los cuales solo uno vive en casa con ella, desD. hace un año se dedica a la produccion D. bolsas D. basura al inicio ella tenia una pequeña bodega pero con el tiempo y al ver que no tenia muy buenos ingresos decidio cambiar D. rubro y dedicarse a la elaboracion D. bolsas,primero con sus ahorros se compro una maquina selladora D. plastico. El prestamo lo invertira para aumentar su capital y comprar insumos. Hasta el momento a logrado comprar otra maquina y su sueño es poder tener su empresa D. plasticos.
texts.en:
Martha is 55 years old.  She is married and has seven children, only one of whom still lives at home with her.  For one year, Martha has been making trash bags.  She used to have a small grocery store but, over time, she saw that she wasn't making very good profits and so decided to change her business activity and start making bags.  She used her savings to buy a machine for sealing plastic.

Martha will invest her loan in increasing her capital and buying supplies.  She has managed to buy another machine and her dream is to own a plastics company.

loans.use: to invest in buying supplies for making trash bags

loans.name: Ammar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 29 years old and married. Ammar has had a workshop since 2006. He repairs and sells motorcycles. He has more than five years experience and has a good reputation. He is well known in his area.

Ammar is requesting a $1800 loan to make showcases, a sliding door and to add more inventory to his workshop. He is aiming to gain more profit so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to make showcases, a sliding door and to add more inventory to his workshop.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es:
El Sr.Ricardo está casado con la Sra. Mirdia hace varios años. Tienen dos hijos menores que dependen de ellos. 
Don Ricardo trabaja en compra-venta  de artículos reciclados, se inició con un pequeño capital que tenía ahorrado de otro trabajo que  realizaba.Gracias al trabajo emprendido educan a sus hijos y compran todas las necesidades de su hogar.Él se define como una persona muy responsable y honesta en sus compromisos.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de aluminio, cobre, plásticos y otros.Como antecedente dentro de la Fundación ya posee créditos, con los cuales cumplió satisfactoriamente.
texts.en:
Sr. Ricardo has been married to Sra. Mirdia for several years.  They have two young children who are dependent on them.

Don Ricardo buys and sells recyclable materials.  He started with a little bit of capital that he saved up from another job he had.  Thanks to his work, he has been able to provide his children with an education and buy necessities for their home.  Ricardo is considered to be a responsible person who is honest in his commitments.  

He is requesting a loan to buy aluminum, copper, plastics, and other materials.  Ricardo has had previous loans with Fundación Paraguaya that were fully repaid.

loans.use: to purchase aluminum, copper, plastics, and other materials.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children.
 
Evelyn has a retail shop that sells canned goods, junk foods & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks.

Evelyn is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Evelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes and cosmetics for the business.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is an aggressive and hardworking 33-year-old business lady. She is married and blessed with four children of whom three are in school. For the last three years she has been running a retail shop so as to make ends meet. She makes extra money by operating a beauty salon. 

She wants in the next five years to have expanded her business and her dream is to own a piece of land. She is requesting a loan of 30,000 Kenya shillings to buy sugar, rice and soap. She is grateful to Faulu Kenya for making it easy for her to access credit to inject into her business.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice and soap.

loans.name: Belquiz

texts.es:
Cuando nuestro asesor vivitó a Belquiz la encontró muy contenta pues con su credikiva dió mantenimiento a su equipo de refrigeración y ahora conserva mejor sus carnes rojas; así mismo hasta le alcanzó el dinero para comprar en mayor volumen y sus clientes se han incrementado.
En la actualidad está aplicando a su nuevo credikiva, para continuar aumentando su capital de trabajo, pues anteriormente solo vendia a vecinos y ahora con nuevos clientes de barrios aledaños, está necesitando aun mas dinero para realizar sus compras; su mensaje a los financiadores es el siguiente:
" Gracias a Dios y a los financiadores de Kiva, por la oportunidad que me han brindado, pues con el crédito recibido, pude impulsar mi negocio y recibir utilidades que son reinvertidas en la familia. Siganme apoyando para aumentar mis posibilidades". Con su nuevo credikiva comprará carne y ternero de vientre pues es uno de los productos, por los que mas preguntan su clientes y rota mas rapidamente. Su inversión es exitosa porque tien mucha experiencia en el mercado,  trabaja mediante venta programada, recibe el pedido y luego lo entrega. Si usted quiere conocer la historia de Belkis ingrese al siguiente enlace:
texts.en:
When our advisor visited Belquiz, she found her very happy with her Kiva loan.  She was providing maintenance to her refrigeration equipment, and she now  preserves her red meat better.  She even had enough money to buy in greater volume, and she has more customers.

She is currently applying for a new Kiva loan in order to increase her working capital.  She previously only sold to neighbors, and now with new customers from bordering neighborhoods, she needs even more money to make her purchases.

Her message to the lenders is the following:  “Thanks to God and the Kiva lenders for the opportunity they have given me.  With the loan I received I was able to drive my business and receive profits that were used for my family.  Keep supporting me in order to increase my possibilities.”

She will use the new Kiva loan to buy meat and calves that are not yet born.  This is one of the products that her customers request the most, and they turnover very quickly.  Her investment is successful because she has a lot of experience in the market, she works through scheduled sales, she gets an order, and then she delivers it.  

If you want to know Belkis’ history go to the following site:

http://www.kiva.org/lend/281705

loans.use: to buy meat and calves that are not yet born.  This is one of the products that her customers request the most, and they turnover very quickly.

loans.name: Timothy

texts.en:
Timothy is a business man and is age 54. He is married and blessed with ten children. For over 25 years, he has been managing a business of selling charcoal to earn a living. He has retained his business because of his good reputation with his customers. He expresses thanks to Faulu Kenya for training him on good customer care.

In the next 5 years, he wants to expand his business. His dream is buy a plot. He is requesting for a loan of 90,000 Kenya shillings to buy charcoal.

loans.use: To buy charcoal

loans.name: Rejoice

texts.en:
Rejoice is a married woman with four children none of whom are in school. She has a business selling charcoal in Hai Gwafa branch in Yei, South Sudan. She has been in this business for four years.

Rejoice requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to enable her to purchase or order more charcoal for sale.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Vitaliana

texts.en:
Vitaliana works hard to support her family. Vitaliana is married and has a food productions/sales business in the Philippines. She has requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business. Vitaliana has been in this business for 2 years now, and also earns additional income from a general store.

Vitaliana would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business

loans.name: Rey

texts.en:
Rey is 22 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has one child. 

Rey is providing habal-habal (motorcycle transport) services. He has had this business for three years. He requested a loan for 15,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for the service. 

Rey has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Rey hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for the service

loans.name: Buviniso

texts.ru: Бувинисо занимается бизнесом на протяжении 11 лет. Она замужем любит свою семью. У нее трое несовершеннолетних детей. Доходы уходят на обучение и содержание семьи. Она старается во всем помогать мужу. В бизнесе  вместе с ней задействован старший сын. На рынке она продает детскую одежду. Наступают праздники и зима. Следует пополнить ассортимент товара и обновить его. Бувинисо хотела бы получить займ и увеличить свой товарооборот. Она надеется получить займ и заранее благодарит вас за вашу доброту и милосердие.
texts.en: Buviniso has been in business for 11 years. She is married and loves her family. She has three minor children. Her income is spent supporting her family and paying for the children’s education. She tries to help her husband in all things. Her eldest son is helping her out in the business. She sells children’s clothing at a local market. Winter and the holiday season are coming. It is time to expand and renew her stock of goods. Buviniso would like to receive a loan to increase her sales volume. She hopes to obtain this loan and thanks you in advance for your kindness and compassion.

loans.use: to buy clothing for the winter season

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. 

Elizabeth has a shop that sells canned goods, shampoo, detergents and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 9,000 PHP to buy canned goods, shampoo, detergents and beverages .

Elizabeth has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Elizabeth hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, shampoo, detergents and beverages

loans.name: Rene Raul

texts.es: Rene, originario de la  Esperanza comarca  localizada en Yalaguina municipio de Estelí , tiene 40 años de edad, tiene 1 hijo de 5 años de edad, el es comerciante dueño de una pulpería . El inicio su negocio atravez de un préstamo que le hicieron hacer tres años , fue comprando mercadería poco a poco y al mismo tiempo invirtió en elaboración de rosquillas en su comarca esta actividad la realiza por  la tardes anteriormente se dedicaba a la albañilería . El realizo el préstamo para comprar maíz, queso, arroz, frijoles, aceite, azúcar, sopas, galletas, gelatinas, jugos, golosinas, detergentes.  Estos productos son de mucha demanda  a diario por lo cual el crédito le ayudaría a mantener inventario para solventar las necesidades de su clientela. El desea ampliar su pulpería con nuevos productos y vender sus rosquillas en los diferentes municipios de Esteli.
texts.en:
Rene is originally from Yalaguina in the town of Estelí, which is located in the region of La Esperanza. He is 40 years old and has a five-year-old son. Rene is a merchant and the owner of a store. He started his business with a loan he received three years ago. Rene purchased merchandise a little bit at a time. At the same time he invests in the production of donuts, an activity he performs in the afternoons. Rene previously worked as a bricklayer.

The loan he is receiving will be used to buy corn, cheese, rice, beans, oil, sugar, soups, cookies, gelatins, juices, candies, and detergents. These products are in great demand each day. This loan will help to maintain his inventory so that he can meet the needs of his customers. Rene wants to expand his store with new products and sell donuts in different towns around Estelí.

loans.use: to buy corn, cheese, rice, beans, oil, sugar, soups, cookies, gelatins, juices, candies, and detergents.

loans.name: Yuryi

texts.ru:
Юрий женат, у него двое дочерей. Юрий с семьей живет в селе Подстепное, Цюрупинского района. Он занимается выращиванием ранних огурцов уже 10 лет. В свое фермерское хозяйство Юрий вложил 100 000 гривен.   

Юрию необходим кредит в 15 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить семена, пленку, химикаты, удобрения, дрова, уголь, а также покрыть транспортные расходы, связанные с установкой отопления в теплицах. За счет улучшения условий в теплицах Юрий сможет удовлетворить потребности покупателей, предоставляя им качественный товар, и получит дополнительную прибыль. 
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en:
Yuryi is married and has two daughters. Yuryi and his family live in the village of Podstepnoye, in the Tsyurupynsk region. He has been growing early cucumbers for ten years. He has invested 100,000 hryvnia into his farm. 

Yuryi needs a loan of 15,000 hryvnia to buy seeds, plastic sheeting, chemicals, fertilizers, wood, coal, and to cover the transportation costs associated with installing heating systems in the greenhouses. By improving the conditions in his greenhouses Yuryi will meet his customers' needs by providing them with quality products, and he'll make an additional profit.

loans.use: to buy seeds, plastic sheeting, chemicals, fertilizers, wood, coal, and to cover the transportation costs associated with installing heating systems in the greenhouses.

loans.name: Mitsanze

texts.en:
Mitsanze is a married man with three children, all of whom attend school. He lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past year, he has operated a printing shop business. His potential customers are neighbours and passersby. He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. He dreams of establishing other businesses in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to purchase five reams of printing papers for his business. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase five reams of printing papers for his business.

loans.name: Mariuxi Yesenia

texts.es:
Mariuxi Yesenia tiene 30 años vive en unión libre, y vive con su cónyuge y su hijo, de 9 años. Vive en el Recinto San Vicente las Lomas  en el Cantón Ventanas.

La ventanilla el recreo  se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Vicente las Lomas, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembre de maíz y arroz, fréjol y soya.

Mariuxi se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz desde hace siete años. Compra y vende los roductos en Ventanas.

El crédito solicito para la compra de insumos, insecticidas, urea, abonos, líquidos para la siembra del maíz. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia. Su sueño es poder gozar de una buena salud y así poder estar unidos con la familia.

En los tiempos libres le gusta salir a pasear y jugar fútbol con su hija.
texts.en:
Mariuxi Yesenia, 30, lives with her common-law partner and her 9-year-old son.  She lives in the San Vicente Las Lomas sector in Ventanas canton.  El Recreo Communal Bank is located in the San Vicente Las Lomas sector of Ventanas canton.  This bank is involved in short-cycle agricultural work growing corn, rice, beans, and soy.

Mariuxi has worked for seven years in agriculture growing corn.  She buys her products in Ventanas and sells them in Ventanas.

She requested the loan to buy supplies, insecticide, urea, manure, and liquid fertilizer to grow corn.  The loan has helped her increase her income for her family's use.  Her dream is to be able to enjoy good health and so be able to be close to her family.

In her free time she likes to go out for walks and play soccer with her daughter.

loans.use: to buy supplies, insecticide, urea, manure, and liquid fertilizer to grow corn.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ingredients and supplies to prepare her food.

loans.name: Djidjoho Group

texts.fr: Le groupe DJIDJOHO est composé de trois personnes qui fréquentent la même église. Delphine2, la représentante du groupe (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 37 ans  est mère de trois. Delphine2 vend noix d’acajous depuis trois ans ce qui lui permet de subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants. Delphine2 s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire sa clientèle, Delphine2 sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe DJIDJOHO un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter des sacs de noix d'acajoux.

loans.name: Yacouba

texts.fr: YACOUBA est né en DECEMBRE 1974 à SOROMANA, cercle de KOLONDIEBA, une des préfectures de la 3ème région administrative du Mali .Mr YACOUBA est âgé de 41 ans avec 8 enfants dont 3 filles. Mr YACOUBA réside à FAKOLA dans une famille traditionnelle. Mr YACOUBA s’est vite intéressé aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat et vente de pièces détachées. Sa vente se fait à FAKOLA. Fort de  ses 7 années d’expérience dans le domaine, il collabore avec Soro Yiriwaso pour augmenter  son fonds de commerce afin de satisfaire sa clientèle qui ne cesse de grandir et est à son  troisième prêt. Mr YACOUBA compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 3 colis de pièces détachées. Il s’approvisionne à BAMAKO. Il effectue ses ventes au comptant à une clientèle mixte. Mr YACOUBA espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les activités.

loans.use: Achat de pièces détachées

loans.name: Irine's Group

texts.en:
Irine is 46 years old and has 9 children. She has been a farmer for more than 20 years and is always said to be a very hardworking individual. Even though Irine is the only one featured in the above picture, she is actually representing her group formed by 12 farmers in Chwele District, Kenya.

Irine started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago, in 2012, and decided to do so because she wanted to earn enough to feed her family. Since then, she has seen her life improve; especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family ever since. This year she decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers.

Irine’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 6.25 acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 7 solar lights."

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season

loans.name: Taiwo

texts.en: Mrs. Taiwo I. is 41 years old.  She is married and has one child. Taiwo lives in an urban area in the Edo State of Nigeria, and she owns a tailoring business. She completed two years of  training to learn how to sew clothes, and then she opened her own business. A loan will help Taiwo buy more material to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Mahmudov

texts.en: F. is a 52 year-old local resident of Beylagan town. He is trading fruit and vegetables in the market place. He has been engaged in this business since 2003. He has his own car to transport goods. Since the start of his business, he borrowed four loans from Normicro Beylagan branch, first $300, and finally $600. He used the loans to increase the stock of goods and expanding the business. Now he needs $700 for the same purpose.

loans.use: To increase the stock of inventories

loans.name: Aygun

texts.en: Aygun is an IDP from Jabrail district of Azerbaijan. She fled to Baku in 1993. She is married and has three children. She started her business in 2000, and borrowed four Normicro loans from Baku branch  totaling $2800. She would like to borrow $1100 to incrase the variety of good she can offer.

loans.use: To increase variety of goods

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria is 26 years old. She is married with 3 children and her husband works as a farmer. Maria makes blouses from blankets, which she embroiders and then sells to the wholesalers offering handicrafts in the city market. She is part of the group Cielo Azul 5 (Blue Heaven 5), together with Josefa Juarez Giron, and Rosa E. Mendez, who also make handicrafts. With the loan, they hope to buy more fabric, as well as thread for the embroidering.

MARIA, tiene 26 años, casada, 3 hijos, su esposo trabaja en el campo como agricultor, Ella se dedica a la artesanía confeccionando blusas de manta las cuales posteriormente borda y vende con los mayoristas que ofrecen artesanías en el mercado de la ciudad.Ella pertenece al grupo Cielo Azul 5 junto con doña Josefa Juárez Girón (artesana)Doña Rosa E. Méndez (artesana) Anastasia Díaz Gómez (artesana). Con el préstamo esperan invertir todas comprando más tela para la confección de sus artesanías y también hilos para bordar.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: Sales of handicrafts

loans.name: Jalal

texts.en: Jalal owns a small shop in a small village close to Baalback in the Bekaa. He has been a client of Majmoua for the past two years and has a good payment history. He invested the previous loans he received from Majmoua to increase the amount of goods available in his business.  Jalal is a hardworker who is financially responsible for his direct family members and some of his extended family. With the revenues from his business, he provides basic daily needs to more than 10 people. Jalal is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase a large quantity of gas bottles so he can sell these as a wholesaler. This will increase his earnings and help him financially care for those who depend on him.

loans.use: To purchase a large quantity of gas bottles for inventory for his retail shop

loans.name: Sigalu

texts.en: Sigalu is a mother of eight and she is forty-two years of age. She runs a flea market stall in town where she sells her products to make money. Her husband is working also, and she is doing her business to help him out in order to support their children’s education. She has a strong heart that will never fail because her business is backed up by her loan from the S.P.B.D. office. Sigalu earns a profit of 200 Tala ($80 US) a week from her sales, and from that she paid her loan and is able to support her family's financial needs.

loans.use: To buy inventory for her flea market stall

loans.name: Aotearoa

texts.en: Aotearoa is a mother of 37 years of age and has 5 children. She and her husband have worked on their plantation for years as their main source of income. She heard of SPBD through some women of the village, and she joined because this is the only door which has opened to help them to get financial support. This is Aotearoa's fifth loan with SPBD. With her loans, she has been able to help her family and develop her business.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her plantation

loans.name: Tohir

texts.ru:
Tohir E. is 61 years old, has a higher education, is a bio-chemist by profession, is married and has 3 children. Tohir works as a teacher in school #22 in Yavan as a chemistry and biology teacher. In addition, he raises and sells livestock. He has been involved in this business for 5 years.

Tohir will use his loan to purchase two young bulls to fatten and resell. Every 40-45 days he will sell the livestock and will use his revenues to purchase new bulls. Tohir will use profits from the sale of livestock to support his family as his teaching salary is low. This loan will provide him with a secondary source of income. Tohir will pay back the loan over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Эламонов Тохир, возраст – 61 год, образование высшее, по специальности химик – биолог, женат, имеет 3-х детей. Тохир в настоящее время работает учителем средней школы № 22 города Яван учителем по химиии и биологии. Помимо этого он также занимается разведением и продажей крупного рогатого скота. Этим видом деятельности он занимается уже в течение 5 лет. На полученный кредит он хочет приобрести два молодых бычка для откормки и продажи. Через каждые 40-45 он будет продавать скот, а на вырученные деньги приобретать опять молодых бычков. Полученную прибыль от продажи скота он будет использовать на содержание своей семьи, так как заработная плата получаемая в школе не слишком большая.Данный кредит даст ему возможность иметь дополнительный источник дохода. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase 2 calves

loans.name: Omolola

texts.en: Omolola A. is a fashion designer and also sells tailoring materials. She is 38 years old and a widow with two kids. She lives in Okoko, Lagos State, Nigeria. She needs a loan in the amount of $600 to enable her buy more tailoring materials to sell.

loans.use: To buy more tailoring materials to sell.

loans.name: Sey

texts.en:
Mrs. Sey P., 46, is married with four children. She works as a weaver and makes $2 a day of profit. Her husband has a business installing a music system whenever there is a celebration, party, or wedding in the village. On average, he earns around $4 a day of profit.

Three of their children are garment workers and the other is a student.

They will use this loan to renovate their house.

loans.use: They will use ths loan to renovate their house

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Mrs. Teresa Fernández Paco and her two children rent a home from her brother-in-law in the Fabril area of El Alto city. Teresa has a neighborhood store in this residence also. The loan will be used to construct walls around a recently purchased piece of land. This is the third time that she is seeking a loan and the socioeconomic analysis qualifies her favorably for this line of credit. The previous loans were channeled through Kiva and have been repaid in full.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Teresa Fernández Paco vive en casa en alquiler, de propiedad del esposo de su hermana, en la zona Fabril de la Ciudad de El Alto, con sus dos hijos. La señora Teresa tiene una tienda de barrio en su mismo domicilio. El crédito solicitado será destinado al amurallado de un terreno que adquirió recientemente. Esta es la tercera ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito. El crédito anterior fue canalizado a través de Kiva y ha sido pagado en su totalidad.

loans.use: Construct walls around recently purchased land.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchase of foodstuffs to replenish a small grocery store.

loans.name: Trinh Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Trinh Thi H. is 51 years old. She has one child who has already grown up. In 2001, she joined TYM FUND (Kiva Partner in Vietnam) and borrowed money to invest on her retail store. Mrs. H.'s first loans were very small, because she wanted to get used to the process and her business. Now, with more experiences and the store's good reputation, her business is very good and her income increases significantly. Mrs. H. was able to send her kid to school and buy more furniture for their house. Her husband is helping her with her store and farming. Mrs. H. wants to borrow 10 000 000 VND (625 USD) to buy more goods for her store and expand the store, in order to increase her family income. Her average monthly income is 3 000 000 VND (188 USD)

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Trịnh Thị Hòa năm nay 51 tuổi, gia đình chị có 1 con đã trưởng thành.Năm 2001 Chị tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư vào của hàng tạp hóa. Những vòng vốn đầu chị chỉ dám vay các mức vốn nhỏ để làm quen với công việc kinh doanh. Nay nhờ có kinh nghiệm, uy tín trong công việc kinh doanh nên của hàng của chị đã cho thu nhập ngày càng cao. Cũng nhờ có thu nhập từ công việc buôn bán hàng tạp hóa chị đã nuôi được con ăn học, trưởng thành và đã mua sắm thêm được các tiện nghi trong gia đình. Hiện nay chồng chị đang ở nhà để hỗ trợ chị trong công việc buôn bán, chăn nuôi. Vòng vốn này chị mong muốn được vay mức 10 triệu đồng để mua thêm hàng tạp hóa đầu tư mở rộng cửa hàng nhằm tăng thêm thu nhập cho gia đình. Thu nhập hiện nay : 3.000.000đ/ tháng

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Riskiniso

texts.en: Riskiniso U. is 36 years old. She’s married with four children. Because of  difficult family financial conditions, a year ago her husband  left for Russia to find work.. The difficult circumstances and hardships in Riskiniso's life made her recognize the value of work from a very young age. For about 5 years she has been purchasing  young cattle in the local market then fattening  and reselling them at the best price. Riskiniso is a very hard-working woman, and her diligence is incredible. She started this occupation because of the recommendation and teaching of her beloved father. Thanks to this activity she is supporting her children and ensuring that they receive a good  education. Riskiniso wants to keep educating them because she hopes that they’ll reach the goals that they have laid out for themselves. With this purpose she is requesting a loan of $400 for the term of 12 months to buy a calf in order to expand her business.

loans.use: Purchasing the small cattle in order to expand the business and to improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.name: Dang Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Đặng Thị Hòa 52 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 2006. Sống tại vùng nông thôn nên nghề nghiệp chính của gia đình chị là làm ruộng, để kinh tế gia đình được cải thiện hơn gia đình chị đã nghĩ đến việc chăn nuôi, tuy nhiện để việc chăn nuôi hiệu quả thì phải đầu tư vốn. Từ suy nghĩ như vậy chị đã quyết định tham gia Quỹ vay vốn, vòng vốn đầu tiên gia đình chị xin vay 3.000.000đ chị đã mua lợn bột và vịt đẻ trứng, với việc chăn nuôi như vậy hàng ngày chị đã có thu nhập từ vịt đẻ trứng, sau vài lứa lợn gia đình chị đã có thu nhập ổn định hơn và việc chăn nuôi của gia đình chị ngày càng quy mô. Hiện tại gia đình chị đang nuôi 9 con lợn thịt và 200 vịt đẻ trứng. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 9.000.000đ tiếp tục đầu tư vào chăn nuôi.
Thu nhập bình quân. 5.000.000đ/ tháng.
texts.en:
Mrs. Dang Thi H., aged 52, has participated in TYM Fund since 2006. As Mrs. H. and her family live in the countryside, the main source of income for them comes from farming. To enhance the family’s income, Mrs. H. considered raising poultries, but back then she didn’t have the capital to put her plan into practice. This motivated her to become a member of TYM Fund, from whom she would be able to request for loans. In the first round of loan, Mrs. H. asked for 3.000.000 VND, which she used to buy pigs, ducks and raised them. As a result, the family’s financial situation has been improved a lot. Mrs. H. is currently breeding 9 pigs for meat and 200 ducks for eggs. In this round, Mrs. H. would like to ask for 9.000.000 VND to invest in poultries. Her family’s monthly income is about 5.000.000 VND.


Translated from Vietnamese by KH. Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pigs

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en: Angelina Y. sells oil and other food items at Duakor which is a small town near Elmina. She also prepares gari (a popular food) for sale. Cassava is used for the preparation of gari. Angelina has received a senior high school education. She is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a security guard. Angelina has been selling gari, oil and other food items since 1985. She is responsible for helping in the payment of the children's school fees and other utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more gari and different kinds of cooking oil for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest for the expansion of her business.

loans.use: To buy more cassava for the gari production and different kinds of cooking oil for sale.

loans.name: Saul

texts.es: Saúl es un joven dedicado a la crianza de animales, con el fin de poder ayudar a sus padres en sus gastos, esta actividad no es desagradable para él, todo lo contrario,  la realiza con sumo gozo porque tiene gran aprecio y cariño a los animales, los cuida de la mejor manera.  Como todo joven tiene sueños que realizar, uno de ellos es incrementar la cantidad de animales, para con el tiempo venderlos en los mercados, especialmente en los días festivos. Por esta razón solicita un préstamo para la compra de un carnerito y así, en algo, aumentar sus animales y sus ingresos para fines de este año.
texts.en:
Saul is a young man who raises livestock as an end to a means to help his parents with their expenses. This isn't an unpleasant occupation for him, actual it is quite the contrary - he carries out his duties with an enormous pleasure and with great affection towards the animals, taking care of them the best way possible. Like every young person, he has dream that he wants to see materialized. One of them is to add to his livestock herd, so that with time he will be able to sell them in the markets, especially on holidays. He is requesting a loan for this reason. He wishes to purchase a calf to add to his herd of animals and to increase his income by the year's end./p>

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a calf to add to his herd.

loans.name: Naila

texts.en:
Naila was born in 1966. She and her husband (who is shown in the picture) have two children. Naila is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fuzuli town, settled in Fuzuli region, Dilagarda village.

This family has been in clothing sales business for five years. Now they need a loan of 800 AZN (US$1,000) to buy clothes for improving their clothing sales business.

loans.use: To buy additional inventory for clothing business.

loans.name: Sabit

texts.en:
Sabit A., an enthusiastic 22-year-old, operates his own food store in a small village in southern Azerbaijan, selling sugar, tea, cigarettes, gum and salt. In this business since 2006, he has become very experienced and now knows the best establishments from which to purchase his commodities at the best prices.

Sabit is now requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase more food inventory, and he thanks everyone for their help and support.

loans.use: To purchase candies, beverages and canned food.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Chea S. is a 68 year old resident of Kandal Province, where she owns and runs a small store selling various kinds of fruit. She currently earns an income of approximately of $5 a day, and has been in business since 2001. She is married with three children, all of whom are single and attend school. Her husband, 59, sells children's toys by bicycle. He normally sells at wedding parties and other ceremonies that are attended by many kids. To increase their income, S. would like to request a loan to purchase more fruit to sell and use the remainder for her husband's business. Her husband is shown in the photograph because she was not available.

loans.use: To purchase more fruit.

loans.name: Mijgona

texts.en:
Mijgona R. is 25 years old; she lives with her spouse and works every day, starting very early in the morning, so that she can get ahead and achieve her goal of having her 3 children successfully enter and finish school. Her business is located in the central market of Dushanbe city and she sells clothes for women. Thanks to the support of her spouse and her own effort she was able to expand her business, which began with little inventory and in a small space and now has a bigger space and a large clientele. With the loan of 3253 Somoni, which she will repay in 9 months, she will buy a greater variety of clothing styles, for a variety of occasions, and a few specific requests of her customers. Support this woman of much strength and courage to keep working.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing new clothing for women for re-sale

loans.name: Dios Verdadero 3 & 4 Group

texts.en:
Groups 3 and 4 of the Dios Verdadero (True God) Bank of Hope are on their second loan cycle. Ramon M. is the Group 3 Coordinator. He has 5 children ages 15, 18, 12, 8 and 4. Ramon owns a colmado, which is a small store where you can buy your daily food and other supplies. Ramon will purchase different products to sell in his colmado with this second loan. He thinks it's important to keep your business well stocked, so that you can meet your customers' demands and keep them happy. His biggest challenge is to work everyday to make a living, so he hopes to make good profits in his business so he can expand its current space.

Some of the other group members have the same type of store; others have smaller vegetable stands or sell a wide variety of products. In this picture, the group members are gathered at one of their homes. On behalf of Esperanza International, thank you for supporting these entrepreneurs!

loans.use: To purchase merchandise to restock business

loans.name: Angel

texts.es:
Ángel F. L. vive en casa propia, en la zona  de tembladerani, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz junto a su esposa, la señora Sandra Terán.
Ángel es empleado de la administración pública en esta ciudad y su esposa se dedica a las labores del hogar.
El crédito solicitado será para la construcción de una cocina en su vivienda, la misma que se encuentra solo en la fase de construcción de muros  y techo.
Esta es la segunda vez que solicitan préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califican favorablemente y pueden acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Ángel F. L. lives in his own home, in the Tembladerani neighborhood on the western side of the city of La Paz along with his wife, Mrs. Sandra Terán. Ángel is employed as a public administrator in the city and his wife is a homemaker. This loan will be used to build a kitchen in his home, which is currently in the beginning stages of construction and has only walls and a roof. This is the second time that he has requested a loan, and his credit report qualifies him to take out another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua O. is forty-five years old. He is married and has six children, two sons and four daughters. Some of his children are in the junior high and the basic school. Others have apprenticeships. His wife is a trader and he is also a commercial driver and trader. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in Mampong in the Ashanti Region of Ghana.

Joshua trades in food, such as maize, yams, etc. He buys bags of maize and tubers of yams from farmers in the nearby villages and then supplies the food to food vendors in his community. Joshua also distributes to retailers. At times, he also resorts to selling fruit, such as watermelon.

He has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to buy food in bulk so that he is able to supply to more customers. Joshua hopes to make more income so he can have his own apartment.

loans.use: To buy maize

loans.name: Ramota

texts.en: Ramota is 30 years old and she is married. She sells loaves of bread to make a living. She hopes for the loan in the amount of NGN50,000 (US$350) to purchase more loaves of bread to sell. She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more loaves of bread to sell.

loans.name: In's Group

texts.en:
This group of borrowers consists of three people. They all live in Banteay Dek Commune, in Phnom Penh City. The group leader is Mrs. In S.. She is 52 years old and makes a living selling various vegetable crops, such as tomatoes, cabbages, and cucumbers. She started the business ten years ago and currently earns approximately $3 per day. She is now a widowed mother of three single children who are working in different jobs. S. will use this loan to purchase different kinds of vegetables to sell.

The other two borrowers are E. and R.. E. is 42 years old and sells fresh fish in the market. She will use the loan to support a rice farming business. R. sells bananas in the market and she is applying for a loan to buy additional bananas to sell.

loans.use: To purchase different kinds of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Carla Carolina

texts.es:
Carla es socia del Banco Comunal Triunfo.
Carla es soltera, tiene 21 años y vive con sus padres, estudia industrias alimentarías en la universidad, Carla se dedica al procesamiento de cereales produciendo harinas, cereales partidos, sus productos los comercializa a clientes ya establecidos y a pedido.
Carla necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de kiwicha, maca, quinua y soya.
Carla sueña con implementar una molinera y ampliar sus mercados.
texts.en:
Carla is a member of the Triunfo (Triumph) Microfinance Institute.

Carla is a 21-year-old single woman who lives with her parents. She is studying Food Techonology at the university. Carla processes grains to make flour and cracked grains. She sells her products to her fixed clientele, as well as by order.

Carla needs a 1,000.00 PEN loan, which will be invested in purchasing kiwicha and maca (both South American plants), quinoa, and soy.

Carla dreams of setting up a mill and expanding her market.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase kiwicha, maca, quinoa and soy

loans.name: Aterei F Acham Monica Group

texts.en:
A. Monica is 28 years old and married with six children, all schooling. She has been making bricks, selling fish and groundnuts (peanuts) for over three years.

She is using the loan to purchase firewood for burning the bricks, to pay workers, and to buy smoked fish and groundnuts for sale. Through her business, she has obtained some poultry and her family’s standard of living is improving. Her future plan is to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase firewood for burning the bricks, to pay workers and to buy smoked fish and groundnuts to sell

loans.name: Evans Muhazi

texts.en: Evans Muhazi is a businessman who runs a retail shop which majors in household goods in Vihiga town. His clientele comes from Mbale market. Evans was introduced to KADET by an existing client at the time and took a first loan of Kshs 20,000 ($257). Evans is married with two children and his wife is currently helping him run the business. He has experienced growth in his business and plans to add more stock. With the new loan, he hopes to expand the business and thus increase revenue, and as a result improve the status of his family. About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of household items for his shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more chicks and medical equipment

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina is a forty-eight-year-old woman. She is married and the mother of four children who are all in school. She is a serious-minded businesswoman who works hard to support her husband in providing for her family.

Georgina owns and operates a grocery shop and a clothing store in the local market in her neighborhood. She sells grocery items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, body and hair creams, skimmed powdered milk, etc. She deems it an opportunity to expand her business and wants to use the loan to buy more bags of rice, bags of sugar and cartons of vegetable oil to increase her stock of goods available for sale.

Georgina hopes to increase her income by adding on the sale of cosmetics.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, bags of sugar and cartons of vegetable oil

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel A. deals in men’s attire (second hand clothing) near Elmina. Emmanuel has junior high school education.  He is single and has one chid. Emmanuel has been selling men’s attire since 1997. He is responsible for payment of the bills of his family. His loan will be used to buy more of the clothes he sells for sale. He hopes to reinvest his new profits into his business.

loans.use: His loan will be used to buy more of the clothes he sells for sale.

loans.name: Lualima

texts.en:
Lualima M., a 33-year-old woman living in the town of Vaiafai, is married and has four school-age children. To make a living, Lualima runs a general store selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in her community. Lualima has been in this business for over two years and earns approximately 200 WST a month.

In 2009, Lualima (0) joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Lualima is requesting a loan of 1000 WST which will be used to purchase products to sell. This loan will be Lualima's first loan from SPBD. Lualima plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Fofo

texts.fr: Cet homme a fini ses études à l’université mais il n’a pas eu la chance de trouver un emploi. Il est marié et est père de 03 enfants. Sa femme est une revendeuse dont les revenus n’arrivent plus à couvrir tous les besoins du foyer ; c’est pour cette raison qu’il a pris la décision en 2000 de se lancer dans le commerce de charbon de bois très souvent réservé aux femmes. Il exerce ce commerce dans le quartier de Saint-Joseph à Lomé. Cette activité lui permet désormais de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Il réalise de bonnes affaires ces temps-ci et est fier de cette activité génératrice de revenus. Il a besoin d’acheter de nouveaux sacs ; c’est pour cette raison qu’il sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 15 sacs de charbons de bois. Il compte sur sa bonne foi et sa meilleure connaissance de son marché pour rembourser le prêt dans les délais exigés.
texts.en:
This man finished his university studies but was not able to find a job. He is married and has three children. His wife is a retailer whose income is no longer able to cover the household expenses; it is for this reason that he decided in 2000 to start a business selling charcoal, something normally conducted by women. He runs this business in the Saint-Joseph district in Lomé. This business has allowed him to provide for his family. He enjoys good business these days and is proud of his income-generating activity. Currently, he needs to buy new bags; it is for this reason that he is seeking a loan through WAGES (one of Kiva's field partners) to buy 15 bags of charcoal. He is confident that his good faith and excellent knowledge of his market will allow him to repay this loan within the allotted time.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en: Along with her husband who is a fisherman and their five children ages 5 to 17, Mary Ann B., 44 years of age, lives in a town surrounded by plains covered in rice fields, enveloped by the crystal water of the sea that meets the foot of the mountains with wide tree plantations. Every morning, Mary Ann’s husband used to go fishing, while Mary Ann was left at home attending to the needs of their children and making herself busy doing household chores. When their children were still young, Mary Ann was content to only perform this role. However, now that all of their children are studying, she realizes that she has to exercise an economic role to augment the income of her husband. Therefore, in 2008 she joined ASHI and requested a loan which she used for starting up her own business. She bought cattle to fatten. After two loans, she realized that her profit from cattle fattening is double the capital, once it is sold after six months. Resources in their surroundings, especially during this season of rain, can provide enough food for the cattle she is raising. Now, she is requesting a much larger loan to buy more cattle for raising and to be able to increase her profit as well. In her business lies her capacity to send all of her children to college to better their future.

loans.use: To pay for cattle for a cattle fattening business

loans.name: Edencita

texts.en:
Edencita R. is from the village of Lugait, Misamis Oriental. She is 48 years old. Edencita is married and has 7 adult-aged children. To make a living, Edencita owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community. Edencita has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Edencita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Edencita is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Edencita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy rice

loans.name: Adith

texts.es:
La señora Adith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Santa Barbará II”, Distrito D. la Banda D. Shilcayo, Provincia D. San Martin, Departamento D. San Martín. Es casada, tiene 50 años y es madre D. 02 hijos, los dos ya independientes.

Lleva 05 años dedicándose a la venta D. Mercería. Se inicio con un capital D. S/. 700.00 y poco a poco, fue implementando mas su negocio. Es su esposo, quien se encarga D. salir por los pueblos aledaños, a ofrecer sus productos y nos cuenta que hoy en día le esta dando muy buenos resultados. Adith y su esposo, están muy contentos, por el logro que obtuvieron, gracias al Movimiento Manuela Ramos.

Ya es muy conocida por sus clientes en el barrio donD. vive y sus ventas diarias, quincenales y mensuales, son muy buenas. En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio ubicada en su misma casa, en un local muy bien acondicionado, para atender a sus clientes.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,500.00, comprará mercería, como: Cuadernos, libros, lápices, lapiceros, mochilas, así como zapatillas en variedad D. tallas, con modelos para damas, caballeros y niños. Adith, es una mujer con muchas ganas D. salir adelante para el bienestar D. su familia y D. ella misma. 

Manifiesta su más gentil agradecimiento al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer y apoyar a otras mujeres que también quieren salir adelante.
texts.en:
Adith, 50, is a member of the “Santa Barbará II" communal bank which is located in the Banda D. Shilcayo district, San Martín province, San Martín department. She is married and has two children, both of whom are now independent. For the last 5 years she has sold general merchandise. She began with an investment of 700 soles and little by little expanded her business. Her husband is the one who is charged with going to the nearby towns to sell her products and we are told that profits are good these days. She still operates her business from a well-equipped area in her home where she is visited by customers daily. With this 1500 sol loan she will buy merchandise such as: notebooks, books, pencils, mechanical pencils, bookbags, as well as sneakers in various sizes for women, men and children. Adith is a woman who very much wants to get ahead in life and to proviD. for the wellbeing of her family as well as for herself. She is is very grateful to Manuela Ramos Movement for allowing her to grow as a woman and as a businesswoman and for helping other woman who also want to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
Mario S. Sr. is from the village of Tamucco Sto. Niño Cagayan. He is 44 years old. Mario is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Mario operates a family member's business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting & harvesting corn for sale. Mario has been engaged in his business for over 20 years and earns approximately 50,000 Php during harvest season.

In 2008, Mario joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mario is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. This will be the second loan taken out by Mario from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of his children.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Chun

texts.en:
Chun S., 50, is married and lives with her three children in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia. To make a living, she sells groceries. She has operated this business since 2008 and is able to earn $2 per day.  Her husband is a driver for a private company.  He makes $5 per day.

Chun and her family members want to improve their standard of living and generate a better income.  She is asking for a loan of $500 to purchase more groceries to stock in her store. This is her first loan from CREDIT MFI.  In the future, she hopes to own a big store that sells more groceries.  She also wants to build a new nice house for her family.

loans.use: Buy more groceries to stock in her store.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr: Mariama S. est une veuve de 59 ans, mère de 4 enfants. Elle souhaite ce prêt pour renforcer son capital de vente de carburant. Les revenus générés lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mariama S. is a 59-year-old widow and the mother of four children. She would like a loan in order to strengthen her fuel-selling business. The revenue generated would allow her to improve the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Kelly Percival, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of fuel and various foodstuff

loans.name: Neva Linette

texts.es:
Neva Linette R. C. es una señora de 43 años de edad la cual vive con su madre y sus dos hijos en una comunidad llamada Coquital localizada en Los Chiles, provincia de Alajuela; está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona montañosa y por estar muy cerca de la frontera norte de nuestro país. Sus principales actividades económicas son la ganadería y la agricultura específicamente se da la siembra de granos básicos y  naranja.

Actualmente doña Neva tiene un negocio propio, empezó hace poco con un salón de belleza pero comenta que le va muy bien. Con el mantiene a su familia y cubre los gastos de su hogar dice que ella brinda un muy buen servicio y atención a sus clientes.

Agrega que le llena de motivación y orgullo el hecho de tener su propio negocio y ofrecer a su comunidad un servicio necesario, tomando en consideración que es una comunidad que no es muy céntrica y por lo que muchos habitantes  se ven en la necesidad de desplazarse hacia otros lugares para obtener ese servicio. Asegura que trabaja con mucho esmero, dedicación y disciplina y así puede ver como su negocio día con día crece.  

Doña  Neva requiere un préstamo de ¢658.000 (seiscientos cincuenta y ocho mil colones) para comprar una secadora, una plancha para cabello, un “lava cabezas”, y productos varios. Además de diferentes materiales de construcción para agrandar su local.

Ella forma parte de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Rapicrédito Progreso Futuro Coquital, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este es el primer crédito de doña Neva y con el espera crecer mas personalmente y profesionalmente como microempresaria.
texts.en:
Neva Linette R. C. is 43 years old. She lives with her mother and her two children in a community called Coquital located in Los Chiles, Alajuela province. This community is in a mountainous region very close to the northern border of our country. The main economic activities are raising cattle and agriculture, specifically basic grains and oranges. Neva has her own business. She opened a beauty salon recently and says it is going well. With the salon she supports her family and covers her living costs. She says that she provides her clients with very good service. She says that it motivates her and makes her proud to have her own business and to offer her community a necessary service - considering that her community is not very centrally located and many residents have to travel to other locations for this type of service. She says that she works with great care, dedication, and discipline and therefore can see her business grow daily. Neva requires a loan of 658.000 Colones to purchase a drier, a hair iron, a hair washing sink, and various products. She also will purchase construction materials to expand her shop. She is part of the Empresa de Crédito Comunal Rapicrédito Progreso Futuro Coquital, one of the 100 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This is her first loan, and she hopes to grow personally and professionally as a micro-entrepreneur.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of equipment and materials

loans.name: Zeinelabidine

texts.en:
ZeinElAbdidine is a 30-year-old married man with 2 children. 

In 2006, he decided to open a new business after seeing a need for such services in the region. He bought a big electric motor to provide the region with electricity. During this period, his business productivity was automatically developed. 

Today, ZeinElAbidine is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase additional cables to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase additional cables

loans.name: Maria Lourdes

texts.es: La señora María Lourdes es maestra desde hace 10 años tiene experiencia en esa labor, ella es trabajadora ella es campesina, su marido trabaja en el campo cosecha frijoles y lo vende en la zona y también para consumo propio ella esta solicitando el crédito para su hija ya que entra a la universidad y no cuenta con mucho dinero.
texts.en:
María Lourdes has been a teacher for 10 years; she is experienced in that occupation. She is a worker, she is a farmer. Her husband works in the fields growing beans which he sells in the area and for their own consumption. She is asking for funds for her daughter because she is about to enter the university and she does not have much money.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For her daughter's university expenses.

loans.name: Lauro Claudio

texts.es:
El Sr. Lauro nacio el 24 de julio de 1981 en Mojocolla Chuquisaca hace 8 años que vive y trabaja en en san luis El Torno ( El Torno es la cuarta sección municipal de la provincia Santi Ivañez, del Departamento de Santa Cruz. Está dividida en cuatro cantones con 65 comunidades campesinas.  De acuerdo al último censo realizado el año 2002, la población de El Torno alcanza a 40.000 habitantes.
Es una población joven, constituida por emigrantes venidos del interior del país: del occidente, quechuas, aymaras y de los valles del oriente, así como de las personas autóctonas.
Como característica de Santa Cruz, existen grandes diferencias sociales que conviven en un mismo espacio. Junto a grandes "quintas", propiedad de terratenientes y personas de mayor poder adquisitivo en Santa Cruz, conviven los propios habitantes de la zona, con construcciones mayormente sencillas (adobe y techo de motacú). Existe una diferencia entre las poblaciones de Santa Rita y Santa Marta 1 y Santa Marta 2, que se encuentran al borde de la carretera antigua a Cochabamba, donde se encuentran viviendas de ladrillo y teja junto a las más sencillas, y las poblaciones campesinas que se encuentran hacia el interior de la montaña, que son puramente de adobe y motacú, con condiciones mucho más sencillas, donde no llegan el agua y la luz.
Estas poblaciones se encuentran a una distancia de entre 5 y 20 kilómetros hacia el interior (en la zona pastoral que deben atender los voluntarios). Dicha zona pastoral está compuesta de 9 comunidades, a las que se accede por caminos de tierra por los que a veces pasan vagonetas para poder acceder a ellas.
La economía de la población se basa en la producción agropecuaria y frutícola, así como el trabajo de extracción de piedra, ripio y arena del río Piraí que circunda a todo el municipio. También existe una gran actividad de comercio, especialmente en la población de El Torno, donde se instala el mercado en que se venden los productos del trabajo campesino.

El Sr. Lauro primero trabajo en alquiler o al partido (trabaja para el dueño de la tierra y despues se parten la cosecha) saco un credito de EMPRENDER para comprarse 2 hectareas de tierra ahora el esta trabajando en su propia parcela y espera un credito  para seguir comprandoce mas parcelas de tierra osea 2 hectareas mas y asi poder sembrar Papa para luego ir a comercializar en el mercado de la zona, esta agradecido con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Lauro was born in Mojocolla Chuquisaca, on the 24th of July, 1981. He has been living and working in San Luis El Toro for the past eight years. (El Toro is the fourth section of Santi Ivañez province in the Santa Cruz department.) It’s divided into four areas with 65 rural communities. The last census in 2002 showed that the population of El Toro was 40,000. The population is young and includes many people who have relocated from other parts of the country. Many social differences exist in Santa Cruz. There are large luxurious homes collocated with homes of simple construction (adobe and thatch). There is a difference among the populations of Santa Rita and Santa Maria 1 and 2, located along the ancient Cochabamba road, where there are brick and fabric homes located alongside simpler homes. The people living more into the mountain have simpler adobe homes with no running water or electricity. These people are located between 5 and 20 kilometers to the interior (in the pastoral zone that must be serviced by volunteers). This zone consists of nine communities, accessible via dirt roads. Wagons sometimes pass through. The economy of the region is agriculture based, as well as on stone and river sand extraction from the Pirai river, which encircles the entire town. There is also a large business activity, especially in El Torno, where the rural population’s products are sold. Lauro first worked as a sharecropper (he worked for the owner of the land and then splits the harverst with him). He got a loan through EMPRENDER so that he could buy two hetaeras of land which he is now working. He is asking for this loan in order to buy 2 more hectares of land and be able to raise potatoes to later sell in the market. He is grateful to EMPRENDER and Kiva for trusting in him and for granting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Farmland

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria P. is 73 and widowed with 10 children (ages 20 - 50).  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting taamu for sale.  Maria has 4 years of experience in this business.  Maria needs a loan of WST $1750 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 280 talas or US $117 per week) to financially support immediate members of her family.

In 2008, Maria joined SPBD.    This is her 3rd loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Maria's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Aissatou

texts.fr: Madame Aissatou F. habite à Ouakam. Elle est sociétaire de la caisse depuis 10 ans. Elle est parent bénéficiaire et évolue dans le commerce de poissons depuis plus de 20 ans. Elle est soutient de famille et a commence  à gagner sa vie  par l’activité de lingère. Et c’est par ce canal qu’une de ses amies lui a suggéré de découvrir la vente de poissons. Madame F. sollicite un crédit de 150 000 frs dans le but d’augmenter  son offre de  produits  pour  ainsi satisfaire sa clientèle. Elle  a déjà bénéficié de 5 prêts antérieurs. Et ces crédits lui permettent d’avancer socialement, d’auto financer son activité et d’aider ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mrs Aissatou F. lives in Ouakam and has been a member of the microcredit association for 10 years.
