She has been working in the fish trade for over 20 years, and also works as a laundry maid in order to earn a living to support her family. It was through this trade that a friend of hers suggested she considered the fish trade. Mrs F. is seeking a 150 000 FRS loan in order to expand her product range to satisfy her customers' demands. She has already received 5 loan and these have allowed her to progress socially, to finance her business and support her children.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: increasing base business funds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Basilia

texts.es:
Basilia es una madre de familia de 45 años de edad que vive junto a su hijo de quince años en el distrito de Cura Mori, de la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nombre. Está ubicado a tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la venta de chicha y de carne de carnero desde hace dos años, ella misma cría los animales que vende, y también prepara la chicha a base de harina de maíz y azúcar. La chicha es una bebida típica del país que viene siendo consumida por nuestros antepasados desde tiempos ancestrales, los pobladores de las zonas rurales del país creen que brinda energías para el trabajo y también la consumen en celebraciones especiales.

Ambos negocios se complementan ya que muchas veces los clientes le piden que prepare algun plato tipico a base de carnero (seco de cabrito con frejoles, por ejemplo) para acompañarlo con chicha, el buen trato de Basilia le ha hecho conocida en la zona y ya cuenta con una clientela fija que siempre acude a su vivienda para adquirir los productos que ofrece.

Basilia desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de harina de maíz para elaborar mas chicha y también en la compra de alimento para mejorar la calidad de sus animales. Por este motivo ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo de modo que pueda incrementar sus ventas y obtener mayores ingresos.

Ella es una mujer alegre y responsable, en la zona donde vive, sus clientes y vecinos le consideran una mujer honrada y trabajadora.
texts.en:
Basilia, 45, lives with her 15-year-old son in Cura Mori district, Piura province, Piura region. It’s located three hours from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region’s capital. For the last two years she has sold chicha (alcoholic beverage made from fermented corn) and mutton; she raises the animals herself and prepares the chicha based on corn flour and sugar. Chicha is a typical beverage of the country that has been consumed by our ancestors since ancient times. Residents of rural areas of the country believe that it provides energy for work and they also consume it on special occasions. Both businesses complement each other because often customers ask her to prepare a typical, mutton-based dish (seco de cabrito with beans, for example) to enjoy with the chicha. Basilia’s good customer service has made her well-known in the area and she can count on her regular customers to come by her home to acquire her products. Basilia wants to buy more corn flour to increase her chicha production as well as buy feed to improve the quality of her animals. For this reason, she is asking Edpyme Alternativa for her first loan in the amount of 500 new soles that will help her reach this goal in order to increase sales and thus obtain higher profits. She is a cheerful and responsible woman. Where she lives, her customers and neighbors consider her to be an honest and hard-working woman.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn flour to expand chicha (alcoholic beverage made from fermented corn) production and sales.

loans.name: Angela Karina

texts.es:
Ángela de 21 años, vive en una zona periurbana en el Fortín (calles de tierra y casas de caña) de Guayaquil, su casa es de caña y solo cuenta con luz como servicio básico. Por la edad que ella tiene no se le han presentado oportunidades de trabajar por eso ella invirtió dinero en vivieres para una pequeña tienda y la ubico en su casa con ayuda de su mama. 

Por esa buena decisión ahora ella tiene una pequeña tienda en su casa vende arroz, bebidas y especies para comida. Trabaja desde las 07h00 hasta las 21h00pm todos los días con ayuda de su mama. Para poder incrementar su negocio ella quiere comprar con el préstamo arroz, aceites, azúcar. 

En el futuro quiere tener un minimarket y continuar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Ángela is 21 years old and lives in the periurban area of Fortín (where there are dirt roads and houses made of reeds) in Guayaquil. Her house is made of reeds and receives electricity as its only basic service. Because of her age Ángela has not been presented with work opportunities, so she invested her money in groceries and opened a small store in her home with the help of her mother.

This turned out to be a good decision because she now has a small store in her house where she sells rice, beverages, and food spices. She works from 7am until 10pm every day with the help of her mother. In order to expand her business, she wants to use her loan to buy rice, oil, and sugar.

In the future, she wants to open a minimarket and continue her studies.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, oil, and sugar

loans.name: Sherlita

texts.en:
Sherlita S. is from the village of Banga, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 50 years old. Sherlita is married and has 8 adult children. To make a living, Sherlita owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Sherlita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Sherlita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Sherlita is requesting a  loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Sherlita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of the family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Emiliana

texts.en:
Emiliana D. is from the village of Daanglungsod, Katipunan. She is 62 years old, is married and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Emiliana owns and operates a business venture in the services sector operating a tailoring business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing general alteration and tailoring services to local community members. Emiliana has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP per month for these activities.

In 2007, Emiliana joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Emiliana has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional fabrics and materials. Emiliana is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be the 8th loan taken out by Emiliana from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory.

loans.name: Anvar

texts.ru:
Anvar agayevu 22 qoda. On ne jinat i jivet so svoyey semyoy  v qorede Baku. On uchitsya v universitete v zaochnom fakultete bioloqii. Etobu biznesu on nauchilsya u svoyeqo papai i poetomu postupil na biloqa.On ochen lubit rasteniya i lubit uxajivat za nimi polevat ix rezat otrastki. 

Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chto bi kupit sajenci novix cvetov kotorix u neqo net i kotorix net v Baku.Tak je on v budushem xotelbi imet bolshe mesta dlya toqo chtob xranit eti rasteniya.
texts.en:
Anvar A. is 22 year old. He is not married and lives with his family in the city of Baku. He is studying at the university in the extramural biology department. He learned this business from his father and this is why he wants to be a biologist. He loves plants and loves taking care of them, to water and trim them. At this time he needs 2000 AZN to buy seedlings of flowers which do not grow in Baku. In the future he also wants to have more space so he can preserve these plants.

Translated from Russian by Elena Bortnikoff, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy flower seedlings

loans.name: Badegan Iii Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Badegna III sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, 3 enfants et  vivant dans des familles polygames à Maban, un des villages de la préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. 
Les spéculations cultivées  par ce groupe sont le petit mil, l’arachide, le fonio et le haricot. Elles sont à leur sixième prêt de campagne et tous les prêts précédents ont été bien remboursés.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, AWA LASSENI D. compte acheter les intrants, les petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1, 3 hectare de petit mil et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Dioïla après les récoltes à une clientèle composée essentiellement de revendeurs.
 Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 50.000FCFA environ par campagne.
texts.en:
The members of the Badegna III group are married women with an average age of 40 and an average of three children. They live in polygamous families in Maban, a village in the Dioïla prefecture in the Koulikoro region (2nd administrative region of Mali). They are working with the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of better organizing their activities in the beginning of the rainy season. The crops grown by this group include pearl millet, peanuts, millet, and beans. They are on their sixth loan, and all previous loans have been fully repaid. With this new loan, Awa Lasseni Dembélé plans to buy fertilizers and small farming equipment and to pay for labor costs to maintain about 1.3 hectares of pearl millet and peanuts. Their crops are sold in the city of Dioïla after harvest to a clientele made up mostly of resellers. They expect to make an average profit of 50,000FCFA per planting season.

Translated from French by Rachel Braff, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Plowing, fertilizers, and small farming equipment

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MI PERU”; el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Santiago, provincia y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Victoria; ella tiene 42 años de edad y es madre soltera y es natural de Apurimac,  ella tiene 1 hijo; la socia es enfermera de proefesión y alterna sus actividades con el comercio minorista, la socia de vez en cuando trae ropa de la ciudad de Lima y los vende a pedido, ella también suele traer zapatos calados como 4 pares a lo mucho y si le piden sus compañeras de trabajo ella envía el dinero y le envían cuando ella no puede viajar. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la mercadería.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “Mi Perú” comnumal bank. The bank is located in the district of Santiago, in the province and department of Cusco. The member is Victoria. She is 42 years old, is a single mother, and is originally from Apurimac. She has one son. She is a nurse by profession and alternates her activities with sales. She occasionally brings clothing from the city of Lima and sells it to people who have requested it. She also brings sandals, usually 4 pairs at the most. If her work companions request it of her, she also sends the money [for the clothing or sandals to her contacts in Lima] and they send [the merchandise] to her when she can’t travel. She is requesting the loan to buy merchandise. She is grateful to the people who are part of her dream through this program. She promises to make her payments in the established timeframe.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing and sandals

loans.name: Ilyne

texts.en:
Ilyne S. is from the village of Culing Centro, Cabatuan, Isabela. She is 48 years old and widowed with one child. To make a living, Ilyne plans to start a business growing vegetables to sell. Ilyne joined ASKI in 2007 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ilyne has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6000 PHP from ASKI, and now requests a 8000 PHP loan to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Los Arbolitos (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
En las Acacias en la vía a Santa Ana en la ciudad de  Portoviejo, capital manabita conocida por su gente honesta y trabajadora, cada 15 días se reúne el Banco Comunal Los Arbolitos.
Ellas se dedican a diferentes actividades tales como, (comercio, ventas, producción y  servicios,) este es el tercer ciclo en el banco y están muy a gusto ya que gracias a la Fundación Espoir han logrado sacar sus negocios adelante.

Aquí conocimos a la señora Aracely, tiene 29 años y mantiene una relación de unión libre hace 16 años de la cual tiene 4 hijos, dos de los cuales estudian en colegio y dos en escuela lo que representa una dura carga económica, su marido es maestro pintor.
 
Ella para ayudar a su marido en los gastos del hogar decidió empezar un negocio de ventas de sabanas y productos de Esika (productos de belleza y perfumería), trabaja de lunes a sábados desde las 8h30 hasta las 11h30 y de 14h00 a 16h00,  su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y también vende bajo pedido más que todo en los productos de Esika que se los realiza de acuerdo a lo que sus clientes le pidan, las sabanas las va a comprar  una vez al mes a Guayaquil aunque  a veces también hace pedidos por docenas que se los entregan en su casa.

Este crédito lo va a ocupar en comprar sabanas ya que tiene algunos pedidos y quiere cumplir con todos ellos.

Sus sueños son construir su casa ya que donde viven es alquilado.
texts.en:
In the Acacias, on the road to Santa Ana, in the city of Portoviejo, which is known for its honest and hardworking people, the Saplings Community Bank meets every 15 days.  

The women dedicate themselves to different activities, such as business, sales, production, and services.  This is the third loan cycle for the bank and they are very happy and thankful to the Espoir Foundation that they have succeeded in improving their businesses.

Aracely is 29 years old and has been married for 16 years.  She has four children.  Two of them are in high school, and two in lower school, which is difficult economically.  Her husband is a master painter.

In order to help her husband with household expenses, she decided to start a business selling sheets and Esika cosmetics.  She works from Monday to Saturday from 8:30am to 11:30am and from 2:00pm to 4:00pm.  She sells door to door and by request, mostly for Esika products, because she has to order what her customers want.  She buys sheets once a month in Guayaquil, but sometimes orders them by the dozen.

She will use this loan to purchase sheets since she already has some orders placed and wants to be able to fill all of them.

Her dream is to build a house, because where she lives now is rented.

loans.use: Purchase sheets

loans.name: Bakusekamajja Development Group-Mukono

texts.en:
Godfrey K. is a resolute, hard-working, and strong-willed 48-year-old businessman who belongs to Bakusekamajja group-Mukono. For 6 years, he has operated a fish-selling business. He explains that it has been a worthwhile endeavor in terms of providing wealth and support for his family and extricating himself out of a life of poverty. In a week this married father of 4 typically earns 60,000 shillings.

He is now requesting a loan to purchase more fish for resale purposes.

loans.use: To expand and improve his business by purchasing additional fish

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah B. is 46 years old and lives in the town of Makindye, in the Kampala south region of Uganda. She is married and has 5 children. Two of her children are currently in school. Sarah has a business of a craft shop, which she has had for 8 years. 

To help expand her business, Sarah has requested a loan of 2000.000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more craft materials.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Sarah hopes to generate greater profits and sometimes buy food. In the future, Sarah hopes to expand more in her arts and crafts business.

loans.use: To purchase more craft materials.

loans.name: Petrona Alejandrina

texts.es: Doña Petrona Alejandrina, tiene 28 años de edad, ama de casa, tiene 4 hijas, ella se dedica a la tejeduria,  tejido de cortes típicos de alta seda,con este trabajo ha logrado sostener a su familia, ya que tres de sus hijas estan estudiando, y ella cubre sus gastos y como tambien el sustento diario familiar. Solicita un crédito para ampliar el capital de trabajo y asi comprar materia prima en este caso mas hijo para la produccón de tejido. Quiere ver un negocio prospero, por lo que no duda en hacer esta inversión.
texts.en: Petrona Alejandrina is a 28-year old housewife with four daughters. She is a weaver who makes typical designs from high quality silk. She has been able to support her family with this job. Three of her daughters are already studying and she covers the daily costs of the family. She is applying for a loan to purchase more thread for her weaving. She wants to see her business prosper, which is why she has no doubt in making this investment.

loans.use: Capital de trabajo

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María es socia del  Banco Comunal “San Salvador”, ubicado en el distrito D. Capachica, provincia D. Puno, Departamento D. Puno, tiene 74 años D. edad,  estado civil casada, con seis hijos y grado D. instrucción analfabeta.
Su actividad consiste en la venta D. queso, quinua y huevo, en las diferentes ferias del lugar y en Arequipa. Ella viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace diez años, el primer préstamo solicitado que fue D. S/.300. 00 nuevo soles, le permitió iniciar con su negocio.
Ahora solicitara un nuevo préstamo D. S/ 1200.00 nuevos soles, préstamo que le permitirá incrementar el capital D. su negocio. 
Su sueño  es seguir con su negocio.
Lo  que le gusta del Banco Comunal  son todas las actividades que se realiza en la reunión.
texts.en:
María is a member of the “San Salvador” community bank which is located in Capachica district, in Puno province, in Puno department.  She is 74 years old, married, and has six children.  She is illiterate.

María's business activity is selling cheese, quinoa and eggs in the different local markets and in Arequipa.  She has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for ten years.  Her first loan was for 300 nuevos soles which allowed her to set up her business.

She is now requesting a new loan for 1,200 nuevos soles which will allow her to increase her business capital.

Her dream is to continue with her business.

What she most likes about her community bank are the activities which take place in the meetings.

loans.use: To increase her business capital

loans.name: Jose Felix

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “UNIDOS PARA EL TRIUNFO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Jose; el tiene 53 años de edad y es soltero; el socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de fabricación de velas,el socio lleva años en este negocio siendo esta la única actividad que realiza por el momento,el socio se siente contento con su negocio y se prepara para fabricar mas velas ya que se acerca las fiestas navideñas.

El socio solicita el préstamo para la compra de materia prima como (parafina)  para la fabricación de velas.

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
José, 53, is a member of the “UNIDOS PARA EL TRIUNFO” (United for Success) communal bank which is located in Cusco district which is part of Cusco province, Cusco department.

He is single.  He alternates his daily chores with candle making.  He has been in this business for years and it’s the only activity he’s involved with at present.  He is happy with his business and is getting ready to make more candles because the Christmas season is approaching.

He is asking for the loan to buy candle making raw materials like paraffin.

He thanks those people who share his dream and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy candle making raw materials like paraffin.

loans.name: Liz

texts.es:
La señorita Liz Z. de 22 años de edad, soltera, no tiene hijos, cuenta con un  copetín en su domicilio, conocido en la zona. Empezó hace mas de 1 año con la ayuda de su madre, la misma se encarga del copetín  a las noche puesto que el negocio queda al costado de una cancha de futbol.
Solicito dicho préstamo a Fundación Paraguaya para la  compra de más mercaderías como harina, huevo, carne, leche, gaseosas, jugos, cervezas, etc. para la elaboración de las comidas y también para aumentar su stock. 
Liz al retirarse agradeció la ayuda a la fundación paraguaya y a Kiva por el apoyo ofrecido ya que gracias a eso podrá seguir dando a sus clientes alimentos de buena calidad y al mejor precio, también bebidas y golosinas.
texts.en:
Liz Z. is 22 years old, single and doesn't have any children.  She has a small restaurant in her home which is well known in her area.  She started her business more than one year ago with the help of her mother.  She takes care of the restaurant at night since the business is located next to a soccer field.

She is requesting this loan from Fundación Paraguaya to buy more merchandise such as flour, eggs, meat, milk, soda, juice, beer, etc. so that she can make her meals and also increase her stock.

As she was leaving our offices, Liz thanked Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for the support she is receiving since it will help her to continue in her business, providing her customers with good quality food at a good price.  She also provides drinks and sweet treats.

loans.use: To buy flour, eggs, meat, milk, soda, etc.

loans.name: Madeline Jissell

texts.es:
Madeline de 25 años de edad, casada madre de un hijo. Labora como analista de unidad técnica coordinadora de proyectos en una empresa privada.
Teniendo el apoyo de su esposo que trabaja en publicidad. Juntos han logrado tener su casa y como objetivo es ir mejorando. Con este préstamo lograra poner cerámica en toda su casa, ya que el piso está muy viejo y parte quebrada.
Para esto comprara cerámica, cemento bond, porcelana, separadores para poner en ciento veinte metros cuadrados de su vivienda. Lo que está contenta por este cambio y por el apoyo financiero a plazo que brinda Afodenic.
texts.en: Madeline is 25 years old, married and has one child.  She works as a technical unit analyst - project coordinator in a private company.  She has the support of her husband who works in advertising.  Together they have managed to obtain their own home and their aim is to gradually improve it.  They will use this loan to put down tiles throughout their home since the floor is very old and broken in places.  For this work they will buy tiles, cement, porcelain and separators so that they can lay down twenty square meters in their home.  Madeline is happy to be making this change and happy with the financial support she is receiving through this loan from Afodenic.

loans.use: To put down tiles throughout her home, managing to make this improvement since the floor is very old and broken in places.

loans.name: Fuente De Paz 9 Group

texts.en:
Jesemena is a coordinator for the group Fuente de Paz 9 in El Seybo. She has five children and her husband. Jesemena operates a bakery, where she sells baked food, especially bread; most of her customers are from nearby areas. She is applying for her 8th loan from Esperanza. With her new loan she wants to increase her business even more, by buying goods like flour, oil, gas and charcoal for the oven, and other items.

Jesemena hopes that she will one day be able to buy a nice house to live in. She is also very preoccupied about the future of her children; one of her biggest challenges in life is give them what they need to become professionals, educated citizens. She will use her business profits to save and invest in her business, because she is dreaming of changing her family's life in the short term, God willing!

loans.use: to buy goods for bakery

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna P. is a married woman who lives in Dungga, Danao City, Cebu. She earns her living by operating a general store. Her husband Roel P., who is 35 years old, works as a laborer to earn his living. They have two children, who are five and 14 years old. Lorna joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2009 because she aspired to something better for her family. With the help of her past three loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Lorna has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 7,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 7,000, improving the family's standard of living. This time, for her fourth loan, she is borrowing PHP 10,000, which she intends to use to buy more stock for her general store so that she can continue to save up for her future education and the improvement of her business. Lorna P. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon -- a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Nhor

texts.en: Nhor K., 28, is married and lives with her two children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia – an area known for its rubber plantations. K. and her husband sell food, earning $10 US per day. Each month, the family has to spend $85 US on food and $40 US on other expenses. K. is requesting a loan of $1000 US to purchase more food to resell. In the future, she would like to use additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy more food to resell

loans.name: Walter Marcelino

texts.es:
Walter, es originario de Palacaguina una pequeña  comarca del Departamento de Madriz , tiene 30 años de edad , es soltero ,  de oficio         ,tiene un hijo de 9 años el cual esta estudiando cuarto grado de primaria, lleva 5 años trabajando  el área de elaboración de puertas y ventanas de vidrio y aluminio .
Empezó en esta actividad al salir de su quinto año de la secundaria, debido a que  no tenia como pagar una carrera universitaria , tuvo que salir de Palacaguina en busca de trabajo y se fue a Estelí ,estando ahí y con ayuda de un primo logro aprender  a trabajar en un taller de vidrio y aluminio donde empezó como ayudante , a los tres años de estar en ese taller logro especializarse hasta ser el que entrenaba a otros jóvenes y adquirió mas pedidos de puertas y ventanas de vidrio al cumplir 5 años en ese taller decidió independizarse y comenzó a trabajar por si solo .  Poco a poco fue comprando herramientas de trabajo gracias a los pedidos que recibía. En este negocio solo el lo atiende cuando tiene pedidos grandes busca ayudantes para que lo ayuden a cumplir con lo pedidos que le llegan así también el mismo sale fuera de su comarca en busca de nuevos clientes. 
Solicita el crédito para compra de materia prima como aluminio, tornillo de cabezal y herramientas de trabajo. Pues le ayudaría a facilitar su trabajo en cuanto entrega de pedidos, a darle un mejor acabado a las puertas y ventanas que haces así mismo hacer nuevos clientes.
Tiene como planes futuros poder tener su propio local y ambientarlo con buenas y modernas herramientas de trabajo y poder contratar personas fijas. 
Dentro de su metas próximas esta adquirir suficientes materiales de trabajo para sacar pedidos grandes que le salgan, tener una cuenta de ahorro donde asegure una buena educación para su hijo, ya que el no pudo estudiar pero su hijo tiene la fe que el si lo lograra, también le gustaría tener su vehículo donde pueda transportar su pedidos y herramientas de trabajo para agilizarlos mas rápidamente.
texts.en:
Walter is originally from Palacaguina, a small region in the Department of Madriz. He is 30 years old, single, employed, and has a 9 year old son who is in the fourth grade. For the past five years, Walter has been making doors and windows out of glass and aluminum.

Walter started working in this trade after he completed his fifth year of secondary school since he had no other way of paying for a university degree. He left Palacaguina to find work and went to Estelí. A cousin helped him out by offering him an apprenticeship at a glass and aluminum workshop where he started out as an assistant. Three years later, he was able to teach other young people since there were more orders for doors and windows. Once he worked five years at the workshop, Walter decided to become independent and start working alone. Over time he was able to buy tools with the income from the orders he received. Whenever he receives large orders, Walter will find assistants to help him complete the work. He also travels outside of the region to look for new customers.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy materials such as aluminum, screws, and tools for his job. This will help facilitate his work so that he can complete his orders and provide better quality finishes to the doors and windows that he produces. As a result, he will be able to attract new customers. Walter has future plans to open his own shop and furnish it with modern equipment of high quality, as well as hire permanent employees.

His immediate goals are to acquire sufficient materials to complete the large orders he has received. Walter has money saved up to secure a good education for his son since he was not able to continue his own education. He has faith that his son will be able to accomplish this. In addition, Walter would like to have a vehicle to help him deliver orders and transport equipment more quickly.

loans.use: To purchase materials and tools for making windows and doors.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es: Julio tiene 48 años, es casado y vive al lado de su esposa y sus 2 hijos en una casa heredada por sus padres. Desde hace 15 años se dedica a la agricultura y a la crianza de animales menores, dispone de amplio espacio libre, lugar que aprovechó para construir su granja de cuyes, desde entonces atiende todos los días a sus animales, asimismo posee extensas tierras donde cultiva y cosecha alfalfa, siendo estos derivados como forraje para sus animales, y lo que le sobra es comercializado. Por otro lado su esposa la ayuda en cuidar los demás productos que tiene cultivados, como es el caso de la papa, maíz  quinua y verduras. Considera que su granja de animales es rentable porque tiene contactos de personas que le aseguran la compra frecuencia de estos animales, además  de que le agrada desarrollar esta actividad ya que le permiten mejorar un poco más su calidad de vida y siempre esta en búsqueda de ver que cultivos son más rentables y recuperar lo invertido en cada campaña de siembra. Este es su tercer crédito en MFP y considera que ser parte de su banco comunal ha suido una grata experiencia  porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce  hace años y son sus propios vecinos  y que siente por ellos un aprecio sincero por lo que ha decidió seguir trabajando mas tiempo en su grupo. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono y también en  la compra de madera para mejorar la infraestructura de su granja de cuyes.
texts.en: Julio is 48 years old, is married and lives with his wife and his two children in a house that he inherited from his parents. For the past fifteen years he has been working in agriculture and in the raising of young animals. He has a lot of land, which he has used to build a guinea pig farm. He cares for his animals everyday. He also has extensive lands that he uses to raise and harvest alfalfa. Alfalfa provides feed for his animals. The extra alfalfa he sells. His wife helps him care for the other products that he grows, which include potatoes, corn, quinoa, and vegetables. He considers his animal farm profitable, as he has contact with buyers that frequently buy his animals. Nevertheless, he would like to develop this activity as it allows him to improve his quality of life. He is always looking to see which crop is profitable, as he wants to recoup the cost of each harvest season. This is his third loan with MFP and he feels that his membership in this community bank has been a good experience as all of the members are people that he has known for years and they are his neighbors. He is grateful that they have continued to work together in this group. With this loan that he is requesting, he will buy bags of fertilizer and also wood to make a better structure for his guinea pig farm.

loans.use: to buy bags of fertilizer and wood to be used to improve the infrastructure of his guinea pig farm

loans.name: Christian

texts.es:
Christian nació en la ciudad de Paruro del departamento del Cusco y tiene 38 años de edad. Actualmente, Christian vive en la ciudad del Cusco donde hay hermosos casas y calles históricas donde antes vivieron los Incas, él es una persona trabajadora que saca adelante a sus dos hijos, él trabaja en una agencia de viajes de turismo como guía de turismo. Ya son 15 años que trabaja en la agencia y le ha ido muy bien. Christian en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para abrir una tienda de abarrotes para que pueda a tender su esposa entonces compraran productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, fideos, leche, aceite y otras cosas más.
   
Christian es una persona responsable que pertenece al banco comunal “Puntualito” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú.
texts.en:
Christian is 38 years old and was born in the city of Paruro, located in the Department of Cusco. He lives in Cusco where there are beautiful historic houses and streets where the Inca used to live. He is a hardworking person who gets his two children ahead in life. He has worked for a travel agency as a tour guide for fifteen years and it has done very well.

Right now, Christian needs a loan to open a grocery store for his wife to manage. As a result, they will buy basic needs items like rice, sugar, pasta, milk, oil, and other items.

Christian is a responsible person who is a member of Puntualito Communal Bank, part of Cusco branch of Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to buy basic needs items like rice, sugar, pasta, milk, oil, etc.

loans.name: Grey Del Rocío

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Dulce Amistad. Este lugar se lo conoce por los deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país. Su gente es muy cálida, amable y trabajadora.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Grey, tiene 39 años, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos de 21, 18, 16 y 11 años de edad, estudian dos de ellos en Universidad, uno en colegio y otro en escuela. Su esposo es chofer.

Es un ama de casa que se dedica a la venta sandalias, agua en bidón y  productos Avon (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas). Ella tiene un pequeño local en su casa donde vende todos sus productos aunque a veces también sale a hacer sus recorridos, trabaja todos los días desde las 8h30 hasta las 17h00 y lleva 6 años dedicada a esta actividad.
 
Este crédito es para comprar sandalias, perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos y cremas. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 4 ciclos y le gusta por la ayuda que recibe con los créditos.
 
Su sueño es tener una farmacia.
texts.en:
The “Dulce Amistad” (Sweet Friendship) Communal Bank meets every two weeks in the Rocafuerte canton.  This place is known for its delicious sweets that the villagers make, which are recognized throughout the entire country.  The people there are very warm, kind, and hard-working.

This is the place where we meet Grey, age 39.  She is married and has four children; ages 21, 18, 16, and 11.  Two of them attend the university, one is in high school, and the other attends primary school.  Her husband is a driver.

She is a housewife who sells sandals, toilet water, and Avon products (beauty products like cosmetics, perfume, and women’s accessories).  She has a small place in her house where she sells all of her products.  Sometimes she also leaves to make her deliveries.  She works every day from 8:30 a.m. until 5:00 p.m.  She has been engaged in this business activity for six years.

This loan is to buy sandals, perfume, costume jewelry, cosmetics, and creams.  She has been in the communal bank for four cycles.  She likes it for the help she receives with the loans.

Her dream is to have a pharmacy.

loans.use: to buy sandals, perfume, costume jewelry, cosmetics, and creams

loans.name: Talitakumi

texts.en:
Talitakumi is 38 years of age, married and has six children. Talitakumi owns & operates a business selling baked goods in the local community. She has 1 year of experience in this business. Talitakumi needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase new items to expand product offering. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 350 talas or US $146 per week) to improve and expand her business.

In 2011, Talitakumi joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Talitakumi's 1st loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand the product offering.

loans.name: Maweza Group

texts.en:
Richard, who is in his mid 60s, is married and has five grown children. Only one is still schooling. 

He has a general store that he has been running for five years now. He works from 9:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Richard's second motisha loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. A motisha loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania that allows borrowers with good credit ratings to pay back their original loans faster and receive extra money before their original loan term has ended. He used the previous loan to fill in the missing stock at the store and has paid back his loan successfully. He wishes for a loan to increase the general store inventory. His dream is to one day open another general store.

Richard will share this loan with his loan group, "Mawela," which has a total of six members. They will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture, Richard is first on the left in the first row.

loans.use: To increase shop inventory.

loans.name: Immaculee

texts.en: Immaculee is 50 years old. She has 7 children who are aged 21-30 years old. Her husband is a farmer and sells items in the market. She sells food items such as cassava, sweet potatoes, irish potatoes, yams, etc. This business has enabled her to pay school fees and to feed her family. She is requesting a loan to buy more food and to fill her store in order to make more profits. With the profits she plans to make some savings.

loans.use: to purchase food stuffs.

loans.name: Mafi

texts.en:
Mafi is 44 years of age and married with four children. Mafi owns & operates a business venture, catching & selling ocean-caught fish .  She has many years of experience in this business.  Mafi needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 200 talas or US $83 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2011, Mafi joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Mafi's 1st loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 45 years old .  She is married and has 3 children. 

Lorna  has a shop that sells generic medicine and food supplements.  At same time,  she also sells snacks and food products.  She has had this business for 10 years.  Lorna has requested a loan for PHP 5000 to buy additional products to sell.

Lorna  has been a member of HSPFI since this year, 2011.  In the future, she hopes to improve her store and make it bigger to accommodate her customers' needs.

loans.use: buy medicine and food supplements

loans.name: Lucrecia

texts.es: La señora Lucrecia vende ropa, artefactos electródomesticos, edredones y los fines de semana vende comida. Así ayuda a su esposo trayendo más ingresos para la familia. El crédito lo requiere para la aumentar capital comprar sabanas, y chamarras, pues con la temporada de frío estos artículos están siendo requeridos mucho. Lucrecia vive en anticrético en una casa, la misma queda ubicada en la zona de Alto Sopocachi en la ciudad de La Paz; es casada y tiene dos hijos. Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito y por la calidad social del mismo es que se lo canaliza a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Lucrecia sells clothes, home appliances and comforters and on weekends she sells food.  This way she helps her husband by bringing more income for the family.  She needs the loan to increase capital buying sheets and jackets because with the cold season these articles are more in demand.  

Lucrecia lives in a house under the “anticrético” modality (Anticrético is a transaction not available in the U.S. whereby a property owner requests a "loan" from you in exchange for housing, which must be paid back to you at the end of your contract. If your loan is not repaid, the property owner loses the property to you) located in La Paz’s Alto Sopocachi zone.  She’s married and has two children.  This is the first time she’s asked for a loan and due to its social nature it’s being channeled through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy sheets and jackets to sell at retail.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita, 55, lives in the Philippines and is married with three children. She has a retail shop that sells fish-like sardines and mackerel, a business she has had for two years. She has requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy fish to sell.

Carmelita is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Erika Beatriz

texts.es:
Erika, vive con su esposo y su hijo, es casada, es empleada y tiene un negocio de una pupuseria el cual surgió por su propia iniciativa y con el apoyo de su esposo, no tiene horario fijo para atender a sus clientes.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de materia prima para su negocio chicharron, quesillo, maiz, aceite y condimentos, esta compra le permitirá surtir el negocio y brindarles más opciones de consumo a sus clientes.
El sueño es tener un negocio fuerte y le genere ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida ella y su familia.
texts.en: Erika lives with her husband and son. She is married, employed and has a pupusería [small grocery store] that she started on her own initiative, with help from her husband. She does not have a fixed schedule for tending to her customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase materials for her business, such as pork, cheese, corn, oil and condiments. This purchase will allow her to stock her business and to offer more options to her customers. Her dream is to have a strong business that generates income so that she and her family can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making pupusas: pork, cheese, corn, oil and condiments

loans.name: Rey

texts.en:
Rey is a man from Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. He is 30 years old, married and is rearing his three little kids together with his wife. He goes fishing frequently to satisfy the mouths to feed and other needs. He owns the fishing boat and is taking good care of it very well. At the end of the month, he gets PHP 5,000 income from said activity.

Earlier this year, he joined GDMPC to have an access to financial services. He is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000 from the cooperative to purchase fishing boat motor parts to accelerate its speed. When the boat is again in good running condition, he expects to catch more and travel farther than the usual routes taken. The possible increased income is intended to expand the business by running even a small fish stall in their own place and sustain the livelihood.

loans.use: To purchase fishing boat motor parts to accelerate its speed.

loans.name: Luis Manuel

texts.es:
El señor Luis Manuel tiene 33 años de edad, es padre soltero tiene dos hijos uno de sus hijos cuenta con 15 años de edad el cual estudia la secundaria se encuentra en el ultimo año, para que en el proximo ciclo escolar pase a preparatoria, el mas  pequeño tiene 7 años de edad este esta estudiando el segundo año de primaria.
El señor nos comenta que tiene un negocio de fabricacion de laminas, es un negocio en donde los integrantes son familiares.Ademas comenta que que el negocio lo inicio su padre, hace ya 11 años, esta vez ha solicitado el pretamo para comprar materia prima como, carton, periodico, papel de todos los tipos hijienico, de libretas, libros etc. El compran este tipo de material para fabricar laminas de carton, la elaboracion es sencilla ya que se muele toda la materia prima hasta obtener una pulpa de papel, despues se pone a secar al sol,  es uno de los desafios que frecuentemente ha tenido ya que si sale el sol es muy dificil que pueda secarse, esto pasa frecuentemente cuando llueve, lo que causa una gran perdida en sus ganancias, porque la lamina obtenida ya como producto la vende, sin embargo es una persona muy trabajadora y nunca se desanima ente esta situacion.
Las ezperanzas que tiene don Luis Manuel es que el negocio cresca para ya no pedir creditos aunque comenta, "Agradesco la ayuda que Frac y Kiva me otorgan ya que ha sidi de gran ayuda y antetodo agradesco la confianza que deposistn en mi para prestarme el dinero".
texts.en:
Luis Manuel is 33 years old.  He is a single father with two children.  One of his children is 15 years old and in his last year of junior high school.  Next year he will start high school.  His youngest son is 7 years old and in the second year of elementary school.

Luis Manuel tells us that he has a cardboard-making business.  It is a family business.  He tells us that his father was the one who started the business 11 years ago. 

Luis Manuel has requested this loan to buy raw materials such as card, newspaper and all kinds of paper (toilet paper, notebook paper, books, etc.)  He buys this type of material for making sheets of cardboard.  The manufacturing process is simple: all the raw material is ground to make a paper pulp which is then put out to dry in the sun.  One of the challenges that he has frequently faced is that if the sun doesn't come out it is very difficult to dry the pulp.  This often happens when it rains and it means that he loses a lot of profit.  However, Luis Manuel is a very hard-working person and he never lets himself become discouraged when faced with this situation.

Luis Manuel hopes that his business will grow so that he no longer has to request loans although he tells us "I am grateful for the help that FRAC and Kiva give me because it has been a great help.  Above all, I am grateful for the trust that is being placed in me when they loan me money".

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as newspaper, card and paper

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua has four children. She sells corn, fresh peanuts, and Fante kenkey (or fermented corn dough) in Abura, which she has done for seven years. 

Ekua will use the loan to purchase corn to make kenkey to sell. With the new profit from her expanded business, Ekua plans to reinvest the profit.

loans.use: to purchase corn to make kenkey, or fermented corn dough, to sell.

loans.name: Damira's Group

texts.en:
Damira is the leader of this group. She is 43 and married to a constructor. Together with her husband she brings up two sons. The older son studies at school and the second son is preschool age (under seven). 

Seven years ago with an initial investment of 4,000 soms she started to sell dried fruits. In this way she earns about 5,000 soms per month. With the profits gained from the trade Damira was able to purchase three cows for breeding.  

She applies for the loan because she needs additional financial funds to purchase building materials for house repairing. In the future Damira wants to provide her sons with a good education.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase building materials to repair the house.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites lives simply with her husband and four school aged children in their community. She is an industrious wife and has operated her sewing business for almost a year. From the business she gets money for their everyday expenses as well as payment for their electric bills. This causes her to work hard and strive for more.

As she stated, “it would be difficult to experience scarcity for the rest of our lives.” Hence the 48-year-old woman is requesting a loan amount of P5,000 to buy fabric, threads, needles and scissors. She hopes these will help increase her income every month so she will be able to provide a more comfortable living for her family and not experience a poor living forever.

loans.use: to buy fabric, threads, needles and scissors

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es:
Juan, vive con su esposa y dos hijos, él es empleado de la alcaldía municipal, tiene 5 años de estar laborando en la municipalidad, su responsabilidad y disciplina lo tiene en un empleo desde hace varios años, su esposa se dedica a vender tortillas.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo terminar la construcción de un rancho, donde su esposa se dispone todos los días a vende tortillas, comprando laminas, madera, clavos y algunos utensilios de cocina que hacen falta,  ya no cuentan con el suficiente dinero para realizarlo.
Su objetivo es continuar siendo empleado de esta alcaldía, también tener la disponibilidad para reunir las cuotas de pago para este préstamo.
texts.en:
Juan lives with his wife and 2 children. He is an employee of the municipal government and has been so for 5 years. His responsibility and discipline have kept him in the job for various years. His wife sells tortillas.

Presently, Juan is requesting a loan to finish construction of the ranch house where his wife plans to sell tortillas every day, by purchasing zinc sheeting, wood, nails, and some kitchen utensils they lack. They don't have sufficient money to buy this themselves.

Juan's objective is to continue in his job with the city and to be able to gather the resources to pay off this loan.

loans.use: to buy zinc sheeting, wood, nails, and some cooking utensils.

loans.name: Nadeem

texts.en: Nadeem is a 24-year-old young man. He is a DJ player and has all the assistant instruments and tools that make his work successful. Nadeem wants to expand his work and open a photography and DJ shop, so he wants to prepare it well for the opening such as installing lights, installing furniture, installing seals, etc, but the amount of money he has isn't enough to pay. So he needs to take a loan of $3,000 from FATEN. When Nadeem gets the loan, he will be able to pay the expenses to open the DJ and photography shop, and prepare well so he will increase his customers and increase his income. This will lead him to have better living conditions. Nadeem is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: To open a photography and DJ shop.

loans.name: Duyen

texts.en:
Duyen is a 44 years old. She lives with her husband and three children in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Duyen and her husband run a food stall from their house selling beef noodles to people in their community. They began this business 15 years ago.

She is requesting a loan to repair her stall and buy new furniture and good quality ingredients to make good soup. She hopes that this will enable her to better serve her existing customers and attract new customers. She also hopes that through the loan she will be able to generate more income and set aside some savings for the future.

loans.use: to buy new furniture and quality ingredients to make good soup.

loans.name: Lita

texts.en:
Lita is 50 years old, lives with one child and is from Santo Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. 

Lita owns and operates a business venture, making and selling banana-cue food in the local community. Lita has operated this business for over three years and she earns 5,000 PHP a month. 

In 2008, Lita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and gain the ability to engage in business activities. Lita is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase ingredients needed in making banana-cue. This will be the third loan taken out by Lita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients needed in making banana-cue (barbecued banana)

location.town: Santo Nino, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: C8023 Abahujumugambi Group

texts.en:
Jeannette, a 33-year-old married mother of four children between the ages of 2 and 11, has a food-vending business which is open from 6 a.m. until 4 p.m. daily. In business for two years, she is the leader of a group which is called "C 8023 Abahujumugambi" in the local language.

Jeannette has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more beans, Irish potatoes, vegetables. etc. to sell. She will reinvest the profits in her business and save money for her future.

loans.use: to purchase more beans, Irish potatoes, vegetables,etc..

loans.name: Katwii

texts.en:
Katwii, 31, is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are rent bills and food for the family.

For the past five years, she has operated a food stall business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation.  Katwii dreams of expanding her business to meet her customer demand in the future.

With the 30,000 Kenya shillings (KES) she wants to purchase food stock of maize flour and wheat flour, and also cooking pots. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase food stock of maize flour, wheat flour, and cooking pots.

loans.name: Danny Alfredo

texts.es:
Danny Alfredo   tiene 31 años vive es soltero, y vive con su papá. Vive en el Recinto San Vicente las Lomas  en el Cantón Ventanas.

La ventanilla el recreo  se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Vicente las Lomas, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembre de maíz y arroz, fréjol y soya, papas criar gallinas.

Danny  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, fréjol. Desde hace tres  años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar.
El crédito solicito para la compra de insumos, fertilizantes, semillas, urea para la siembra del maíz,   El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia. Su sueño  es poder alcanzar a cumplir su meta que es la compra de un terreno para  poder  tener mayores ingresos  para su familia.

En los tiempos libres me gusta  jugar indor y pasar  con toda mi familia.
texts.en:
Danny Alfredo is 31 and single. He lives with his father in the San Vicente de Las Lomas precinct in the Canton of Ventanas.

The “El Recreo” communal bank is located in the San Vicente de Las Lomas precinct, which is part of the Canton of Ventanas. The members of this communal bank make their livings in short-cycle farming. They grow corn, rice, beans, soy and potatoes, and raise chickens.

Danny makes his living by farming. He has been growing corn and beans for the past three years. He purchases his products in Ventanas and sells them in the Ventanas market. 

He requested the loan to purchase agricultural inputs, fertilizers, seeds, and urea for sowing corn. The loan helped him to increase his income for his family. His dream is to be able to reach his goal of purchasing a plot of land so that he can earn more for his family. 

In his free time, he likes to play indoor soccer and spend time with his whole family.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural inputs, fertilizers, seeds, urea to sow corn.

loans.name: Octavio

texts.es: El señor Octavio a sus 61 años de edad se dedica a prestar el servicio de reparación y montaje de llantas para automóviles y motos desde un pequeño local ubicado en la vía principal del municipio de Rionegro localizado al oriente de Antioquia. Gracias a esta actividad, el señor Octavio ha salido adelante junto con su esposa y dos hijos. Con el ánimo de mejorar el servicio que presta y sus ingresos, el señor Octavio necesita de la compra de llantas e insumos con los cuales pueda cumplir su meta y a futuro cumplir su sueño de ampliar su negocio y brindarle una buena calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en: Octavio, 61, works offering repair service and tire assembly for cars and motorcycles in a small place located on the main street in the town of Rionegro, in Eastern Antioquia.  Thanks to this job Octavio has gotten ahead together with his wife and two children.  With the intention of improving the service he offers and his income, Octavio needs to buy tires and supplies with which he can achieve his goal and, in the future, his dream of expanding his business and giving his family a good quality of life.

loans.use: to buy tires and supplies such as glue and hammers.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es: Olga de 23 años, es una joven soltera alegre y trabajadora con ganas de triunfar en la vida, vive en su propia casa y lo que más desea es obtener mejores ingresos para así darle una buena estabilidad económica a su futura familia. La actividad a la que se dedica Olga, es al cultivo de cacao; pues tanto la planta y las tierras fue herencia de sus padres, desde entonces trabajan labrando y sembrando. Asimismo necesita del apoyo de los jornaleros, para que puedan sacar la maleza de entre sus plantas, así como cosechar y trasladar los productos  hasta las carreteras, que luego serán llevados con triciclos y/o carretillas. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la libertad que tiene en el desempeño de su labor, ya que ella decide que es lo mejor para sus cultivos, lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es combatir con la plaga que se apoderan de los brotes de sus cultivos.  Ahora lo que más prioriza es comprar nuevas tierras para amplair la siembra, por tanto este será su crédito número 03 con MFP, es conciente que éste aporte le será muy útil en el progreso de su trabajo. Se siente muy contenta por ser socia de su banco comunal y aportará de si misma por el desarrollo de su grupo. Con los 2,000 nuevos soles, comprará semillas de cacao para incrementar su producción.
texts.en:
23-year-old Olga is a young, single woman.  She is cheerful and hard-working, and has a desire to do well in life.  She lives in her own home and what she most wants is to make better income so that she can provide good financial stability to her future family.  Olga's business is growing cacao.  The plants and the land were an inheritance from her parents.  She works the soil and sows her seeds.  She also needs the support of laborers to weed between her plants, harvest them and transport them to the roads where they will then be taken off by three-wheeled vehicles and / or wheelbarrows.  What Olga most enjoys about her work is the freedom that she has to carry out her tasks as she decides what is best for her crops.  She has been in this business for 15 years and she considers the most difficult part of her work to be battling the pests who attack her plants' shoots.  Her biggest priority right now is to buy more land so that she can grow more crops.  

This will be Olga's third loan through MFP.  She is aware that it will be very useful to her in making progress in her work.  She feels very happy to be a member of her community bank and she will contribute towards the development of her group.  Olga will use the 2,000 soles to buy cacao seeds with which to increase her production.

loans.use: to buy cacao seeds

loans.name: Vyuka  A Group

texts.fr:
Laurent  fait partie du groupe  Vyuka A et  habite à  Muramvya. Il a 35 ans et est marié à Viola, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants âgés de 4 à 7 ans, dont  1 étudie. 

Il fait le commerce de bananes,  depuis  5 ans. 

Il est à son neuvième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup de bananes  à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il  voudrait  acheter une voiture, et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Laurent is part of the Vyuka A group and lives in Muramvya. He is 35 years old and married to Viola, a farmer. Together they have three children from 4 to 7 years old, one of which is in school. 

He has sold bananas for five years.

This is his ninth loan with Turame. with the KIVA loan that he receives, he will increase his capital and buy many bananas to resell so that he may earn more. 

In the coming years, he would like to buy a car, and see his children in school.

loans.use: to increase his capital and to buy many bananas to resell in order to earn more.

loans.name: Anastasia

texts.en:
Anastasia is 52 years old, married, and has been blessed with a beautiful family. She is a farmer from Nkuguru village, situated in the central province of Kenya. She is dedicated to her work and only thinks about going forward and delivering good produce. She knows that many people consume her produce, and because of this, she is determined that her produce are of good quality. Anastasia lives on a small piece of land where she keeps cows and grows a wide variety of crops, which she has been doing for 10 years. Her primary sources of income are milk and horticultural produce. Her biggest challenges are diseases and the shortage of farm inputs. Farmers in the area lack capital to purchase farm inputs, such as chemicals, to prevent these diseases. Anastasia joined Juhudi Kilimo in order to access loans that would help him improve her farming activities. Anastasia is requesting a loan, which she will use to expand her horticulture farm. This loan will enable him to expand her operations to increase the output. The additional income from the expansion will go toward her children's education. With this loan, Anastasia children will acquire quality education.
During this festive season support a smallholder farmer by granting him a loan!

loans.use: To expand her horticulture farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow and to build a cow shed

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Aggie is 37 years old and mother of 4 children. She had only basic education. She supports the upkeep of the family with the sale of used clothes in her community and in the villages outside the metropolis.

Since she has very little capital, Aggie has to contend with the very low grades of clothing available to her. Having gone through the KRABAN learning sessions, she is determined to use the KIVA loan to buy two full bales of used clothes for a start. She also hopes to find others who would buy from her for onward resale.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Xi

texts.en: Miss Xi is 34 and her husband is 38 years old. They have 3 children between 8 and 12 who are going to school in grade 2 and 6. They have a little land for rice, about 3000 square meters. Tam, her husband, works as a daily laborer but he only works in the dry season. So Xi sells food for breakfast in the morning from door to door. This has increased her family's income by about $1.6/person/month. Average is low at $8.5/person/month. Now, she wants to borrow a loan of $75 for her selling and buying fertilizer

loans.use: sells food

loans.name: Magdaline

texts.en:
Sixty-seven year old Magdaline is a widow who has gone through a lot of difficulties in single-handedly providing basic needs for her eight children, and given her old age. Motivated by other GHAPE members in his community, she joined the program where she was trained in business management, marketing techniques and credit discipline. Since then, she has invested and repaid all of her loans with which she raised money to pay school fees and provide food for her children.

Given a loan of $600, she plans to sell foodstuff and also cultivate crops so she can raise money to pay school fees for her children and take care of other needs.

She plans to pay her loan in 18 months. First loan repayment installment shall be made on the fourth month from the date of disbursement.

loans.use: Purchase corn, rice, cocoyam, garri, seeds, and transport to farm.

loans.name: Tarana

texts.ru:
Taranara Suleymanove was born in 1969 in the city of Aksu. She is married and has two children. She has had her own business for 6 years now thanks to the Norwegian branch of Normico. Tarana remembers the day when she first came to Normico as if it was yesterday. It was in 2005 and she was able to obtain a $300 loan. The second time around she borrowed $600 that allowed her to increase the size of her business. Now she needs money in order to by more goods. Tarana sells clothing.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Тарана Сулейманова,родилась 1969 году в городе Аксу. Замужем, имеет двоих детей. Уже 6 лет подряд она занимаеться бизнесом, благодаря Нормикро Аксуниского филиала.Тарана прекрасно помнить тот день, когда обратилась Аксуниский филиал. Это было 2005 году 300$.Второй раз она взяла 600$, чтобы расширяться. Теперь ей нужны деньги чтобы по больше купить товар.Тарана занимаеться торговли одеждами.

loans.use: To purchase more goods

loans.name: Otila

texts.en: Otila is looking to use her loan to help her with her plantation business. The plantation business would help her with her family commitments and these include her church commitments as well. At the same time, the business will provide the support she needs for her to pay back this loan, in case she decides to borrow more money in future. There is bound to be problems along the way in her plantation business and therefore she needs to make sure that she manages the plantation and funds well so that she meets her goal of having a successful business.

loans.use: To buy supplies and equipment for her plantation business

loans.name: Ruta

texts.en: Ruta is a new member for Nono'a Centre. She is 24 years old, married with 2 children. Her husband has been a farmer all his life. Through their plantation, they have managed to earn their income.  Through the advice of her friends, Ruta decided to join SPBD so she could get some financial help to improve their income. Ruta thought of making ice cakes (popsicles in a bag) because she is close to the village school and she noticed many people like eating them. With her first loan, she is eager to make good money to develop her family living.

loans.use: To start her ice cakes (popsicle) business

loans.name: Ruslan

texts.en:
Ruslan S. is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from Khojavend city of Azerbaijan. He settled in Beylagan with his family in1992. He is married and has two children.

Ruslan owns a spare parts store in Beylagan. He started his business three years ago. He applied to Normicro Beylagan Branch for a loan of $1000 to buy new spare parts and expand his business.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy A. is a mother of five, married and is 56 years old. She hails from Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells clothes and stationeries and has been in business for over 20 years. She needs a loan of $1200 to purchase more clothes for sale.

loans.use: To buy more clothes

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en:
Mrs. Chantha T. (pictured with her first son) and her husband have five children; two sons and three daughters. All of their children are working. The first son has been in construction for four years and two of her daughters weave silk at home. The family lives in Mekong River’s Island, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Chantha started weaving silk when she was young. It’s a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to a middle man in her village. Her husband, Van Vin, is a chef for wedding ceremonies.

Mrs. Chantha is requesting a loan for the second time in the amount of $700 to purchase construction material for her first son.

loans.use: To purchase construction material for her son

loans.name: Papa

texts.en:
G. Papa sells shoes and clothing. He is married and has 3 children. Business is very good and he wants to increase sales to meet the demand for his goods. He is lacking capital.

He is asking for $525 as additional capital to buy more goods for sale.

loans.use: As additional capital to buy more goods for sale.

loans.name: Araba

texts.en:
Araba K. is married and has 4 children. She travels to a distant town to purchase food supplies in large quantities which she in turn sells to local customers in small quantities. Business is doing very well, but the cost of transportation is becoming a financial problem.

She is asking for a loan to reduce the burden of transportation cost.

loans.use: To reduce the burden of transportation costs

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Tám, 41 years old from a traditional farming family, joins the TYM Fund in 2001 at the time her family’s economy was in hardship. She used the funds from those earlier loans for traditional farming practices of raising pigs. Though not hugely successful, her family could get by and she managed to save a little. In 2006, seeing the demand of using tractor in the area she decided to acquire more loan in addition to their saving so she could purchase a tractor to rent to farmers in the area. This entrepreneurial decision has proved that she hit the right demand. The income is huge, 4,000,000VND a month. Her husband and two children take turn to maintain and run the business. She is applying for a loan of 18,000,000 VND to invest more into the business.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.  
 
Chị Nguyễn Thị Tám 41 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ tình thương năm 2001, gia đình anh chi làm nông nghiệp vì vậy những năm trước khi trưa vào Quỹ điều kiện kinh tế gia đình còn nhiều khó khăn, khi tham gia vào Quỹ ở những mức vốn đầu tiên gia đình chị cũng vay vốn về đầu tư chăn nuôi lợn, với mô hình nhỏ thu nhập từ dự án này tuy không cao nhưng gia đình chị cũng tiết kiệm được một khoản tiền nho nhỏ sau mỗi lần xuất chuồng lợn, năm 2006 nhận thấy bà con trong địa phương có nhiều nhu cầu thuê máy cày khi vào mùa vụ. Anh chị đã bàn bạc với nhau lây số tiền tích lũy được sau nhiều năm kết hợp với việc vay vốn của Quỹ, anh chị đã mua được một chiếc máy cày, chồng chị là người chịu khó, khi vào vụ gia đình anh chị được rất nhiều bà con trong thôn thuê máy cày, với việc kinh doanh này gia đình anh chị kinh tế ngày càng phát triển, chị có 2 con đang sống cùng và các con chị đều có thể giúp đỡ chị mọi công việc trong gia đình. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 18.000.000đ sửa sang máy móc và chăn nuôi.
Thu nhập bình quân 4.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Repair machine and raise animals

loans.name: Sangita

texts.en:
Mrs. Sangita T. lives in Bhatkepati. Bhatkepati is one of the developing villages located in Kathmandu dristict. Most of the people in this region are engaged in agricultural farming. Mrs. Sangita has three members including her self in her family. Her husband Mr. Share Bahadur T. works in private office and her son is in primary school. 
Mrs. Sangita opens her cosmetic shop five years ago in the town of Koteshwor. She sells different types of cosmetic goods in her shop like glass bangles, cream powder, etc in her shop. Now due to high competition she needs to increase verities of cosmetic items in her shop. So Mrs. Sangita T. is requesting a$225 loan to buy different varieties of cosmetic items.

loans.use: To buy goods for her shop

loans.name: Phal

texts.en:
Mr. B. Phal is a 47-year-old who lives with his wife and one child in Srork Commune, Kampong Cham Province. He grows rice on his farmland in the rainy season, which provides the main income for his family. Phal and his wife work hard every day to support the family. They lack capital to pay for plowing their farmland and to purchase fertilizer for their rice crop. They decided to request a loan for this purpose.

About Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL): HKL is one of Cambodia's largest and most successful microfinance institutions (MFIs). It is committed to helping its clients achieve their business goals by providing sound financial services, and thereby hopes to contribute to the social and economic development of Cambodia. HKL specifically targets women and poor families in order to help them achieve increased financial security and quality of life, by offering various credit programs and encouraging savings. In accordance with its mission and its commitment to operational and financial sustainability, HKL contributes part of its net profits every year to support social development in education and healthcare.

loans.use: To pay for plowing their farmland and to purchase fertilizer for their rice crop

loans.name: Diouma

texts.fr: Diouma N., 63 ans est mariée avec des enfants majeurs qui l’aident dans les charges familiales. Elle est membre  et présidente du banc villageois de Boucotte Place de Gao depuis 7 ans. Son activité consiste à acheter et revendre de l’huile de palme et du jus de citron. Diouma veut renforcer son activité. <b>Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.<b/>
texts.en:
Diouma N., 63, is married with grown children who help her to support the family. She has been a member and the president of the village bank Boucotte Place de Gao for 7 years. Her business consists in buying and re-selling palm oil and lemon juice. Diouma wants to expand her business. She is requesting a loan that will be reimbursed at the end of 6 months in one single repayment.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying and re-selling palm oil and lemon juice

loans.name: Thai

texts.en: Thai L., 31 years old, is married and lives with her husband and three children. Living in Kampong Cham, she is able to make around one dollar per day. She grows rice and crops on her plot of land. She said she has been planting since 1980 - before she got married. Her husband, Chhuon Soeun, 31 years old, has a business digging wells, making around US$3 per day. Thai L. is asking for a loan of US$1000 to purchase land for reselling.

loans.use: To purchase land for sale.

loans.name: Abies

texts.en: Abies E. is a retired civil servant. She sells plastics, provisions, drinks and foodstuffs. Abies is a hardworking woman and she is determined to excel in her business. She needs the loan amount of N40,000 to purchase more provisions, drinks and foodstuffs to sell. She is 59 years old and married with 3 children. She is indeed grateful to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks, provisions and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Ejiro

texts.en: Ejiro sells frozen foods for a living, and travels to the Republic of Benin to buy items to sell to her customers.
