Ejiro is a 36-year-old widow and needs to support herself and her only child.  She has applied for a loan to buy more frozen foods such as turkey and fish to sell to her customers. Ejiro is a LAPO client and wants to thank Kiva's lenders and LAPO Microfinance for their financial support.

loans.use: To buy more buy frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa se dedica a la comercialización de perfumes y cosméticos, que los vende por catalogo en los mercados y oficinas.
Vive en la zona de Irpavi de la ciudad de La Paz, en alquiler.
El crédito será destinado para la compra de mercadería (perfumes, cremas,  shampoo, y demás cosméticos).
Es la cuarta vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, su historial lo califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su crédito.
texts.en:
Rosa makes a living buying and selling perfumes and cosmetics. She sells them by catalog in markets and offices. She lives in rental housing in the Irpavi neighborhood of La Paz. The loan will be used to buy merchandise (perfumes, creams, shampoo, etc.) This is the fourth time that Rosa has applied for an Impro loan. Her history qualifies her as a premier customer because she has a good record of repaying past loans.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy perfumes and cosmetics for resale.

loans.name: Mirzoali

texts.ru: Мирзоев Мирзоали проживает в районе Рудаки. Район находится рядом с городом Душанбе. Мирзоали женат и имеет пятерых детей. Сейчас ждет пополнение. Поэтому , имея такую большую семью ему необходимо много работать. Занимается торговлей фруктами. Кроме того имеет грузовую машину. Кредит запрвшивает для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот и пополнить запас товара. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Mirzoali M. lives in Rudaki region in the vicinity of Dushanbe. Mirzoali is married and has five children. His wife is expecting another child. To support his large family, Mirzoali has to work hard. He is involved in fruit trade. He also has a truck. Mirzoali would like to get a loan for increasing cash flow and the assortment of goods. He would be able to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase cash flow

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: Martha tiene 41 años, vive  con su esposo y sus hijos en una casa que se encarga de cuidar. Desde hace más de 5 años se dedica a ofrecer el servicio de lavado de ropa, ella y su esposo son las principales fuentes de ingresos en su hogar y es por ello que Martha  eligió esta actividad. Lava diariamente las prendas de vestir de sus vecinos y con ello  cada semana obtiene ingresos, cobra 3 soles la docena de prendas simples y las más gruesas y difíciles de lavar hasta 15 soles. El tiempo y el esfuerzo en su trabajo ocasionan en Martha constantes resfríos por lo que quiere comprase una lavadora que le ayude con su trabajo, porque hasta el momento lava todo a mano. Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP, ella es una de las socias más activas de su banco comunal y de las más responsables, y siempre pide un crédito de acuerdo a sus posibilidades. Con la cantidad solicitada, logrará por fin, comprar una lavadora doméstica de 15 litros de capacidad en lavado, esto facilitara en gran medida el trabajo que realiza.
texts.en:
Martha is 41-years old and lives with her husband and children in the house where she is caretaker. For more than five years she has provided laundry services. Martha and her husband are the family's main providers, which is why she chose to work. Everyday she washes her neighbors' clothes, charging 3 PEN per dozen garments, and up to 15 PEN for heavier garments that are more difficult to wash. The time and effort required to wash clothes by hand causes Martha to catch colds easily, and she wishes to buy a washing machine to help her in her work. This is her second loan from MFP. Martha is one of the most active and responsible members of her community bank. She always requests a loan amount within her capacity to repay. With the amount she is currently requesting she will finally be able to buy a 15-liter capacity washing machine, which will make her work much easier.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of washing machine

loans.name: Maritza Antonia

texts.es: La Sra. Maritza es una mujer dedicada a su familia como  a su negocio desde hace ocho años logro poner una pequeña venta de productos varios con dinero que le presto su familia y que luego presto a Afodenic para incrementar su negocio este es su sexto ciclo. Tiene 34 años de edad, reside en el barrio  villa reconciliación con tres hijos de 1, 7,12 años de edad, su esposo trabaja junto con ella ya que gracias a sus estrategias y préstamo logro hacer de su pequeña venta una miscelánea donde vende variados productos que son del consumo diario de los clientes. Con esta solicitud quiere comprar productos de consumos diarios como pollo, carnes, embutidos, productos enlatados y otros para seguir fortaleciendo su inventario. A futuro es poder ayudar a sus hijos a que se formen profesionalmente, es por eso la dedicación de aumentar sus activos para poder apoyarlos en sus carreras ya que estudiar hoy en día es muy costoso y no desean privar a sus hijos de tan rico privilegio.
texts.en:
Maritza is a woman dedicated to her family as well as her business, which she has had for the past 8 years. She was able to open a small store where she sold various products with money she borrowed from her family, and later with money from Kiva partner Afodenic. This is her sixth cycle with Afodenic. She is 34 years old and lives in the Villa Reconciliación neighborhood with her three children ages 1, 7 and 12, and her husband. Her husband works alongside her and thanks to their strategies and the loan, they were able to turn their small store into a general store that sells a variety of staple products to their customers. With the loan, she wants to buy staple products such as chicken, meats, milkshakes, canned products, and other products to strengthen her inventory. In the future, her goal is to help her children develop professionally, and for this reason she is dedicated to increasing her assets. She wants to support her children in their careers, as education today is very expensive and she doesn’t want to deprive her children of such a great privilege.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy staple products such as meat, chicken, milkshakes, and canned products

loans.name: Diana Leidy,

texts.es:
A sus veintisiete años y con dos hijos de seis y dos años cada uno Diana, además de ser ama de casa, también se desempeña como una microempresaria. Desde hace cuatro años vende productos de belleza de una marca muy conocida. La idea de emprender este negocio nació a raíz de que se vio en la necesidad de apoyar en los ingresos de su hogar. A medida que su hijo mayor iba creciendo se dio cuenta que debía trabajar.

Anteriormente, estuvo trabajando por dos años vendiendo ropa, pero el negocio era de otra persona. Su esposo trabaja en una imprenta, negocio familiar que lleva a cabo junto con su hermana. Diana mas adelante quisiera abrir una librería en su propia casa, ya que ofrece mas ingresos y es un negocio rentable.
texts.en:
Diana is 27 years old and has 2 children, who are 6 and 2 years old. In addition to caring for her home, she is also a small business owner. For the past 4 years she has sold beauty products from a well-known brand. She started her business because she saw it was necessary for her to contribute to her family’s earnings. As her older son grew, she realized she needed to work. She worked for 2 years selling clothing, but it was through someone else’s business. Her husband works for a printer, as part of a family business he has with his sister. In the future she would like to open a stationary store/ bookstore in her home, since it is a profitable business that would bring in more income.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Beauty products to increase her stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To sell grocery items

loans.name: Oyuntsetseg

texts.en: Oyuntsetseg S. is a widow living with her mother and son in Ovorhanghay, one of Mongolia's central provinces. Her son is a student in a local technical college where he is learning carpentry. Oyuntsetseg runs a small barber shop located in a local shopping mall. She has been running her business since 2003 and plans to expand her business soon. Since her barber shop is the only source of income for her family, she works hard and does her best to earn money. In the future, she hopes to run her own full-service salon.  She requests a loan to purchase hair products and equipment such as hair dye and dryers.

loans.use: To purchase hair products and equipment such as hair dye and dryers.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
La señora  Vilma  pertenece al Banco Comunal “Micaela Bastidas” ubicado  del  distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno; ella tiene 46 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 5 hijos.  Ella tiene estudios superiores (profesora).

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 7 años,  inicio su trabajo con un préstamo inicial de S/.  300.00 nuevos soles, para la compra de abarrotes.

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 1300.00 Nuevos soles, para poder comprar arroz, azúcar, leche, aceite fideos, conservas y gaseosas, de esta manera podrá aumentar su mercadería y obtener mayores ingresos.
Su sueño es poner una tienda y vender al por mayor. 
A ella le gustan  los encuentros, los ahorros  y las reuniones de su Banco Comunal.
texts.en:
Mrs. Vilma belongs to the Village Bank “Micaela Bastidas” located in the Ilave District, El Collao Province, Puno Department. She is 46 years old, and is a single mother with 5 children. She has a higher education (professor).

She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for 7 years, she began her work with an initial loan of 300.00 New Soles, in order to buy groceries.

At the moment whe requires a 1300.00 New Soles loan, in order to purchase rice, sugar, milk, oil, noodles, canned goods and sodas. With this she will be able to increase her merchandise and earn more income. Her dream is to have a store and to sell at wholesale. She likes the encounters, savings and meetings of her Village Bank.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Hopkins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: In order to purchase sugar, milk, oil, noodles, canned goods and soft drinks.

loans.name: Rafiqa

texts.en:
Rafiqa K. is an active entrepreneur, selling clothing for men. She has a circle of loyal clients and a variety of merchandise in her shop. She has gained rich experience working in this sphere of trade for the last five years.

All of Rafiqa 's business endeavors have been characterized by commitment and reliability. She tries to please each of her customers’ tastes and is always seeking to expand the assortment of inventory she offers for sale in her shop. She started this business on her own, but now her children are actively helping her to run this family venture.

Today Rafiqa is requesting a loan of 1200 USD to re-stock her inventory and to continue expanding her trade.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing inventory.

loans.name: Kishna

texts.en:
Kishna K. works on a small plot of land growing vegetables and maize with the help of one of her sons. Kishna and her husband both used to work on the land but he is too elderly now for physical labour.

Kishna is applying for a loan of Rs. 10, 000 to purchase new seedlings for her vegetable farm.

Every few days Kishna’s son travels from their village of Dolchoky to Kathmandu to sell their produce. It is very expensive to reach Kathmandu,  sometimes taking more than four hours of travel time in a day,  but Kishna and her family receive more money for their vegetables if they sell them at the market themselves.

Kishna has three sons, only one of whom is still in school. Kishna finds the manual labor on her farm very tiring and hopes that in the future all of her sons will join the family farming business so that she can retire with her husband.

loans.use: purchasing vegetable seedlings

loans.name: Juana Brigida

texts.es: Juana Brígida Martínez S. tiene la edad de 41 años. Es una mujer casada. Tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. Su actividad económica es una pulpería. Juana tiene 10 años de tener su negocio. El dio inicio con una pequeña vitrina en donde coloco galletas, pan, caramelos y repostería. Por lo que sus clientes llegaban en busca de nuevos productos. Con las pocas ganancias que Juan obtenía logro comprar más utilidades, y empezó a modificar su vivienda ya que no tenía suficiente espacio. Y así decide establecer la pulpería en donde ofrece productos de uso frecuente. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de golosinas, pan, refrescos naturales, jugos y gaseosas. El sueño de Juana es  establecer otra pulpería para que sus hijos se hagan cargo.
texts.en:
Juana Brígida Martínez S. is 41 years old, married, and has 2 children. She has been operating a grocery store for 10 years. When she started, she only had a small display case filled with cookies, bread, candy and pastries. Soon her customers wanted to find new products. With what little earnings she had, she bought more useful items and remodeled her shop because there wasn’t enough space. She then decided that her store be stocked with the most frequently used items.

The loan she is requesting will be used as working capital to buy candy, bread, natural sodas, juices and soft drinks. Juana hopes to open another store for her children to run.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Adriana Del Socorro

texts.es: Adriana del Socorro Millón Bárcenas tiene 56 años. Es madre soltera, tiene 6 hijos, pero ninguno está a su cargo. Su actividad económica es la venta de tortillas. Hace más de 13 años que se dedica a esta actividad. Todos los días en su humilde vivienda ofrece sus tortillas, por lo que en su mayoría los vecinos llegan a comprar sus productos. Son a un precio muy accesible y además sus clientes disfrutan de su elaboración. Ella dio inicio a su negocio por la necesidad de proveer a su hogar el pan de cada día y mantener a su familia. el financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de maíz y otros productos para la elaboración. Su mayor sueño es lograr que sus hijos finalicen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Adriana is 56 years old. She is a single mother of six children though none are still under her care. She has been selling tortillas for more than 13 years in her modest dwelling since most of her neighbors come and purchase her products. They are sold at a very affordable prices and moreover, her customers enjoy the way they are made. She started her business out of the necessity to provide her home and children with bread. The loan that she requests is to purchase corn and other supplies for the tortilla production. Her greatest dream is for her children to complete their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Laurie Paguio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase corn and supplies to make tortillas

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
At Elmina, Agnes A. sells palm oil, the fresh taste of a locally prepared orange juice, and cocoa drink which is made from cocoa powder. Agnes has junior high school education. She is married and has one child. Her husband is an ICT (Information and Communications Technology) technician.

Agnes has been selling palm oil, and drinks since 2007. She helps in paying her dependents’ fees and other expenses of the family. Her loan will be used to buy more palm oil and other goods to sell. She hopes to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy more palm oil and other goods to sell

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es: La señora Delfina, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Trabajando II”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es Separada, tiene 42 años, 04 hijos, 03 que aun dependen de ella.Deseando ver profesional a sus hijos y tener sus propios ingresos para poder lograrlo, decidió emprender su propio negocio. Se dedica a la Venta de Anticuchos y Juanes, todos los días a partir de las 6:30 pm. Nos cuenta que sus ventas le salen muy bien, ya que tiene muy buena acogida y sus alimentos le salen muy ricos.En la actualidad, continúa con el mismo negocio y le va muy bien, tiene sus clientes fijos y ya es conocida por sus clientes y por la buena sazón que le pone a sus comidas.Con este préstamo de S/ 800.00, comprará insumos para sus preparados como: sacos de arroz y azúcar, pollos y huevos en javas, plátanos en racimos, fideos y aceites en docenas, asimismo utensilios de cocina para brindar un servicio de calidad.  Se siente con muchas fuerzas para seguir con sus ventas de comidas, posteriormente desea implementar mas su negocio con un Restaurant bien acondicionado para brindar a sus clientes un mejor servicio y atención. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Delfina belongs to the “Mujeres Trabajando II” (Working Women II) Village Bank in the Tarapoto District, San Martin Province, Department of San Martín. She is 42, separated, and has four children, three of whom still depend on her. Wishing to see her children become professionals with their own incomes, she decided to start up her own business. She earns her living selling kebabs and juanes every day starting at 6:30PM. She tells us that sales are going nicely, since she is very well received and her food is quite delicious. Right now things are going smoothly for her as she continues with her business; she has steady customers who know her well for her food’s yummy flavors. Delfina plans to use her loan of 800 soles to buy ingredients for her meals, including: sacks of rice and sugar, chickens, crates of eggs, bunches of bananas, lots of pastas and oils, and cooking utensils, all so she can provide quality service. She feels strongly about continuing to sell her food. Later, she wants to expand her business with a restaurant, well-equipped so she can offer her customers the best attention and service. She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos movement for contributing to the fulfillment of her dreams and goals.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for preparing her meals.

loans.name: Clarisse

texts.fr: Y. Clarisse est née vers 1982 à Ouidah. Clarisse est mariée à LISSANOU Ghislaine, un employé du plus grand hôpital du Bénin. Clarisse est mère de trois enfants et en plus de leurs enfants, son mari et elle ont à charge deux autres enfants, tous scolarisés. La famille vit à Fridjrossè  à Cotonou, Capitale Economique  de la République du Bénin. Grâce au revenu de son activité, Clarisse vient en aide à son mari dans les charges de la famille. C’est des mèches et des produits  cosmétiques que Clarisse vend. C’est à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin que Clarisse achète ses produits. Clarisse a déjà trois ans d’expérience dans cette activité.  Clarisse a déjà eu deux crédits d’ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés et avec lesquels elle a pu élever le niveau de son activité.  Pour  continuer de développer son activité, Clarisse demande un troisième crédit pour renforcer son fonds de roulement.

loans.use: Achat de mèches et de produits cosmétiques.

loans.name: Nil

texts.en: Nil C., 65, is married and lives with his wife and four children in Takeo province. Since 1993, he has been running a motor-taxi business to earn a living, making about $5 each day. His wife is a farmer who works for less than $1 per day. The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year, and inflation has caused food prices to rise dramatically. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians. In light of these conditions, Nil  is asking for a loan of $1000 to replace an old and unreliable motorbike. With the new motorbike, Nil will be able to earn more money to raise the family's standard of living.

loans.use: To replace an old motorbike.

loans.name: Rudy

texts.en:
Rudy S. is from the village of Brgy, Kahulogan, Gingoog City. He is 52 years old. Rudy is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Rudy owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating a "motorela" transport business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing transportation services to local community members. He also runs a sari-sari (variety) business. Rudy has been engaged in his business for over 7 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rudy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rudy is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Rudy from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

location.town: Barangay 26, Kahulogan, Gingoog City, Misamis Orie

loans.name: Maria Marlene

texts.es:
La señora  R. D. S. MARIA MARLENE tiene 49 años, vive en el distrito D. FLORENCIA D. MORA, provincia D. Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. Maria estudió hasta 6º D. primaria. La socia está casada y tiene 5 hijos, D. los cuales solo 2 dependen económicamente D. ella.
Maria se dedica a la confección D. peluches y venta D. juguetes, como carritos, camioncitos, muñecas, ositos D. peluche, muñecas D. trapo, barbies, etc. Con su primer crédito D. 300.00 nuevos soles compró material para confeccionar sus peluches, papel D. regalo para envolver sus juguetes, y una vitrina. Con este crédito D. 600.00 nuevos soles comprará mas juguetes para cubrir pedidos para la navidad, puesto que esta proximo a celebrarse la navidad en diciembre. 
Maria sueña con tener su stand D. juguetería y peluches en el Distrito D. Trujillo.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria Marlene Rodríguez D. S. is 49 years old and lives in the District of Florencia D. Mora, Trujillo Province, Department of La Libertad – Perú. Maria has a 6th graD. education. She is married and has 5 children of whom 2 are dependents.

Maria makes stuffed animals and sells toys such as cars, trucks, dolls, teddy bears, rag dolls, Barbie dolls, etc. She used her first loan of 300 soles to buy material for making stuffed animals, gift wrapping paper, and a display case.

With this loan of 600 soles, Maria will buy toys so that she can fill her orders for the Christmas season. She hopes to open a toy store in Trujillo District.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase toys

loans.name: Blenda

texts.en:
Blenda O., from the village of Tru-cut, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidenta, is 45 years old, married and the mother of three school-aged children. To make a living, Blenda owns and operates a specialized retail store that sells daily use products such as shampoo, toothpaste and other products. She also sell banana cue in the local community. Engaged in her business for over eight years, she earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Blenda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting a loan of 4000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell, and plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Glorita

texts.en:
Glorita A. is from the town of Turod Norte, Cordon. She is 55 years old. Glorita is widowed and has 6 adult-aged children. To make a living, Glorita owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector selling charcoal. While not the only means of generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling charcoals to their community. Glorita earns approximately 3500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Glorita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Glorita is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional charcoals to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Glorita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional charcoals to sell

loans.name: Clarecil

texts.en:
Clarecil A. is from the village of Camanga, Tukuran Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 26 years old. Clarecil is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Clarecil owns & operates a general store, selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap & boost food in the local community. Clarecil has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Clarecil joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Clarecil has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Clarecil is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Clarecil from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi is 44 years old. She is divorced and has given birth to four children. All of her children are in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a commercial community. 

Esi is a trader. She trades in cereals, specifically maize. She procures bags of maize from nearby communities and supplies to food vendors and retailers in her community. Esi also treks to other towns to sell. She has been in business for 10 years and wants a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy maize

loans.name: Walter

texts.es: El sr, Walter R. T. su negocio es taller de soldadura el repara las plataforma de los camiones de carga pesada, mofles, motor todo lo que se refiere de soldadura de vehículo, el crédito lo está solicitando para comprar un soldador y hacer un pozo de agua en su casa el tiene su propio taller ubicado en el municipio de san Rafael consta con tres personas que le ayudan que son mecanico. El trabaja como ayudante en un taller de soldadura una vez que el aprendio este oficio decidió tener su propio taller y tenia unos ahorrito y realizo un crédito para ajustar y comprar sus herramienta que eran necesaria para el trabajo ya si fue poco a poco surgiendo los crédito que ceprodel le ha otorgado le han sido de mucha ayuda. Es casado y le tiene2 hijos los dos en edad escolar ya ha tenido 6 creditos con nosotros y le han impactado mucho en su negocio y en su vida familiar ya que con sus ingresos del negocio a podido ir construyendo su casa.
texts.en:
Walter R. T.'s business is a welding workshop. He repairs the beds of heavy trucks, mufflers, motors or anything with regards to vehicle welding. The loan that he is requesting is for purchase of a soldering iron and to build a water well in his home. He has his own shop located in the town of San Rafael. He has three people who help him who are mechanics. He worked as an apprentice in a welding shop. Once he learned this job, he decided to start his own shop and he had a little savings and took out a loan to make for the difference and bought the tools that were necessary for the job. The loan that Ceprodel granted has been very helpful. He is married and has two children who are school age. He has had six loans with us, which have had great impact on his business and in his family life since with the income from his business he's been able to build his house.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a soldering iron and build a water well.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Zainab is a 29-year-old married woman with 2 children. In 2009, she opened a used clothing shop in her town to sell clothes at good prices. She opened her business after seeing a need for a place where customers could buy clothes for lower prices. She uses her business to help her husband to raise their two children. 

Today, Zainab is requesting a loan of $1,200 to buy additional clothes. This will increase her sales and, therefore, her income.

loans.use: To buy additional clothes

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.es:
Feliciana, D. 52 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía D. su pareja Fidel (38), quien es agricultor, y D. su pequeño hijo D. 10 años, porque los 3 mayores ya tiene sus propias familias.

DesD. muy joven se dedica a las labores agrícolas, ya que aprendió D. sus padres las técnicas necesarias para el cuidado D. las tierras. Cuando quedó viuda pensó que su vida estaba terminando, pero tiempo después se unió a su actual pareja y tuvo un hijo; en la actualidad trabaja junto a su pareja en la siembra D. maíz y papa. Cada día es D. sacrificio, ya que la vida en la sierra es algo dura por los constantes cambios climáticos D. la zona y porque debe despertarse al amanecer, todos los días, para vigilar sus tierras. Paralelamente a las labores agrícolas cría ganado ovino, el que comercializa D. vez en cuando en las ferias su zona. Y como es una mujer muy emprendedora, para el futuro tiene planeado empezar a sembrar alverja, ya que se ha enterado que el precio D. este producto tiene un buen precio en el mercado.

Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP y está muy agradecida con todas las personas que hacen posible que pueda acceder al crédito para continuar trabajando. Además está contenta D. pertenecer a su grupo D. trabajo porque es muy unido y solidario. El dinero solicitado lo invertirá en la compra D. varios sacos D. abono y fertilizantes que necesita para el cuidado D. sus tierras y para que la producción no presente ningún tipo D. problemas durante la cosecha.
texts.en:
Feliciana is 52 years old and lives in her own home with her partner Fidel (age 38), who is a farmer, and her ten year old son. Her three older children already have their own families.

From a young age she has worked on a farm. Feliciana learned from her parents the necessary techniques required to care for the land. When she became a widow, she thought her life was coming to an end. However, she later met her current partner and had another child. They work together planting corn and potatoes. Every day is a sacrifice because life in the mountains is sometimes difficult because of the changing climate. Feliciana wakes up at dawn every day to monitor her farmland. In addition, she raises sheep and sells her animals from time to time at the local fairs. Being a very enterprising woman, she has future plans to start growing peas because she learned that she can get a good market price for this product.

This is her first loan with MFP. She is grateful to everyone who maD. it possible for her to access a loan that allows her to keep working. Feliciana is glad to be working with a group that is very close and support of one another. She will use the money to buy sacks of compost and fertilizer needed to care for her land and prevent production problems that will impact her harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase compost & fertilizers

loans.name: Faustina

texts.es:
Faustina tiene 45 años, comparte su vida con su esposo Marcos y sus dos hijos; todos viven en su casa propia.

Desde hace 2 años se dedica a la venta de productos naturales y energéticos. Su rutina consiste en ofrecer sus productos mediante catálogos y muestras, dando a conocer los beneficios de cada uno, lo bueno de esto es que a Faustina no le resulta difícil la venta, puesto que posee un gran poder de convencimiento. Además está contenta porque este trabajo le da la ventaja de poder realizarlo según su tiempo disponible, ya que también debe velar por el bienestar de sus dos hijos, los cuales se encuentran estudiando y requieren de su ayuda. Para el futuro quiere seguir mejorando su negocio comprando una vitrina para colocarla en la puerta de su casa y donde pueda exhibir sus productos.

Este es el primer crédito de Faustina con MFP y espera ser muy puntual con todos los pagos. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más productos para tenerlos en stock y así aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Faustina, age 45, shares her life with her husband, Marcos, and their two children. They all live in their own house.

For 2 years she has been engaged in the sale of natural, energy enhancing products. Her routine consists of offering the products by means of catalogues and demonstrations, giving knowledge of the benefits of each one. The good thing about this is that Faustina doesn’t have difficulty making sales since she possesses great powers of persuasion. In addition, she is happy because she can carry out this work in her spare time since she also has to watch over her two children, who are students and require her help.

In the future, she wants to continue improving her business by buying a display case to set out in the doorway of her house so that she can exhibit her products. This is Faustina’s first loan with MFP, and she hopes to be very punctual with all the payments. With the money she is applying for she will buy more products to have in stock and, thus, increase her sales

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase of inventory.

loans.name: Salma's Group

texts.en:
Salma is the wife of A. L. and lives in the mid-sized city of Vehari in Pakistan. She owns a two-roomed brick house in which she has lived with her family for the past 22 years. She has nine children – four daughters and five sons. Her first three sons work in different barber shops for a monthly wage. The others are enrolled in a local school. Her husband owns and operates a tea stall in the food market where he also serves his customers with food items (biscuits and chips). He has been in this business for over five years.
Salma is a very skillful lady. She operates an embroidery business. She collects order from clothes shops and earns a profit after completing each embroidered dress. She uses her income to pay for utilities, but she also saves part of her income for her elder son's marriage, which will be held in December this year.
Salma has successfully repaid her first loan to Kiva partner, Asasah (a microfinance institution of Pakistan). Now she is requesting another loan for her husband to purchase items for his business such as milk, sugar, tea cups etc. in order to generate a good profit.

loans.use: To buy items for tea stall such as milk, sugar, teacups etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
Lucila B. is married and lives with her husband in the province of Rizal in the Philippines. She is an ambitious entrepreneur who has managed a doormat-making business in her community for almost 11 years. 

Lucila would like to receive a loan to purchase additional fabric made from different materials, including cottons, for her business inventory. She believes that having a greater variety and assortment of fabric will help her design different styles of doormats to match her clients’ particular design tastes. 

Since 1999, Lucila has been a loyal, dedicated, and proud member of Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), a Kiva microfinance partner in the Philippines. Lucila has demonstrated solid performance on her previous loans. 

Lucila’s dreams are to expand her business and eventually open her own doormat-making factory in her neighborhood. With the support of ASHI and Kiva lenders, she aspires to expand her business and generate steady income to support her family’s long term financial security.

loans.use: To purchase additional fabrics, cotton, and other materials for her doormat-making business.

loans.name: Kène Bougoul

texts.fr: Kène Bougoul F. est une femme âgée de 38 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants en charge. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis le 26 février 2006 et a reçu fois 7 de suite du crédit qu’elle a toujours bien remboursé.  Elle fait de l’embouche ovine et son nouveau prêt  lui permettra d’acheter 10 paires de moutons et de l’aliment de bétail pour engraisser les bêtes pendant au moins 4 mois et  les revendre dans les marchés hebdomadaires de sa localité. Les revenus générés par cette activité lui permettent de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille et de satisfaire ses besoins personnels.
texts.en:
Kène Bougoul F. is a 38 years old married mother, bringing up 4 children. She has been a member of the Village Bank since February 26, 2006 and she has successfully repaid all of her 7 loans. Kène raises sheep and her latest loan will allow her to buy 10 head of sheep and enough feed for the next 4 months. She will then sell the sheep at the weekly markets in her area. The profits from her business will help her husband meet the family finances and also provide for some of her personal needs.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sheep to raise

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
Mi nombre es: Catalina, tengo 66 años, nací y vivo en la ciudad de Iscuchaca, provincia de Anta y departamento del Cusco.   
Yo me dedico a la venta de emolientes;  el emoliente es una bebida utilizada con fines medicinales en Perú, Bolivia, Ecuador, Colombia y, en menor medida, el resto de Latinoamérica. Es una mezcla de infusiones: agua de cebada, linaza, boldo, alfalfa, cola de caballo y gotas de limón recién exprimido. Se toma preferentemente caliente o tibio. Se le atribuyen diferentes propiedades medicinales, ya sea para tratamiento del aparato digestivo, reproductor, respiratorio, circulatorio, etc. Es una bebida tradicional, que se encuentra en carretillas ambulantes. Es tradicional su consumo por la mañana (4:30 am - 8:30 am), o por la tarde (5:30 pm - 11:30 pm), aunque los horarios pueden variar según la zona. Yo tengo treinta y tres años en el negocio y me va muy bien y con las ganancias puedo educar a mis hijos y comprar alimento. Al inicio se me fue un poco difícil ya que no contaba con mucho capital, fue entonces que se me presento la oportunidad de perteneces al banco comunal de Arariwa el cual me brindo apoyo con préstamos de dinero y así pude empezar y así mejorar mi negocio.

Ahora que mi negocio va creciendo necesito más capital de negocio y requiere  el préstamo para comprar más insumos como hierbas medicinales.
texts.en:
My name is Catalina, and I am 66 years old. I live in Iscuchaca, the city where I was born, located in the province of Anta, in the department of Cusco. I sell emolientes for a living. An emoliente is a drink used for medicinal purposes in Peru, Bolivia, Ecuador, Colombia, and, to a lesser degree, the rest of Latin America. It is a mix of infusions: barley water, linseed, boldo (an herb native to South America), alfalfa, horse tail, and drops of fresh-squeezed lemon juice. Emolientes are preferably drunk either hot or warm. Different medicinal properties can be attributed to it, and one may drink an emoliente to treat any of the various systems of the body (digestive, reproductive, respiratory, etc). It is a traditional drink, and it commonly found for sale in street carts. It is traditional to consume it in the morning (4:30am – 8:30 am) or in the afternoon (5:30pm – 11:30 pm), although these hours can vary by region. I have already been selling emolientes for thirty-three years, and it is going well; I am able to educate my children and buy food with the profits. At the beginning, it was a little difficult for me, as I did not have much capital. It was then that I was presented with the opportunity to belong to the Arariwa community bank, which has offered me support with loans and allowed me to begin and improve my business. Now that my business is growing, I need more capital, and I will use this loan to buy more materials such as medicinal herbs.

Translated from Spanish by Mairead Harris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials such as medicinal herbs

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida S. is from the village of Eastern Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 44 years old. Nida is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Nida owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Nida has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Nida joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nida is requesting a  loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Nida from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of the family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Annalyn

texts.en:
Annalyn D. is from the village of Binuangan, Misamis Oriental. She is 31 years old. Annalyn is married and has four school-aged children. Annalyn owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling spices and vegetables in the local community. Annalyn has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2010, Annalyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid her last loan from HSPFI, which was for 5,000 PHP and was used to purchase additional products to sell.

Annalyn is now requesting her second loan from HSPFI, for 6,000 PHP, which will be used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & as working capital

loans.name: Vianora Petino

texts.pt:
VIAINORA C. nasceu na catembe um dos distritos  da capital mocambicana na provincia de Maputo .frequentou o seu ensino primario e secundario no mesmo distrito e passou depois a estudar na cidade de maputo onde fez o ensino pre-universitario.
Estuda e e faz negocio a mais de 5 anos,  onde atraves de vizinhas e amigas ouviu falar da Hluvuku tendo aproximado para solicitar o seu emprestimo. Com o presente credito no valor de 15.000.00mt pretende comprar produtos (arroz,acucar, cervejas,refrescos,feijao,amendoim e outros)para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria.
No futro pretende continuar com seus estudos e solicitar mais emprestimos para desenvolver ainda mais o seu nogocio.
texts.en:
Viainora was born in Catembe, one of the districts of the capital of Mozambique, in the province of Maputo. She went to elementary and middle school in the same district. Later she went to the city of Maputo for high school. She goes to school and has had her business for more than 5 years. She became familiar with Hluvuku through neighbors and friends. She came to request her loan. With the current loan in the amount 15,000 meticais she intends to purchase products (rice, sugar, beer, sodas, beans, peanuts and others) to increase her inventory. In the future, she intends to continue her studies and request more loans to expand her business even more.

Translated from Portuguese by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of products (rice, sugar, beer, sodas, beans, peanuts and others)

loans.name: Elver

texts.es:
El señor Elver vive en la zona de ciudadela ferroviaria de la ciudad de La Paz, esta casado tiene tres hijos; la esposa trabaja en una institución que vende nichos. Elver tiene un auto con el cual trabaja como transporte libre con el cual genera sus ingresos, es cliente de Impro con 5 créditos a la fecha, todos cancelados y es primera vez que forma parte de Kiva a través de este nuevo crédito que solicita, el cual será destinado a la reparación y mantenimiento de su taxi.

Por el carácter social puede acceder a un crédito nuevo.
texts.en:
Elver lives in the railway district of the city of La Paz. He is married and has three children. His wife works at a company that sells niche items. Elver has a car that he uses as a taxi to earn income. He has had five loans with Impro to date, all fully paid off, and this is his first time via Kiva. He plans to use the new loan he is requesting to make repairs and perform maintenance on his taxi. He qualifies to be approved for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Make repairs and perform maintenance on his taxi

loans.name: Gladys Zoraida

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MI PERU”; el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Santiago, provincia y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Gladys; ella tiene 23 años de edad y soltera y es natural de L.,  ella estudia administración turística y trabaja en un restaurante de nombre  “antojitos”;  desde hace 8 meses, La socia solicita el préstamo para ahorrar para sus estudios y su alquiler.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This client belongs to the communal bank, Mi Perú (My Peru). The bank is located in the district of Santiago, in the province and department of Cusco.

The client is Ms. Gladys. She is 23 years old, single, and is a native of L.. She studies touristic administration and has worked in a restaurant called Antojitos for the past 8 months. She is requesting the loan to save for her studies and her rent.

Gladys is grateful for those who are part of this dream and she promises to make her payments according to the established timeframe.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To save for her studies and her rent

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: The Kiva borrower is a 49-year-old married woman from Lebanon. A mother of four children, she has established a sewing business from her home. She has more than 20 years' experience as a talented seamstress. She produces all type of clothes according to the customer’s request. Today, she is requesting a loan of $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase tailoring supplies and textiles to offer a variety of products to her clientele. Her services are valued by customers in some of Lebanon’s suburban towns.  In the future, she is expecting to continue expansion of her business to earn more income and continue the education of her children.

loans.use: To purchase tailoring supplies and textiles

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth T., age 50, is from the town of Sindangan. She is married and has five children. To make a living, Elizabeth works in a family member's specialized retail store, a business that sells clothing and shoe products in the local community. Elizabeth has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Elizabeth joined PMPC to gain access to financial services. Her goal was to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Elizabeth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Elizabeth is requesT. a new loan of 50,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the ninth loan taken out by Elizabeth from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet A. has been selling variety of items as a wholesale trader in Mahanga village, in Vihiga, for 11 years. He has had a profit margin of KES13,500. She is married to Evans Ababu who is a primary school teacher, and they have two children age nine years, and six years.

Janet is applying for her second loan of KES 40,000 with KADET LTD. after she paid back her previous loan successfully. She intends to buy more stock of various items like plastic basins, jugs, and buckets worth KES 40,000 in bulk. She will sell the items to traders at wholesale price. She will use the anticipated profit invest back into the business to grow it and to be in a position of financial stability.

She desires to have a business with a capital base of one million KES.

loans.use: To buy more stock of various items like plastic basins,jugs, buckets worth KES 40,000.

loans.name: Azra's Group

texts.en:
Azra lives in Lahore which is Pakistan’s second largest city and famous for its food and culture.  She lives there with her family in an area named Mughalpura in a two-room brick house. 

She supports her family financially with her dye clothing business. She dyes specifically women's clothing. Her husband is also involved in the same business. He operates a little dye shop in the market where he dyes men's clothing.  In this way, they both generate income for the family. They have been in this business for the last ten years and have a good number of clients by providing good quality work at reasonable rates.

Azra has three sons and two daughters. All of them are enrolled in a school and are getting their education. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for their dye clothing businesses. With the loan, the couple will buy dyes in bulk which will help them provide better quality services to their clients and increease their income.  

Azra wants to save some money to buy a motorbike for her husband and she is hopeful that she will be able to do so with the help of an increased income.

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her fourth loan application. She has maintained good credit history in previous loan years and attended every meeting.  

Note: In the photo, Azra is the lady who is raising her hand.

loans.use: To buy dyes in bulk for dye clothing business

loans.name: Emiliana

texts.es: Emiliana, de 48 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Segundo de 65 años y sus 4 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Junto a su esposo, Emiliana trabaja todos los días en sus cultivos. Con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado que sus tierras sean muy productivas y ahora siembra de todo, ya que sabe que todo producto que obtenga será de calidad. Ella principalmente siembra cacao, café y hoja de coca, ya que estos son los productos que mejor se venden en el mercado. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus sembríos de las plagas que pueden afectarlas, lo cual reduciría mucho sus ganancias, lleva 20 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus cultivos, hasta la ciudad de San Francisco, ya que es ahí donde vende sus productos. Para el futuro de su negocio, espera juntar el dinero necesario para comprar nuevas tierras. Este es el segundo crédito con MFP, siente que este aporte le ayudará mucho en el desarrollo de su actividad. En su banco comunal es una socia, muy responsable, de lo cual se siente muy orgullosa. Los dos mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, los invertirá en mejorar sus cultivos, para ello comprará abono.
texts.en:
Emiliana, age 48, is a very unassuming and hard-working woman.  She lives in her own house with her 65 year old husband, Segundo, and their four beloved children.  She wants to give the children a better quality of live.  

Emiliana works together with her husband every day on their crops.  Through much effort she has managed to make her land very productive, and she now plants everything.  She knows that all of the products that she will get will be of good quality.  She primarily grows cacao, coffee, and coca leafs.  What she likes the most about her work is taking care of the plants so that they are not affected by pest infestations.  That would reduce their earnings.  

She has been doing this work for 20 years.  She thinks that the most difficult part is transporting her crops to the city of San Francisco, which is where she sells her products.  For the future of her business she hopes to get together the money needed to buy new land.

This is her second loan with MFP.  She feels that this assistance will help her a great deal in developing her work.  She is a very responsible member of her communal bank, and she is very proud of that.  She will use the requested 2,500 soles to improve her crops.  She will buy fertilizer to do so.

loans.use: To buy sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Italia

texts.es:
Italia tiene 55 años de edad, es casada y vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Pacasmayo, una zona comercial que se encuentra situada en la provincia del mismo nombre, en la región La Libertad, a más de dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la comercialización de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega instalada en su domicilio. El negocio ya cuenta con una antigüedad de tres años y gracias a el puede ayudar a su esposo a sacar adelante la economía de su familia. Su clientela se encuentra fidelizada debido a que siempre les ofrece productos de buena calidad y un trato amable.

Italia desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más productos de modo que pueda aumentar su nivel de ventas y percibir mayores ganancias, para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles. 

Ella es una mujer bastante trabajadora y que siempre vela por el bienestar de su familia. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria para sacarlos adelante.
texts.en:
Italia is 55 years old.  She is married and lives with her family in Pacasmayo district, a commercial district which is located in the province of Pacasmayo, in La Libertad region, more than two hours from the city of Chiclayo which is the capital of Lambayeque region.

Italia sells convenience store products and groceries in a small grocery store which is located in her home.  Her business is three years old and, thanks to her business, she has been able to help her husband to improve their family finances.  She has loyal customers owing to the fact that she always offers them good quality products and kind service.

Italia would like to expand her business, buying more products so that she can increase her sales and make more profits.  In order to achieve her goal she has approached Edpyme Alternativa to request a loan for 2,000 nuevos soles.

Italia is quite a hard-working woman who is always looking out for her family's well-being.  Her greatest wish is to continue growing as a businesswoman and to get her family ahead in life.

loans.use: To buy convenience store items and groceries to expand her grocery store

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, es un una madre de familia trabajadora de carácter noble, vive en su casa propia, en compañía de su hijo Franco de 11 años. El trabajo al que Rosa se dedica, es la venta de zapatos y los fines de semana dende platillos criollos en la puerta de su casa. Ambos negocios le va muy bien. Pero el negocio que le da mayor importancia es la venta de zapatos, puesto que le es rentable, ya que son mucho los clientes quienes siempre le hacen pedido de esta mercadería. Es por ello que constantemente acude al mercado mayorista del centro de Lima, donde encuentra variedad de zapatos a precios módicos. En adelante desea adquirir un puesto de zapatos, en algún mercado, para así mejorar su calidad de vida. Este es su 16avo crédito con MFP y se compromete pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, para evitar futuras complicaciones a su banco comunal, en donde es muy apreciada. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará mayor cantidad de zapatos con la finalidad de tener un stock y de ese modo tener variedad que ofrecer.
texts.en: Rosa is a hardworking mother and an upstanding woman, who lives in her own home along with her son Franco, who is 11 years old.  Rosa has a business selling shoes, and on the weekends she sells Creole food from the door of her house.  Both of these businesses are doing very well.  But the most important business for her is the shoe selling business; it is profitable, since she has many customers who always order her merchandise.  For this reason, she is constantly going to the wholesale market in the center of Lima, where she can find a variety of shoes at affordable prices.  In the future she wants to acquire a stall in a market where she can sell her shoes, to improve her quality of life.  This is her 16th loan with MFP and she is committed to making all of her payments on time so she can avoid future problems with her communal bank, where she is well respected.  With the loan she requests she will buy a greater quantity of shoes with the goal of increasing her inventory and, in this way, having a greater variety of shoes to offer her customers.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of shoes to have in stock for her business

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es:
Doña María Cristina, de 50 años de edad, reside en San Miguel, vende papas fritas, tostadas de plátano y bebidas refrescantes, vive sola por que sus hijos ya son mayores y formaron sus propios hogares, ella ubica el negocio en la terminal de buses ya que es un lugar donde mucha gente que viaja llega hasta ahí para tomar el autobús. 
Ella quiere comprar mercadería para aumentar su venta ya que en momentos tiene poco inventario y prepara poca venta perdiendo tal vez de ganar más, con este préstamo está en la disposición de producir más y ver la posibilidad de tener mejores ganancias, ya que en San Miguel están de fiesta y la movilización de la gente es mayor.
Quiere contar con salud principalmente para desempeñar su trabajo y poder pagar puntualmente el préstamo e ir aumentando su negocio y ganancias.
texts.en:
María Cristina, 50, lives in San Miguel.  She sells potato chips, fried plantain chips and beverages.  She lives alone because her children are grown and have made their own homes.

She has located her business at the bus terminal because it is a place where many travelers come to take the bus.  María Cristina wants to buy merchandise to increase her sales because at times her inventory is low, and her sales are low, so perhaps she is losing out on earning more.  With the loan, she will be able to produce more and possibly have greater earnings, since now is a holiday time in San Miguel and people are traveling more.

Mainly, she wants to be healthy so she can do her job and pay off the loan on time, and so she can make her business and earnings grow.

loans.use: Buy potatoes, plantains, sodas and juices

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
Rosa de 33 años, es una mujer trabajadora que desde que trabajo en una panadería comenzó a reunir dinero para tener su propio negocio ya que tenía la experiencia en hacer panes. 

Viviendo en una zona urbana llamada Guasmo ha trabajado en la pequeña panadería que ahora tiene y en la actualidad trabaja desde las 06h00am hasta las 22h00pm. Vende los panes a $ 0.08 c/u, el litro de leche a $ 0.80, el queso entero a $ 2.80. Aunque trabaja sola quiere continuar con su negocio para mantener a sus 4 hijos de 11, 9, 5, 4 años. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar harina y un horno para poder hornear más panes y dulces y así tener más clientela. En el futuro quiere que su negocio sea más grande para tener mas clientela.
texts.en:
Rosa is 33 years old.  She is a hard-working woman who used to work in a bakery and started to gather together money to set up her own business since she had experience making bread.

Rosa lives in an urban area called Guasmo.  She has worked in the small bakery that she now owns and she currently works from 6.00am to 10.00pm.  She sells her bread at $0.08 each, a liter of milk at $0.80 and a whole cheese at $2.80.  Although she works alone, she would like to continue in her business to support her four children aged 11, 9, 5 and 4.

Rosa will use her loan to buy flour and an oven so that she can bake more bread and sweet treats so that she can attract more customers.  In the future, she would like to expand her business and have more customers.

loans.use: To buy flour and an oven

loans.name: Shabana's Group

texts.en:
Shabana lives in Lahore, which is the second largest city of Pakistan and famous for its history and culture. She lives there with her family in the area of Mughalpura in a 3-roomed house. 

A talented lady, Shabana operates an embroidery business at her home. She makes embroidered dresses for her neighboring clients and earns well after completing them. She is the mother of 2 sons and 3 daughters. All of them study, except the youngest one who is only 2 years old.  
Her husband’s name is M. and he is a painter by profession. He paints walls, doors and windows on contract and generates income for the family. 

Shabana has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her embroidery business. With the loan, she will purchase embroidery material such as beads, colored thread and clothes in bulk to offer more embroidered variety to her customers and to make more income. She has been operating this business for over 9 years and she is hopeful that an investment will bring more profits for her. She is a new loan applicant of Asasah. 

Note: “In the photo, the lady with a raising hand is Shabana”.

loans.use: To buy embroidery supplies for embroidery business.

loans.name: Yasmeen Muhammad Ameen's Group

texts.en:
Yasmeen is 25 years old, married to M. A. and does not have a child yet. She lives in Arifwala, a small Pakistani city located in Punjab, and known for its dairy industry. She lives in a three-roomed house to which she moved six years ago.
Yasmeen is a scrap dealer. She operates her business from home and sells different items such as iron, plastic bottles etc. She is also a very good housewife and carries out her household responsibilities very well. Yasmeen's husband sells crockery from a shop in the market. His younger brother also works with him and supports him in his business. His shop sells all sorts of crockery such as plastic, steel and glass.
Yasmeen has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy crockery in bulk to sell through his shop. Yasmeen is hopeful that the loan investment will be helpful for her husband and will increase his monthly profit. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. In her previous loan year, she had good credit behavior and never missed a meeting.
Note: In the photo, the lady with the book (an Asasah Passbook) is Yasmeen.

loans.use: To buy crockery for resale

loans.name: Khy

texts.en:
Khy S., 41, is married and lives with her five young children in the Prey Veng province. She is a farmer who works for less than $1 each day, while her husband is a construction worker making about $10 each day. The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year, and inflation has caused food prices to skyrocket. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Khy S. included. 

In light of these economic difficulties, she is asking for a loan of $1,200 to purchase more land to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy a plot of land to expand her farm

loans.name: Mirella Marina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PATRON SAN SEBASTIAN”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac, provincia de Cusco, Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Mirella; La socia tiene 37 años de edad, la socia es soltera,  y tiene 2 hijos (el menor de 6 años de edad);  la socia es arquitecta de profesión y realiza diversos proyectos, ella desea invertir el préstamo de este banco en la compra de maquinas y de papel, ella desea hacer los planos y diseños y para lo cual requiere una máquina y papeles en diferentes tamaños. La socia invertirá el préstamo en la compra de una máquin y papeles.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Mirella is a member of the “PATRON SAN SEBASTIAN” community bank which is located in Huanchac district, in Cusco province, in Cusco department.

Mirella is 37 years old, single, and has two children (her youngest is 6 years old).  She is an architect by profession and carries out a number of projects.  She would like to invest her loan in buying machines and paper.  She would like to make plans and designs, for which she needs a machine and different sizes of paper.  She will invest her loan in buying a machine and papers.

Mirella is happy to be receiving her loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy a machine and papers

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes Q. is married and has four children. Agnes fries “poolo” (local name) at Abura for sale. “Poolo” is made from flour, grated coconut, sometimes sugar is added and nutmeg. It is deep-fried. 

Agnes husband is a farmer. Agnes uses her income to help her husband pay school fees and utility bills. Demand for the "poolo" is increasing and she is requesting a loan to purchase more ingredients to be able to produce on a larger scale for sale.

Her increased profit will be reinvest back into her business.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients to make local delicacy.

loans.name: Josue Antonio

texts.es: Jose Antonio P.: de 23 añosel Trabaja en la Municipalidad de su localidad como encargado de bodega, pero aparte de eso tiene su negocio, que es venta de computadoras y venta de repuestos para las mismas, el nos cuenta que le a hido muy bien en este negocio porque le deja ganacias muy faborables, aparte de eso en sus dias y ratos libres arregla celulares, el solicita el credito para la compra de computadoras y repuestos para las mismas ya que nos cuenta que nececita mas capital para trabajar y asi poder aumentar mas su ganancia, su sueño es ampliar mas su ganancia.y estar mejor economicamente.
texts.en:
Josue is 23 years old and works in the municipal government of his locality, in charge of a warehouse. Apart from that, he has a business selling computers and their replacement parts. He tells us that the business is going very well and he is earning very favorable profits.  In addition, on his days off and during his free time, he repairs cellular phones.

Josue requests a loan to buy computers and replacement parts.  He needs the money to keep his business going and augment his earnings.  His dream is to enhance his income and improve himself economically.

loans.use: TO BUY COMPUTERS AND THEIR REPLACEMENT PARTS TO SELL

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en:
Mrs. Meriam M. is 40 years old, married and lives at Upper Langcangan Oroquieta City. She has two adult children. 

Her husband is a tricycle driver. (A tricycle is a motorcycle with a passenger cab.)

Determination and hard work are what Mrs. M. believes in. She joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative to avail herself of its loan facilities. The coop teaches its members to have a "livelihood project," or business, in order to become productive and self-reliant. At this time, her husband drives a tricycle they bought with a loan that they have since paid off. 

Now, she is applying for PHP 45,000 to buy additional goods for sale and a franchise for their tricycle.

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy additional goods for sale and a franchise for their tricycle

loans.name: Utuoge Faalolo

texts.en:
Utuoge Faalolo P. is 72 years old, married, and has three children. She owns and operates a business selling pancakes, which she has been doing for two years. Utuoge Faalolo is requesting a loan of 1,000 WST, which she will use to purchase raw ingredients needed to make pancakes.  She plans to use the profit from her business, estimated to be $83 per week, to improve and expand her business.

In 2011, Utuoge Faalolo joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Utuoge Faalolo's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make pancakees

loans.name: Nieta Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Nieta, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 45 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Boumoutou, sous préfecture de Fana ; Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de beurre de karité, d’oignons, de galettes, d’habits et des articles divers de boutique.                                                                                                                               
Les femmes du groupe Nieta sont à leur premier prêt solidaire. 
La cliente AWA compte acheter de l’oignon avec les grossistes du marché de Fana. Elle effectue sa vente au village, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée  essentiellement de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 10 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, payer les contributions des cérémonies sociales et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de commerce.
texts.en:
The women of the Nieta group, all married, are on average 45 years old with 5 children. They all live in traditional extended families in the village of Boumoutou in the Fana sub-prefecture of the Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).
They got to know each other through family, neighbors, and friends. They retail Shea butter, onions, patties, clothing and various store articles.
This is the first solidarity group for the women of the Nieta group.
The client named AWA intends to purchase onions from the wholesalers at the Fana market. She retails in the village, for cash or credit, to a clientele mostly comprised of women.
She is planning on an average monthly benefit of 10,000 CFA, to be used to repay the loan, contribute to social ceremonies, with the remainder to be reinvested in her retail activity.

loans.use: to purchase onions.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is 68 years old. She has 6 children who are between the ages of 28 and 37 years old. She is a widow and she has always taken care of her children. She sells different kinds of food stuffs and she has been selling food stuffs for the past 12 years. Her business is moving on well. She is requesting a loan to buy more food items such as beans, sorghum, wheat flour, etc.

loans.use: to purchase food items.

loans.name: Mercedes Concepcion

texts.es:
En la parroquia Quiroga de la  ciudad de Calceta, localidad donde la gente se dedica en gran parte a la agricultura, cría de animales  y a la venta de sus productos, se reúne cada quince días  El Banco Comunal Quiroga.

Aquí conocimos a la señora Mercedes. Tiene 54  años de edad, está casada y  fruto de esta relación tiene cuatro hijos, todos mayores pero una de sus hijas que es madre soltera vive con ella, allí también vive con ellos su pequeña nieta la misma que es la ilusión de nuestra amiga. Su esposo es chofer de taxi.

Ella es un ama de casa que para generar ingresos para el bienestar de su familia  tiene una pequeña granja de pollos y chanchos, ella compra tanto los pollos como los chanchos cuando están pequeños, los cría por tres a cuatro meses y cuando tienen un peso adecuado los ofrece a los comerciantes que llegan hasta su casa a comprar sus productos, trabaja todos los días de tres a cuatro horas diarias en el cuidado y alimentación de sus animales, su hija y su esposo le ayudan de vez en cuando, nos cuenta que lleva más de 15 años dedicada a esta actividad y le ha ido muy bien siempre.
 
Este crédito para comprar  pollos, cerdos, alimentos y medicinas para sus animales. Es socia del Banco Comunal hace siete años y le gusta  la facilidad que dan para realizar los pagos.
 
Su sueño  tener un local donde vender sus productos directamente al consumidor.
texts.en:
The “Quiroga” communal bank meets every two weeks in Quiroga Parish in the city of Calceta, a place where its residents are for the most part farmers and raise livestock and sell their production.

We met Mercedes, 54, here.  She is married and has four children, all adults.  However, one of her daughters is a single mother and lives with her.  Her little granddaughter, who is our friend’s thrill, also lives with her.  Her husband’s a taxi driver.

She is a housewife who in order to generate income for her family’s wellbeing has a small farm raising chickens and pigs.  She buys both the chickens and the pigs when they are little, raises them for three or four months and when they reach adequate weight she sells them to merchants that come by her house to buy her products.  She works every day from three to four hours daily caring for and feeding her animals.  Her daughter and husband help her occasionally.  She tells us that she’s been in this line of work for over 15 years and has always done very well.

This loan is to buy chicks, piglets, feed and medicine for her animals.  She’s been a member of the communal bank for seven years and she likes the easy payment plans.  Her dream is to have a locale in order to sell her products direct to the consumer.

loans.use: to buy chicks, pigs, feed and medicine for them.

loans.name: Boniface

texts.en:
Boniface is 31 years old and a blacksmith businessman married to Catherine, who is a farmer. They are blessed with three children ages 15, 9 and 4 years old, respectively. He makes things like stoves, cooking pots and pans.  

He has been in this business for the past five years with a monthly income of 20,000 KES, which he uses to support his family members. He is applying for his third loan with KADET Ltd. after repaying the previous loans successfully. Boniface will use the loan to purchase more scrap metals to increase his stock.  

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children.  His hopes and dreams are to open a wholesale shop and live a stable life with his family.

loans.use: to purchase more scrap metals to increase his stock

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is 42 years old and lives in Paynesville.  She attended school and is a high school graduate. She is married and her husband is a teacher.  They have three children between the ages of 4 and 19.  They all live at home and go to school.
