Annie sells cold drinks including water and sodas.  She is proud that her business is going well and likes to meet new people through her business.  She started the business with her own savings.

She’s requesting a loan to purchase more goods for sale including charcoal. She would like expand her business and support her children.

loans.use: to purchase more goods for sale including charcoal.

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en: Sophal is 32 years old and works in a factory for $3.5 per day. She is a single mother with one child, who is 11 years old. Sophal lives with her sister and child. Every month, she has to spend $50 on food, $15 on school fees, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $500 to buy some farmland for farming during the rainy season. In the future, she wants to sell cosmetics to her friends at the factory, so that she can earn more income to support her son's studies.

loans.use: to buy farmland for farming.

loans.name: Hector Eduardo

texts.es:
Héctor, vive con su esposa y tres hijos, empleado de una agencia de seguridad y ademas es agricultor, cultiva maíz y frijoles,  dicho negocio surgió por su propia iniciativa trabaja todos los días y no tiene horario fijo para atender a sus clientes de agricultura.
El esta solicitando un préstamo para la compra de abono, pesticidas y otros fertilizantes para el cultivo, esta compra le permitirá garantizar la siembra y darles un mejor producto a sus clientes.
Su objetivo es mejorar los ingresos para apoyar a su familia con los gastos más necesarios.
texts.en:
Hector lives with his wife and their three children. He is employed by a security agency and he is also an agriculturist who cultivates corn and beans. He started out his business under his own initiative, working every day and not working under a fixed schedule in attending his agricultural customers.

The loan which he requests will be used to purchase fertilizers, pesticides, and other types of fertilizers for the cultivations. This purchase will help him guarantee the plantation and to provide his clients with a better products.

His objective is to improve his income in order to support his family with the most necessary expenses.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticides for his cultivation.

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.en:
Eulalia is married to a patient and hardworking farmer who is the father of their two children. They are both helping each other to sustain their family's needs. She describes herself as a small but loving wife and mother.

Eulalia manages her sari-sari store where she sells vinegar, soy sauce, catsup, noodles, coffee, sugar and bread. She also sells various snacks like pancakes and juice in their village’s school canteen.

According to Eulalia, through the income generated from her business she had been able to give weekly allowances to her children in school. She is happy now that her two children have graduated from college and are looking for work suitable to their degrees.

Eulalia wishes for a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy San Mig Light beer and soft drinks to sell in her sari-sari store. Her goal is to repair her house which was damaged in the previous typhoon.

loans.use: to buy San Mig Light beer and soft drinks to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
Maribel de 38 años, tiene mas de 10 años confeccionando prendas de ropa, tiene su clientela que la conocen hace mucho tiempo, ella es casada con Fredis quien es maestro constructor, el tiene trabajo por obras, y de forma independiente, viven en un sector periurbano de Guayaquil-ecuador, llamado Isla Trinitaria. Sus 3 hijos son estudiantes de una institución fiscal cerca de su hogar.
Ella hace todo tipo de ropa y según temporadas, por ejemplo uniformes en la época de clases, tiene el taller de costura en la parte alta de su casa. 
Para continuar con su trabajo necesita un préstamo para comprar telas, hilos y terminar de arreglar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Maribel, thirty-eight, has been making clothing for more than ten years.  She has clientele that have known her for a long time.  She's married to Fredis, a self-employed builder who does construction projects. They live in a peri-urban area of Guayaquil, Ecuador called Isla Tinitaria.  Their three children are in public school close to home.

Maribel makes all kinds of clothing, depending on the time of year. For example, she makes uniforms during the school year. She has a sewing studio upstairs in her house. In order to keep working she needs a loan to buy fabric and thread and to fix up her house.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Montazer

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 22-years-old, single and lives with three family members; two of them work.

Montazer has been an owner of a mobile phone shop since 2008, selling mobile phones and accessories. He worked with his brother for three years in this field so he has good experience and has a good reputation. His shop is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by.

He is requesting a $2700 loan in order to purchase a computer, to make a digital ads and to renovate his shop. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to purchase a computer, to make a digital ads and to renovate his shop.

loans.name: John Patrick

texts.en: John Patrick is a 57-year-old married man with six children. He is living in a permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. His dream is to become a role model farmer in his area of residence. John's major challenge has been high transport fees when taking his produce to the markets. He needs the loan to buy farm inputs.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Uuganbayar

texts.en: Uuganbayar is 30 years old and lives with her husband and 3 kids in a ger, Mongolian yurt, in Huvsgul province of Mongolia. Her husband builds houses and helps her part time. Two kids are in school and the other one is in kindergarden. She started her business in 2000 by sewing deel, the Mongolian traditional wear in remote areas.  In 2010, she started running a tailoring business in a central area of the province and became well known for her sewing skill. She is a capable and responsible woman who says "I love what I do and more importantly, people acknowledge my work".  She is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to buy more sewing materials.

loans.use: To buy more sewing materials

loans.name: Mapera B Group

texts.en:
Receive greetings from Mapera B Group in Western Kenya! George is the facilitator of the Mapera B group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

George is a father of five children. He joined One Acre Fund in order to have additional maize profits to ensure food security to his family and access fertilizer and hybrid seeds. In the recent 2011 season, George had an excellent maize yield, harvesting 10 bags on 1/2 an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, George was only able to harvest 3 bags of maize on 1/2 an acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to George and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, George will educate his children, ensure food security, and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Mapera B group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

Picture
George is pictured with his group members in the photograph.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Akouavi

texts.fr:
Akouavi est une femme âgé(e) de 56 ans. Elle est veuve et n’a pas d’enfants.
Akouavi travaille comme revendeuse de bouillie (une nourriture faite à base de mais)  depuis 2001. Elle sert ses clients à la maison et vend seule. Akouavi a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter du maïs et du sucre. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité
Dans les prochaines années, Akouavi voudrait élargir  en ajoutant d’autres activités. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit s’occuper de sa famille.
texts.en: Akouavi is a 56-year-old woman. She is a widow and doesn't have any children. Akouavi works selling bouillie (a type of corn porridge). She has been in this business since 2001. She serves her customers from her home and makes her sales alone Akouavi has requested her first loan from WAGES to buy corn and sugar. She would like to re-invest in her business. Over the coming years, Akouavi would like to expand, adding other activities. She says that she plans to use her profits to take care of her family.

loans.use: to buy corn and sugar

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
Hong is a 46-year-old married woman with two daughters. They live in Ho Chi Minh City.

For over ten years, Hong has been operating a general store selling basic household necessities and many kinds of instant food to people in her community. She would like to take a loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of goods in bulk to stock her store. She hopes that this will enable her to attract more customers and increase the turnover of her business.

Hong hopes that through her loan she will be able to improve her family's living conditions and set aside savings for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods and food for her general store

loans.name: Munhertunts

texts.en: Munhertunts is 30 years old and lives with her husband and two kids in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Bayanhongor Province in western Mongolia. Her husband is a herder, her elder child is a school student, and other one goes to kindergarden. She started her dairy product retailing business in 2009 by renting a counter in a market. Before that, she used to sell her dairy products directly to the wholesalers. Now that she sells her products herself, it is much more profitable, however her produced dairy products are not enough to run a whole counter. She is requesting 1,200,000 to rent a cellarage to stock her dairy products.

loans.use: To rent a cellarage

loans.name: C9335 Abishyizehamwe Group

texts.en: Grace is 34 years old and has three children, aged between 4 and 10 years old. She owns a clothes business, which is open from 6am until 6pm every day. She is the leader of the group, which is called "C9335 Abishyizehamwe" in the local language. Grace has two years of experience in this business. Grace has requested a loan from Kiva lenders, via Vision Finance Company, in order to purchase more clothes to sell. With the profit, she expects to save money for her future, to pay her children's school fees and to renovate house.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for sewing.

loans.name: Mwikali

texts.en:
Mwikali is a married woman with six children, all of whom are grown up. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past four years, she has operated a greengrocery business, selling to local residents. In addition, she sells charcoal which contributes another source of income. She faces a major challenge of price fluctuation in her business. She dreams of becoming a wholesale supplier in the future.

With the KES 60,000 loan, she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Dios Proveera 5, 6 & 8 Group

texts.en:
Memena is a member of the group called Dios Proveera 5,6 & 8 (God Will Provide). Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding La Romana, where the economy is dominated by the sugarcane industry. She is excited to be taking her sixth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and expanded her business.

Memena plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling miscellaneous products like local candy and medicine. She will purchase coconuts, sugar, milk and peanuts, to prepare local candies as well as purchase vitamin pills and and other medicine (for headache, stomachache and minor relief) that she could sell without prescription.

She will use the profits to reinvest in her business and save for her children's education and to purchase her own house. She wants to have an improved business that will provide enough support for her family's needs. She is a mother of five children, two of whom live together with Memena and her long-term partner. She enjoys serving to the Lord and to do business.

Memena thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy coconuts, peanuts, sugar, milk, and medicine

loans.name: Eder

texts.es:
Eder de 24 años, convive con Luz, con quien tiene a sus 2 hijas: Seicy de 2 años y Camila de 2 meses, sus grandes tesoros. Vive en una casa propia con su familia, en la comunidad nativa de San Pablo de Shaoriato, en el distrito de Pichanaki, provincia de Chanchamayo. Eder es un hombre de negocios y muy trabajador. Se dedica a la agricultura en sus 2 parcelas de terrenos siembra café y kión. En la zona de San Pablo el kión es muy solicitado por las bondades de sus tierras y climas. Es así que cada año Eder cosecha 17 mil kilos, los que vende con éxito en la ciudad de Pichanaki. A Eder le gusta su trabajo, por ser más independiente y sobretodo porque sus ingresos dependen de su propio esfuerzo. Para agilizar su trabajo contrata personal que le ayuden a posear (acumular tierra alrededor de las plantas), desyerbar y sembrar sus cultivos. Cuando tiene alguna urgencia económica, cosecha el kión sin madurar llamado “Chikión”, que también es solicitado, pero su precio es un poco más bajo.
El piensa sembrar otros productos como el maíz para el próximo mes, para eso alquilará terrenos de vecinos o amigos. Sería la primera vez que Eder accedería a un préstamo de MFP. Se responsabiliza de ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas. Se siente contento de pertenecer al banco comunal “Los Norionkis de San Pablo”.
Con el dinero del crédito podrá pagar a los operarios que contratará para la limpieza y cultivos de sus tierras.
texts.en:
Eder, 24, lives with Luz, and together they have 2 daughters who are their greatest treasures: Seicy, who is 2 years old, and Camila, who is 2 months old.  They live in their own home in the indigenous community of San Pablo de Shaoriato, in the Pichanaki district of the province of Chanchamayo.  Eder is a very hardworking businessman.  He farms 2 parcels of land, cultivating coffee and ginger.  Ginger from the San Pablo area is highly sought after, because the land and climate there is very good for growing it.  For this reason every year, Eder harvests 17,000 kilos, which he successfully sells in the city of Pichanaki.  Eder enjoys his work because he can be more independent, and most of all because his income depends upon his own efforts.  In order to facilitate his work, he hires people to help him put soil around the plants, weed and plant his crops.  When he has an urgent need for cash, he harvests the immature ginger, called “Chikión,” which is also in demand, although the price is lower.  

He is planning to plant other products such as corn in the next month, and to do this he will rent some land from neighbors or friends.  This will be the first time that Eder will take a loan through MFP.  He will be responsible for making his payments on time.  He is pleased to belong to the communal bank “Los Norionkis de San Pablo."

With the money from this loan, he will be able to pay for workers that he will hire to clear and cultivate his lands.

loans.use: to hire workers

loans.name: Rene Arturo

texts.es:
René Arturo de 43 años de edad, casado, vive en la Colonia Cerrito Lindo en la periferia de San Pedro sula, tiene 4 hijos dos de ellos son mayores de edad y dos son menores. 
Don René, hace diez años estableció un negocio de venta de tortillas de maíz.  Para la elaboración de tortillas le apoya su esposa y su hija, y él se transporta en bicicleta a venderlas a domicilio. Vende tortillas normales  y para tacos. Es un negocio muy rentable y es de consumo básico y diario. Le dedica diez horas diarias. Este préstamo que actualmente solicita es el segundo y lo va invertir en compra de materia prima como harina de maíz para la elaboración de tortillas. Con el préstamo anterior hizo arreglos en la cocina y ahora piensa terminar de construir unos apartamentos para alquilar y recibir otros ingresos.
texts.en:
René Arturo is 43 years old and married.  He lives in the Colonia Cerrito Lindo in the outskirts of San Pedro Sula.  He has four children; two adults and two minors.

Ten years ago René established a business of selling corn tortillas.  His wife and his daughter help him make the tortillas.  He uses his bicycle to sell them door-to-door.  He sells regular tortillas and for tacos.  It is a very profitable business, and it is a staple food eaten every day.  He works ten hours a day in the business.

The loan he is currently requesting is his second.  He will use it to buy raw materials like corn flour to make tortillas.  He used his previous loan to make repairs in the kitchen.  Now he plans to finish building some apartments to rent to get other income.

loans.use: to buy corn flour to make tortillas.

loans.name: Akouegnon Group

texts.fr: Le groupe AKOUEGNON  est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans la même maison. Cécile Seive, la représentante du groupe (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 36  ans est mariée à un tailleur du nom de Pascal. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Cécile Seive vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par Cécile Seive et son mari. Pour cette raison, Cécile Seive vend des poissons depuis une vingtaine d’année ans.  Cécile Seive s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Cécile Seive sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe AKOUEGNON  , un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter des cartons de poissons.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr: Les membres du groupe BENKADI sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  48 ans, 2 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à GOUROKO, commune de FARAKO, cercle de KOLONDIEBA, une des préfectures de la 3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés. La spéculation cultivée est: le mais avec MOUMINE la 1ère personne à gauche sur la photo position debout. Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labours pour exploiter: 6 hectares. La production est vendue à KOLONDIEBA après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 360 000F cfa qui la permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

loans.use: Achat d’intrants, de semences et frais de labours pour la campagne agricole.

loans.name: Roza

texts.en:
Roza is 61 years old housekeeper woman, from village Chaladidi. She lives with her daughter and grandson. To take care of her family's increased needs, Roza had been involved in agribusiness. She breeds 4 cows and also harvests maize seasonally. Roza sells agricultural products at the local market and gets some income. However the family lives under poverty as the income is hardly enough for satisfying all family needs. Roza wants to make another source of income and start new type of business with the loan, that she had requested among local financial institutions. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a joint initiative by Kiva and Credo. The startup loan program envisages provisions for business startups and re-startup credits with soft conditions for the country's rural poor, who, regarded as "high risk borrowers" because of their low income, do not have access to credit products. With the received credit, Roza will purchase stock of various home products, such as bed linens, mattresses, utensils and will sell in her community in increased prices. 
The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva startup loan, will significantly increase the family's income. Roza will be able to generate more income and expand the business in the future with opening a store. She awaits Kiva lenders' support and kindness.

loans.use: To start trading business with various home products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Peninah would like to buy chicks

loans.name: Matilda

texts.en:
Matilda is a big-time businesswoman who deals in General Merchandise in her locality at Jogis Estates in Ghana. She supplies household items including beverages to a lot of customers in her vicinity.

Matilda is a client of Kraban Support Foundation and has benefited from the TEACH lending program since 1997. She requires a KIVA loan of $975 to improve her business.

loans.use: Working CAPITAL

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.en:
My name is Maria V., and I have dedicated myself to making sweet bread and small pizzas for the past two years. My customers are excellent; I sell my pizzas at a school cafeteria and my sweet bread at various stores and businesses in my neighborhood. My goal is to have a higher sales volume, and with my earning I'll be able to afford my daughter's education (she's in second grade) and provide for my family.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Mi nombre es Maria Velassques me dedico a la fabricacion de tortas de pan dulce y pizzas pequeñas, tengo mi negocio hace unos 2 años, mis clientes son excelentes ya que mis pizzas las vendo a una cafeteria de una escuela, y mis tortas de pan dulce las vendo en diferentes pulperias y necogios que estan cerca de mi casa de habitacion, mi meta es tener un mayor volumen de ventas y con las ganancias que obtenga poder pagarle los estudios a mi hija que esta en segundo grado y tambien alimentar mi familia.

loans.use: Purchase wheat flour, salt, sugar, cheese, ham, tomato sauce, yeast, lard, margarine, oil, food coloring and water.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.en:
Gregoria has 2 children. She used to work in a private house, but then decided to form her own business, which she will start with this loan. She will supply herself with products from Natura International, which sells natural products.

Also, she plans to have her husband, who has a motorcycle that he uses to transport people around the community, collect the revenues that she initially might extend on credit.

We bid her farewell, and expect that this new business will assist the D. R. family in supporting themselves and move out of the poverty they seem to live in now.

loans.use: She wants to buy natural source based medicines to distribute

location.town: Jesus Primero community of Los Alcarrizo

loans.name: Ni Komang Wati

texts.id:
Pig farming has been the preoccupation of Komang Wati for a while. With a capital of Rp750,000 (about US$83), Komang Wati raised a mother pig. This pig was raised very simple and traditional. The food given was a mixture of rice shell clippings and pounded banana tree trunk . That pig was fed 2x/day, and the feed expenses per pig is Rp6500 (about 72 cents). In 4 months the pig gave birth to 9 piglets. She sold them for Rp1,575,000 (about $172) at Rp175,000(about $18)X9. After subtarcting Rp1,000,000 (about $110), her profit from this sale is Rp575,000 (about $62). She usd the profit to pay for her child's schooling expenses, who now sits in 7th grade; also to pay for other Komang Wati's household expenses, since her tenant farmer husband does not have a steady income. With a loan from Dinari in the amount of Rp1,300,000 (about $145), Komang Wati could expand her business, and expect to buy another mother pig for Rp800,000 (about $88), and 1 piglet for fattening for Rp250,000 (about $27.50); and the rest to buy animal feed. Komang Wati hopes that she could increase her profit, and make her family more prosperous.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Usaha beternak babi sudah ditekuni Komang Wati sejak lama .Dengan modal awal sebesar Rp.750.000, Komang Wati memelihara 1 ekor babi penginduk. Babi ini dipelihara dengan sangat sederhana dan tradisional. Makanan yang diberikan adalah campuran dedak padi dengan batang pisang yang sudah ditumbuk. Babi tersebut diberi makan 2 kali dalam satu hari sehingga biaya yang diperlukan untuk satu ekor babi tersebut sebesar Rp.6.500. Dalam waktu 4 bulan babi ini sudah melahirkan anaknya sebanyak 9 ekor, Dan laku dijual seharga Rp.1.575.000 (@ 175.000 x 9 ) ,dari penjualan ini diperoleh keuntungan sebesar Rp.575.000 ,Setelah dikurangi biaya sebesar Rp. 1.000.000 selama enam bulan. Keuntungan ini dipergunakan untuk biaya sekolah satu orang anaknya yang kini duduk dikelas 1 SMP, dan juga untuk memenuhi kebutuhan rumah tangga Komang Wati mengingat suaminya seorang petani yang penghasilannya tidak pasti setiap bulan. Dengan adanya pinjaman dari Dinari sebesar Rp. 1.300.000 Komang Wati dapat mengembangkan usahanya dengan membeli 1 ekor penginduk lagi seharga Rp.800.000 dan 1 ekor bibit babi penggemukan seharga Rp.250.000 ,sedangkan sisanya digunakan untuk menambah modal pakan ternak. Hal ini dilakukan Komang Wati dengan harapan keuntungan yang diperoleh lebih banyak lagi dan kesejahteraan keluarga lebih baik.

loans.use:
To buy mother pig and piglet for fattening

Membeli induk dan bibit untuk penggemukkan

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline D. is happily married with two children. She is 40 years old, and is from Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells used clothes and she has been in this business since 1990. She needs a loan of $400 to buy more used clothes for sales.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Alamoni Mateai

texts.en: Alamoni is a married mother of four and she is 33 years of age. Her husband is a farmer and they live with her parents. Alamoni's family has a big plantation and her husband, father and three brothers look after the plantation. For many years they have not been able to afford a back sprayer which most local farmers need to assist in killing the grass. Alamoni is very thankful that with her first loan she will be able to buy supplies for her plantation and for her ice cakes (popsicles in a bag) business.

loans.use: Alamoni would like to buy supplies for her ice cake (popsicles) business and for her plantation.

loans.name: Kamuli B4(I) Group

texts.en: This group has been together for one year. Clementine is 40 years old and married with five children. She runs a poultry business. She wants to use the extra business profits to complete her rental houses and also fence her residential house. Hasifa, Slvia and Annet all have beauty salon businesses. Josephine sells used clothes and wants to use the loan to purchase more clothes for sale. This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase more chicks. and use the profits to complete rental houses, to improve 3 beauty salon businesses and to purchase more used clothes for sale.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
Beatriz lives on Luis Espinal Avenue, Street 4 of the Puerto Mejillones zone of the city of El Alto.

She lives with her husband, who works as a salaried driver, and two children of 10 and 13 years of age. Beatriz works in the sale of prepaid mobile phone cards.

She will use the loan proceeds to buy merchandise (prepaid phone cards) to increase her sales and therefore her income.

This is her first loan with Impro. Her financial evaluation makes her eligible for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Beatriz vive en la avenida Luís Espinal, calle 4 de la zona Puerto Mejillones, de la cuidad de El Alto.

Vive junto a su esposo el cual trabaja como chofer asalariado y dos hijos de 10 y 13 años respectivamente. Beatriz se dedica al la venta de tarjetas pre-pago para telefonía móvil.

El crédito lo destinara en la compra de mercadería ( tarjetas pre-pago) y así incrementar sus ventas y por lo tanto sus ingresos.

Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise (prepaid mobile phone cards)

loans.name: Madeleine

texts.fr:
Madeleine is married and has been a member of the Lyndiane Catholic Women’s village bank in Ziguinchor for 6 and a half years. She has considerable experience in the sale of forestry products such as palm oil and lemon oil, among others. The income from these sales allows her to help her family. She would like to build her business and is requesting a loan that she promises to repay in one installment within 6 months.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Madeleine, mariée est membre du banc villageois des Femmes Catholiques de Lyndiane à Ziguinchor depuis 6 ans et demie. Elle a une bonne expérience du commerce des produits forestiers: huile de palme, citron, etc. Ces revenus lui permettent d'aider à l'entretien de sa famille.Elle souhaite renforcer son activité et sollicite un prêt qu'elle s'engage de rembourser au bout de 06 mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: Purchase of palm oil for resale

loans.name: Aracelly Del Socorro

texts.es:
In the Somotiillo area of Chinandega city, Aracelly G. has had a convenience store for eight years, supporting her two children who today are students in their small community. It is necessary to note that Aracelly is both mother and father as she is a single mother and the convenience store is her only business that provides income.

In order to improve her economic situation she has struggled to supply her business and little by little she has stocked her store. Today she seeks support from Ceprodel to obtain a loan which will permit her to get ahead in selling her products.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Desde hace ocho años en el municipio de Somotillo de la ciudad de Chinandega la señora Aracelly G. se ha dedicado al negocio de pulpería con el que sustenta a sus dos hijos que hoy en día se encuentran estudiando en su pequeña comunidad. Es necesario recalcar que la señora Aracelly hace el papel de padre y madre por ser madre soltera y siendo la pulpería su único negocio con el que percibe ingresos.

Para mejorar su situación económica ha luchado para suplir el negocio poco a poco y para cubrir la necesidad del abastecimiento de la mercadería, hoy en día busca el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito que le permita salir adelante en la venta de sus productos.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Rodolfo Daniel

texts.es:
Rodolfo is 29 years old, married, with 2 children ages 12 and 11 years old. He lives in the Hialeah neighborhood of Managua. His wife is a housewife and she is in charge of taking care of their small children. Rodolfo has had a business buying and selling scrap metal for a year. He owns two small trucks in which he moves the scrap metal.

He needs a loan to buy materials to build 7 meters of a bedroom and in this way improve his home little by little. Among his future plans are saving money to buy a truck to make moving the scrap metal easier, therefore being able to improve his income and consequently his family’s quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Rodolfo tiene 29 años de edad, es casado, con 2 hijos de 12 y 11 años, habita en el barrio Hialeah de Managua. Su esposa es ama de casa y es quien se encarga del cuido de sus pequeños. Desde hace un año Rodolfo se dedica al negocio de la compra y venta de chatarra. Posee dos camionetas en las que traslada la chatarra.

Requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales para hacer 7 mts de un cuarto de habitación y así ir mejorando su casa poco a poco. Entre sus planes está reunir dinero para la compra de un camión para hacer más facil el traslado del material, y así poder mejorar sus ingresos y por ende la calidad de vida de su familia.

loans.use: Construct 7 meters of a bedroom

loans.name: Raksmey

texts.en:
Mrs. Raksmey B. is a farmer in Trapaing Teap Village, Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. Her husband, Mr. Saory Uong, is a middle man who buys rice to keep in stock and then sell later for a good price. Although her husband's business has improved, Mrs. B. needs to ask for a loan to buy more rice to keep in stock.

Mrs. B. is 35 years old and the mother of three children, all of whom attend the local school. Last year, Mrs. B. obtained a loan from AMK to buy a cow for breeding. One of Mrs. Raksmey B.’s children got liver disease and Mrs. Raksmey B. spent $125 to have her cured.

Her husband is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy more rice to keep in stock and sell it later for a good price.

loans.name: Mawuenyégan Komivi

texts.fr:
Mr. Mawuényegan Komivi K. was born in Kévé on April 8, 1978. He is single and has no children. He is a merchant of generic goods. However, since 2007, he has specialized in the sale of Forever Living products; he received training for these products and he is able to offer his clients advice about them. At present time, he has a large number of clients who want to buy his products. Yet, Mr. K.’s working capital is insufficient to meet the demand. As a result, he is asking for this loan, his first, so he can increase his stock.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

Monsieur K. Mawuényegan Komivi est né à Kévé le 08 avril 1978. Il est célibataire sans enfant. C’est un commerçant de produits génériques. Mais depuis 2007, il s’est spécialisé dans la vente des produits FOREVER LIVING, car il reçoit des formations sur les produits et sait conseiller les clients sur les produits. A présent, il dispose d’un nombre grandissant de clients qui ne cherchent qu’à être satisfaits. Mais le fonds de roulement dont dispose monsieur K. est insuffisant pour satisfaire la demande. Il sollicite alors ce premier crédit pour augmenter son stock.

loans.use: Purchase of health products

loans.name: Hekima Group

texts.en:
Tabu has owned a cafe and clothes-sales business in Dar es Salaam since 2002. She is 44 years old, married, and has four children ages 6, 9, 15, and 23. She works daily from 7:00am to 6:00pm, which allows her to earn a monthly profit of approximately $300. She hopes that with this loan, she will be able to buy more goods at bulk rates to sell for a greater profit at her store.

Tabu will share this loan with her fellow group members who also have shops in Dar es Salaam.

loans.use: To buy more goods for business.

loans.name: Servando Enrique

texts.es:
Enrique inició el negocio por que a su esposa le gustan las ventas además de tener un ingreso extra por que le acababan de dar casa de infonavit y como en la calle donde vivían había muchos niños decidieron poner el snack para así conocer mas gente.Comenzó hace aproximadamente 5 años vendiendo nachos, tostadas, chicharrones, frituras, dulces y bollos, y les va muy bien.

El necesita un préstamo por US $375 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía.
texts.en:
Enrique started the business because his wife enjoyed sales as well as to have some extra income, because they had just been given an Infonavit house (housing subsidized by the mexican mortgage corporation). Since on the street where they live there are many children, they decided to setup a snack bar in order to get to know more people. About 5 years ago he began selling nachos, tostadas, pork cracklings, fried foods, sweets and buns and sales go very well.

He needs a loan of $375 which will be repaid in 6 months, to buy merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise for his snack bar.

loans.name: Sanoat

texts.en:
A. Sanoat lives in the Nausky region of Tajikistan. She decided to become a client of MicroInvest because all her friends and colleagues improved their business situations thanks to the MicroInvest loan process. Mrs. A. Sanoat has been a client of MicroInvest since 2004, and she is the one of the oldest clients in our program. She is a reliable and experienced client. She is engaged in commercial service and trade; she trades in assorted children's wear.

A. Sanoat works with suppliers and trades in normal prices that are not the higher bazaar prices. She has very strong competition, and so now would like to import seasonal wear. Now Mrs. A. Sanoat asks KIVA for the business support loan of 2600 STJ for 3 months for importing new seasonal wear.

loans.use: new imports of seasonal wear.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William O. is 35 years old and married with four children. He is a furniture maker who makes furniture for both office and home use. The demand for his furniture is high and he needs a loan in the amount of N52,000 to purchase more wood in bulk for his furniture business.

He says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their financial support and LAPO Microfinance for their business training.

loans.use: To purchase more wood for furniture making.

loans.name: Fermina

texts.es:
Fermina forma parte del Banco Comunal “Señor Del Cautivo II” del distrito D. Independencia, provincia D. Huaraz, departamento D. Ancash.

Fermina ya no se hace cargo D. sus 5 hijos. A sus 65 años comenta que no ha tenido problemas difíciles en su vida, que su logro más granD. ha sido ver, junto a su esposo, a sus hijos crecer y el poder educarlos para que sean profesionales. En la actualidad se dedica a la crianza y venta D. cerdos en las afueras D. la ciudad D. Huaraz. Compra los deshechos D. los restaurantes mezclándolos con el afrecho y cebada molida. VenD. los cerdos vivos a las mujeres que venden cerdos asados en las plazuelas D. la ciudad y también venD. la carne a pedido.
 
Con este préstamo D. S/.1,200, el cual será cancelado en 8 cuotas, invertirá en la compra D. afrecho para reserva y pagará por adelantado a los restaurantes para el abastecimiento D. deshechos, ya que paga por cada balD. S/. 3.00. 

Fermina afirma que le encantaría capacitarse para su desarrollo personal porque es tiempo D. descansar del trabajo.
texts.en:
Fermina belongs to the community bank of Senor del Cautivo II at the Independence district, department of Ancash. Fermina doesn’t support her 5 children anymore, as they are all adults now. She is 65 years old and she says her biggest achievement has been to see together with her husband her children grow and educate them to be professionals. Currently she rises and sells pigs outsiD. the city of Huraz. She also buys leftovers from restaurants and mixes it with other ingredients to feed the pigs. She sells the pigs alive to the women who sell barbeque pork in the city and she also sells meat under request. With the S/.1,200 which will be paid in 8 quotes, she will buy leftovers to store and will pay in advance because currently she pays S/. 3.00 per bucket. Fermina would love to study to improver her personal development because is time to rest from work.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy in advance leftovers from restaurants

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
La señora Hilda es socia del Banco Comunal “Flores la Pampilla” del distrito, provincia y departamento de Puno. Tiene 29 años de edad, es casada y madre de un hijo. 
Con su primer préstamo de S/. 300 compró golosinas para venderlas en su tienda. Tiene casi 5 años trabajando con el banco comunal y nos cuenta que es enfermera técnica pero no ejerce su carrera. 
Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará juguetes y pirotécnicos para la campaña navideña. 
Hilda desea continuar trabajando para construir su casa propia.
texts.en:
Hilda is a member of the “Flores la Pampilla” Communal Bank located in the district, province and state of Puno. She is 29 years old, married, and mother of one son. With her first loan for S/ 300 she bought candy to sell in her store. She has been working with the Communal Bank for almost 5 years and she tells us that she is trained as a nurse technician but does not practice this profession. With this loan for S/. 1,000, which will be repaid in 4 payments, she will buy toys and fireworks for the Christmas season. Hilda wishes to continue working to build her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy toys and fireworks.

loans.name: Essohanam

texts.fr: Essohanam D. est propriétaire d’une baraque d’alimentation générale au bord de la route à Lomé, la capitale du Togo. Agée de 37 ans, elle est mariée et mère d’un enfant. Elle désire avec ce crédit louer un magasin et l’approvisionner afin de mieux satisfaire aux besoins de la clientèle. Ceci lui permettra d’augmenter ses recettes qui engendreront des profits ; par là elle pourra mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Essohanam D. is the owner of a road-side grocery stall in Lomé, the capital of Togo. She is 37 years old, married, and the mother of a child. To satisfy her customers better, she would like to use this loan to rent a store and to stock it with merchandise. This will enable her to increase her receipts, which will result in profits. She will thus be able to do better in providing for her family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To rent a store and to stock it

loans.name: Florentino I Group

texts.en:
The Group 1 from the Florentino Bank of Hope in Los Alcarrizos is on their third loan cycle with Esperanza International. Los Alcarrizos is a large district on the northwestern outskirts of Santo Domingo. Many of its habitants are Haitian inmigrants.

Suze C. is one of the group members. Suze is 31 years old, is married and has 2 children. She sells seasoning and cooking spices in her small business at home. All the other group members are involved in clothing sales. Suze's customers are mostly from her own neighborhood. She will use this loan to buy some more products to continue her activities. Her pastimes include reading the Bible, praying, and thinking about new ways to "spice up" her business. She also dreams of providing her children a good education.

On behalf of Esperanza International, thank you for supporting this group!

loans.use: To purchase new merchandise for her business

loans.name: Ngaeth

texts.en:
Mrs. Ngaeth M. lives in Ampil village in Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Say Lyheng, are farmers who own a plot of land for the cultivation of both rice and vegetables. In their efforts to cultivate rice, they face some problems because their field is infertile and because the crops are being damaged by insects. Additionally, their field is far away from irrigation systems.

In order to deal these problems, Mrs. Ngaeth M. has decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers, pesticides, and fuel, and she would like to use the rest of money to hire laborers to work on the field. She is 44 years old and the mother of seven children: two are employed in a garment factory, one is a car repairer, and the others are enrolled in the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, pesticides, and fuel, as well as hiring laborers to work on the field.

loans.name: Farhod

texts.ru: Фарход занимается куплей продажей различных сухофруктов на местных рынках. Оборот бизнеса большой и приходится много работать. Для сортировки купленных сухофруктов привлекает свою семью, а иногда нанимает работников. Но прибыль позволяет пользоваться услугами наемных рабочих. Фарходу 28 лет, женат и имеет 2 детей. Фарход собирается закупить большую партию абрикосов и поэтому подал заявку на займ.
texts.en:
Farhod purchases and sells a variety of dried fruits and the local markets. He has high turnover and has to work a lot. He uses his family to sort the dried fruits and sometimes hires workers. His profits allow him to use the services of hired laborers. Farhod is 28 years old, is married and has 2 children. Farhod plans to purchase a large quantity of apricots and because of this decided to apply for a loan.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase apricots

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To stock beans, cassava flour, and oil

loans.name: Otgonchimeg

texts.en:
Otgonchimeg N. lives with her teenage daughter and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She is a divorced woman, who is working hard to provide a better life for her two children.

She has a small retail business selling second-hand clothing. She launched her business in 2006 and since then, she has been doing well and gaining abundant experience in retail. She rents a stall in the Narantuul market, the largest outdoor market in Ulaanbaatar, and sells the second-hand clothes that she purchases from the wholesale market.

Her ultimate hope is to afford her two children's college tuition when they graduate from high school. She wants her two children to be well-educated and to pursue their dreams in their chosen fields. She requests a Kiva loan to buy more second-hand clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more second-hand clothes for her business.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.es:
La señora Shirley, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Micaela Bastidas”, vive en el Jr. Mariscal Castilla Nº 282, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 37 años y 01 hijo, que aun dependen de ella.

Shirley, con el apoyo de su pareja y de Manuela Ramos y tendiendo  habilidad para la costura, decidió implementar su propio negocio ubicado en su misma casa,  se rige mas al rubro de confección de ropas de deporte. Nos cuenta que le va muy en sus ventas, trabaja con pedidos y los vende en docenas.
En la actualidad continua con sus confecciones de ropas de deporte y tiene una clientela ya fidelizada que a diario acude a su casa para realizar sus trabajos y pedidos, es ella quien personalmente les atiende  con la amabilidad que le caracteriza. 

Con el préstamo de S/ 1,000.00, desea invertirlo comprando telas en metros, de diferentes especies, instrumentos que utiliza como tijeras, agujas de coser y de maquina, alfileres, botones. 

Shirley, hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas de alcanzar y hacer realidad sus demás sueños. Agradece a Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Señora Shirley, a customer of the Community Bank “Micaela Bastidas”, lives in Jr. Mariscal Castilla Nº 282, in the Juanjui district, Mariscal Cáceres Province of San Martín. She is 37 years old, and lives with her son and his father, who depend on her.

Shirley, with the support of her partner and of Manuela Ramos, and having sewing skills, decided to start her own business out of her house. She works mostly in the area of sportswear. She tells us that these sell well. She takes orders and sells by the dozen. Currently she is working on the manufacture of sports clothing, and she has a loyal customer base. She stays home each day completing her sewing and filling orders. She tends to her customers with the amiability that characterizes her.

With a loan of S/ 1,000.00, she will invest in fabric by the meter, of different styles, and tools like scissors, sewing needles for both machine and hand sewing, pins and buttons.

Shirley currently feels that she is an accomplished woman, with the desire to achieve and make her dreams a reality. She thanks Manuela Ramos for helping her start her business, as well as assisting many women who hope to expand their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Novesky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric to make clothing

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
M. Nguyễn Thị (1044061336) is a 49 year-old female living in the town of Nghi Lộc. She is married and has 3 school-aged children. To making a living, M. owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling rice products in the local community. M. has been engaged in this business for over 4 years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month from these activities. In 2004, M. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. M. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

M. is now requesting a new loan of 12,000,000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business. The loan will be the 5th loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund. M. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena is a widowed mother with seven children. Three are in school and the rest are working to earn a living. Abena is a 56-year-old trader. She prepares and sells pastries like doughnuts. She has been in the business for ten years now. People come to buy from her to resell and she sells the remaining at a stand in the community where she lives. She says prices of flour, margarine and other needed ingredients have gone up significantly. She requests the loan to buy bags of sugar, flour, margarine etc. to remain in business. She wants to save part of her profit for her children's educational needs. She belongs to the community group called ’Doduo’ which means ‘Plenty or More’

loans.use: To buy more ingredients

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To make and sell porridge

loans.name: Norlan Yuran

texts.es: El joven Nolan Yuran O. C. tiene 25 años de edad. El se dedica a la venta de ropa. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio. A pesar de su corta edad es un joven muy emprendedor y trabajador. El capital con que inicio fue con muy poco dinero, y decide recorrer muchos lugares para ofrecer sus productos. Pero Nolan enfrento dificultades porque no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, además el vive con su Mama y  se enfermo y es Nolan quien la cuidaba, por lo que algunas veces tenía que cerrar su pulpería para atender su Mama.  El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de golosinas en general, pan, granos básicos, refrescos naturales y jugos.
texts.en:
Young Nolan Yuran O. C. is 25 years old. He sells clothing. More than five years ago he began this business. Despite his young age, he is a very dedicated and industrious worker. He started his business with very little capital, so he decided to visit various locations to offer his wares. But Nolan faced challenges because he did not have the opportunity to study. He lives with and takes care of his sick mother, which requires him to close his store sometimes so that he can care for his mother. The loan he is requesting is for business capital to purchase basic snacks, bread, basic grains, natural drinks and juices.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes A. sells clothing, scarves, silver pans and maize, at Bronyinima near Elmina. Agnes has received senior high education.  She is single and has three children. Agnes has been selling scarves, silver pans and maize for 15 years now. She is responsible for paying for the upkeep of her home and also paying utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more clothing to boost her business. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to complete a house she is building.

loans.use: buy more clothing to boost her business

loans.name: Mrs. Pouy Shum Village Bank Loan Group

texts.en:
This village bank, which consists of twenty-four people, is located in Daem Rues village in Kandal province. They will each use the loan for a different purpose.

Mrs. Pouy S. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a farmer who is also a Khmer noodle seller in the local village. Since this business is going wE., she wants to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more ingredients to make Khmer noodles to sE. to earn more profit. She is a widow with three children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the youngest one is a laborer in a rice mill.

Two members in this village bank have end-of-term (EoT) loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. Those with EoT loans are not required to pay any princiP. on the loan until the very end of the loan term. EoT loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. EoT loans allow them to repay portions of the princiP. whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients for making Khmer noodles

loans.name: Edgar Faraón

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Edgar Faraón R. le esta haciendo falta poner vitropiso en la toda la casa.
Pero en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder comprar el vitropiso y pagarle a la persona que se encargara de colocar el piso. Es por eso que nos está solicitando un préstamo y realizar la mejora lo más pronto posible.
El señor Edgar Faraón planea pagar el crédito con los ingresos de su trabaja como chofer de un camión de carga. 
La persona que aparece en la foto es su esposa la señora Eydolisa Carreón  ya que el señor Edgar Faraón se encontraba en su trabaja.

loans.use: Colocación de un vitropiso

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase poultry feed and treatment

loans.name: Hilda Senayda

texts.es:
La señora Hilda Senaida M. Lainez tiene 36 años de edad, esta casada con el señor Rafael Lainez quien vende mercaderia. 
Tienen tres hijos los cuales todos estan en el colegio. 
Hila se dedica a la compra y venta de lacteos como ser queso, mantequilla, quesillo, requeson.  hilda vende el producto en Alinza, Caridad, Aramecina y el mercado de Nacaome. 
 
Sus ventas son cada tres dias por la seman, vende mas los fines de semana. 
Ella esta solicitando el crédito para surtir mas su negocio.
su meta es poder vender mas en otros caserios y pueblos de Nacaome, asi tendria muchas ganancias.
su sueño es ver graduados a sus hijos de la universidad.
texts.en:
Señora Hilda Senaida M. Lainez is 36 years old and is married to Señor Rafael Lainez, who sells merchandise. They have three children who all attend school. Hila purchases and sells dairy products such as cheese, butter, quesillo, and cottage cheese. Hilda sells her products in Alinza, Caridad, Aramecina, and the Nacaome market. She sells her products during the week but makes the majority of her sales during the weekend. She is requesting the loan to help purchase more products and increase her business. Her goal is to increase her sales in the surrounding villages and the towns of Nacaome so that she can increase her earnings. Her dream is to see her children graduate from university.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Raimondi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase dairy products

loans.name: Mario Alejandro

texts.es: El señor Mario Alejandro es padre de 2 hijos, el trabaja en maquiladora desde hace 6 años, su esposa se queda al cuidado de sus hijos y al hogar. Mario siempre se preocupa por el bienestar de la familia es por ello que hay veces que trabaja tiempo extra para tener un ingreso mas y darles una mejor calidad de vida. Ahora se viene la temporada de frío el cual observa que su hijos están mas grandes y las prendas del año pasado les queda muy pequeña. Mario no quiere que su familia se vea afectada con el virus que hoy en día esta surgiendo en el mundo, es por ello que requiere un préstamo para comprar vitaminas que prevengan las enfermedades de las vías respiratorias y ropa de invierno con el fin de que sus hijos tengan buena salud.
texts.en:
Mr. Mario Alejandro is the father of 2 children. He has worked in an assembly plant for the past 6 years. His wife looks after their children and the home. Mario has always worried about the wellbeing of his family. There are times that he works overtime to augment his income and give them a better quality of life. Now the cold weather is coming and he has noticed that his children have grown and last year’s clothing is too small. Mario does not want his family to be infected with the virus that is currently appearing in the world and, for this reason, is requesting a loan to buy winter clothing for his children to help keep them in good health.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ropa de Invierno

loans.name: Juana Ursula

texts.es: Juana Ursula
texts.en: Juana Ursula

loans.use: To buy basic grains.

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely P. is from the town of Rizaluna, Cordon, Isabela. She is 38 years old, married, and has four school-aged children.

Fely owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month.

In 2009, Fely joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first loan taken out from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 


About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It  has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie A. is from the village of Baliwagan, Misamis Oriental. She is 34 years old. Rosie is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Rosie owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector, operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling plastic wares, plates and glasses in the local community. Rosie is just starting this business.

In 2009, Rosie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosie is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Rosie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Paz Y Amor 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Yessenia, age 33, lives near the town of Samana in the Dominican Republic. She is the coordinator of her group, Paz y Amor (Peace and Love), and her story is representative of the other borrowers in the group.

Yessenia and her husband live with their three children in a simple home from which she also runs her small business. Yessenia sells necklaces, earrings, Avon beauty products, toiletries, and perfumes, and also makes custom clothing for her clients. With this loan, her ninth loan from Esperanza International, Yessenia plans to buy a new sewing machine and more inventory. 

As in most of the Dominican Republic, life in Samana can be very difficult. Running potable water is unavailable, electricity is scarce at best, and healthcare and infrastructure are inadequate. 

Despite these difficulties, Yessenia has bright hopes for the future. She plans to continue expanding her business with continued access to loans. Yessenia also hopes to improve life for her family by purchasing furniture for her home, finishing the construction of her kitchen, and buying a computer. In addition, the profits from her business will help Yessenia to buy shoes, books, backpacks, and other school supplies for her three young children. She hopes to send them to college one day, helping them become professionals and grow economically. 

Thank you for your loan to Yessenia and the Paz y Amor Group!

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine and more inventory

loans.name: Santos Esxequiel

texts.es:
EL SEÑOR SANTOS TIENE EL NEGOCIO DE SERVICIO DONDE ES EL SECTOR TRANSPORTE 
EL CREDITO LO INVERTIRA PARA MEJORAR SU VEHICULO Y ASI PODER DAR UN MEJOR SERVICIO Y A TENCION A SUS CLIENTES, EL CREDITO LE AYUDARA A TENER UN MAYOR INGRESO PARA SU FAMILIA EL ES PADRE SOLTERO Y TIENE UNA NIÑA DE TRES AÑOS DE EDAD A LA CUAL AMA MUCHO  Y ES POR ELLA QUE EL QUIERE MEJORAR SU CALIDAD DE VIDA POR MEDIO DEL FINANCIAMIENTO, SU TRABAJO EMPIEZA DESDE HORAS MUY TEMPRANA (CINCO DE LA MAÑANA) Y TERMINA SU LABOR A LAS OCHO DE LA NOCHE YA QUE EL REALIZA VIAJES A LOS DIFERENTES LUGARES DEL SECTOR.
texts.en:
MR. SANTOS HAS A SERVICE BUSINESS IN THE TRANSPORTATION SECTOR. HE WILL INVEST THE LOAN TO IMPROVE HIS VEHICLE TO BE ABLE TO GIVE BETTER SERVICE AND ATTENTION TO HIS CUSTOMERS. THE LOAN WILL HELP HIM HAVE A LARGER INCOME FOR HIS FAMILY. HE IS A SINGLE FATHER. HE HAS A THREE-YEAR-OLD DAUGHTER WHICH HE LOVES VERY MUCH AND HE WANTS TO IMPROVE HIS QUALITY OF LIFE FOR HER THROUGH THE FINANCING. HIS JOB STARTS VERY EARLY (FIVE IN THE MORNING) AND HE FINISHES WORK AT EIGHT IN THE EVENING SINCE HE TRAVELS TO DIFERENT PLACES IN THE SECTOR.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUY TIRES, SHOCK ABSORBERS, PUMP, ALTERNATOR, AND HOSES

loans.name: Najebullah

texts.en:
Najebullah son of G. N. is educated and is a married man. He has worked in a butcher shop for more than ten years. He is a hard-working man. He has requested an individual loan of 50,000 AFN to complete his various stocks of meat and to buy some necessary things to help in his business in order to build a better future for his children and family. 

He would like to thank everyone who supports him and hopes to continue his partnership with both Kiva and AFS in the coming years.

loans.use: to buy necessary things for his butcher shop

loans.name: Tajihan Jeenkulova`s Group

texts.en: Tajihan is 53 years old and is married with one son, a pupil. Her husband works as a yardman in the local school. Tajihan’s main business is livestock. She fattens them at home in autumn-winter and goes to pasture in spring-summer. She started her business with just two cows and now she looks after fifty cattle. This loan will be used to buy fodder and hay. Besides meat, she also sells milk products. Her average income per month is about 150 USD. Our next borrower is Kanayim. She is 44 years old and the mother of two daughters, both pupils. Her husband is a builder, usually working in Uzgen district. Kanayim keeps some animals. Either she looks after them at home or sends them to pasture because the cost of keeping them is less there. Her loan will be used to buy two calves. Gulzina is 25 years old. Her husband is in Moscow and is working as a builder there. With her husband’s family she is involved in farming. They raise corn and sunflowers. Sunflower seeds are then used to produce vegetable oil. Her loan will be used to cover sowing costs in the upcoming spring. Temirlan is 24 years old and is the youngest member of this group. His wife is a housewife raising their little daughter. Like the other members of this group, Temirlan fattens animals. Usually it is the only source of income in rural areas. His loan will be used to buy two calves. In the future he hopes to build his own house for his growing family. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To buy fodder and hay for her cattle

loans.name: Carlos José

texts.es:
El Señor Carlos Jose J. R., labora para el centro de insumos para la salud CIP-MINSA.
 El tiene a su cargo dos hijos y estos se encuentran en edad escolar, esta casado, lleva 2  créditos con CEPRODEL, estos los ha invertido en mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda con los Créditos otorgados por CEPRODEL.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: Hierro, zinc, cemento etc. para la construcción de un anexo en la parte de atrás de su casa de habitación, esto es para darles una mejor condición de vida a su Familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Carlos Jose J. R. works in CIP-MINSA (Centre for Health Supplies).

Mr. Carlos has under his care 2 children who are of school age.

He is married and has had 2 loans with CEPRODEL (Kiva’s field partner) which he has used to improve his living conditions.

The loan is to buy construction materials like iron, zinc, cement etc. to build an attachment to the back of his home, to give his family better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve and make his home bigger.

loans.name: Bruno Flavio

texts.es:
Este Sr. Se llama Bruno Flavio Poveda, tiene 36 años de edad, soltero, es obrero, trabaja en la Alcaldía del municipio de Posoltega, él habita en una comunidad Rural que se llama los Zanjones número tres, lugar de donde es originario, tiene cuatro hijos, una mujercita y tres varones, de ellos dos están cursando la escuela secundaría y dos la primaria, él curso únicamente hasta tercer grado de primaria

Con nuestra institución es el primer crédito que está obteniendo.
texts.en:
This is Bruno. He is 36 years old and single. He works as a laborer for the Posoltega city hall. He is originally from and currently lives in a rural community called “Zanjones número tres” (Zanjones Number Three). He has four children, three sons and one daughter. Two of them are attending junior high school and two are in elementary school. Bruno himself only completed the third grade. This will be his first loan through our institution.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Piglets

loans.name: El Buen Samaritano Group

texts.es:
ALCANCIA COMUNAL EL BUEN SAMARITANO
R. tiene una tienda que le permite aportar con los gastos D. educación D. sus hijos, aperturo su tienda hace mucho tiempo, con el primer crédito que le otorgo EDAPROSPO. ElL. es parte D. L. Alcancía Comunal El buen Samaritano donD. todas las socias son responsables y puntuales en el pago D.  sus cuotas.
Irma se dedica a L. venta D. productos D. belleza por catalogo hace 2 años, este negocio le brinda talleres D. belleza para que pueda atender lo mejor posible a sus clientes y  tener mayores ventas. L. socia tiene 2 hijos por los cuales es muy positiva y desea salir adelante. Con su esfuerzo diario pueD. aportar para L. mantención  D. sus hijos.
 Nuestros socios destinaran el reciente préstamo para L. compra D. mercadería y productos para satisfacer a sus exigentes clientes. About EDAPROSPO: EDAPROSPO seeks to use micro-credit to foster productive commercial activity for the sake of economic and social development within vulnerable urban and rural sectors traditionally neglected by commercial banks. By offering innovative products such as technical education loans and microfinance groups for young persons, EDAPROSPO helps disadvantaged Peruvians lift themselves out of poverty.
texts.en:
Community Bank "El Buen Samaritano" (The Good Samaritan) R. has a shop that allows her to contribute to the educational expenses of her children. She opened her shop a long time ago, with the first loan that EDAPROSPO granted her. She is part of the community bank "El Buen Samaritano," where all the members are responsible and punctual in the payment of their loans. Irma has been selling beauty products by catalog for two years. This business offers beauty workshops so that she can give the best possible advice to her customers and have better sales. She has two children, for whom she is very positive and wants to advance. With her daily efforts, she can contribute to the support of her children. These bank members will direct their loans to the purchase of merchandise and products to satisfy their existing customers. About EDAPROSPO: EDAPROSPO seeks to use micro-credit to foster productive commercial activity for the sake of economic and social development within vulnerable urban and rural sectors traditionally neglected by commercial banks. By offering innovative products such as technical education loans and microfinance groups for young persons, EDAPROSPO helps disadvantaged Peruvians lift themselves out of poverty.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products and ingredients

loans.name: Hyde

texts.en:
Hydie H. is managing a small rice field. She has four children, the eldest is 14. Her husband is a farmer and they work together to improve their harvest to support their children. 

Now, the family is preparing the farm for another planting. They need additional money to buy farming materials. She would like to apply for a loan of 7,000 Philippine Pesos at Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies and fertilizers.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros S. is from the village of D'ban. She is 54 years old, married and has an adult-aged child. Milagros owns and operates a business selling fish in the market. Milagros has been involved in her business for over 13 years and earns approximately 11,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2006, Milagros joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Milagros has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from PMPC, which was used as additional capital for her business. Milagros is requesting a new loan, her 4th, of 30,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fish to sell. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fish to sell

loans.name: Damaris Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Damaris tiene 23 años, es casada y tiene 1 hijo de tres años de edad. Su esposo trabaja como operario de maquinas en la empresa Gildan. La señora Damaris tiene un negocio de venta de frutas y verduras, este negocio está localizado en la salida de la zona franca. Ella ya tiene 3 años de tener este negocio, el cual dio inicio cuando nació su hijo, debido a que necesitaban buscar una fuente alternativa de ingresos para la manutención del mismo, con el tiempo, observo que el negocio brindaba buenas ganancias y se ha dedicado a él desde esa fecha. Ella está solicitando este crédito para invertirlo en la compra de frutas y verduras, ella aprovecha el momento en que salen los trabajadores para vender sus productos. Su sueño siempre ha sido llegar a tener su casa propia, ya que actualmente están habitando donde sus suegros. Además desea hacer un negocio más grande y tener una buena fuente de ingresos para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Damaris is 23 years old, married, and has 1 child, who is 3 years of age. Her husband works as a machine operator for Gildan company. Damaris has her own business selling fruits and vegetables. Her business is located at the exit to the Free Trade Zone. She has operated the business for 3 years. She started it when her baby was born because she needed to find an alternative source of income to maintain her child. In time, she noted that the business offered good earnings and she has dedicated herself to it ever since. Damaris is requesting a loan to purchase fruits and vegetables. She takes advantage of the moment the workers are leaving work to sell her products. Her dream always has been to have her own home, since at present, they are living in her in-laws house. In addition, she wants to have a bigger business and a good source of income for her and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: PURCHASING FRUITS AND VEGETABLES TO SELL

loans.name: An

texts.en:
Mrs. An T. is a middle-aged woman whose husband we see in this photo. An T. works as a sewing laborer in the garment factory and gets a specific salary to help support her family. She has a life partner in her husband who works repairing sewing machines with her in the same industry. The couple married years ago but doesn’t have any children yet. 

An T. said she faces a problem: she gets to work by taking a taxi or walking because she hasn't her own vehicle. She has been planning to own one but she lacks money to buy one. Therefore, An T. is applying for a loan so she can afford to purchase a used motorbike to ride to her work location.

loans.use: To purchase a used motorbike.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma B. is from the village of Tinotongan, Tukuran Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 29 years old. Alma is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Alma owns and operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing motorcycle services in the local community. Alma has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Alma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase materials needed to provide service. Alma is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Alma from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Sandra Mirtha

texts.es: La Sra. Sandra vive en la localidad de el torno distante a 39 km de la ciudad de santa cruz, en  el Barrio Miraflores, su actividad principal es la venta de frutas, y peinadora, su esposo por la falta de trabajo viajo al exterior en busca de un futuro prometedor, y así ayudar a su esposa a sacar adelante  a su familia, ya que son cuatros sus hijo en edad escolar, hace 6 años que vive en la comunidad, a base de créditos financieros a podido construir su casa y tener un capital necesario para trabajar, con el dinero del crédito comprara frutas de temporada como se chirimoya, mandarina, papaya, etc. Es muy trabajadora y muy responsable siempre pensando en el bienestar de su familia, esta muy agradecida con Emprender y kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en:
Sandra lives the Miraflores neighborhood of the El Torno, located 39 km away from the town of Santa Cruz. Her main activity is to sell fruits, on top of being a hairdresser. Due to the lack of jobs, her husband has traveled abroad looking for a more promising future that will allow him to help his wife providing for their family, composed of 6 children of school age. She has been living in the community for 6 years, and thanks to some loans she has been able to build her house and succeeded in having enough money to maintain her activity. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy seasonal fruits such as cherimoyas (custard apples), tangerines, papayas and so on. She is a very hard-working and responsible woman, always caring for the well-being of her family. She is really thankful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence shown in granting her the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seasonal fruits.

loans.name: Datitza

texts.es:
Datitza, vive en la zona de Alto Obrajes de la 
ciudad de La Paz.
Esta separada de su esposo  y tiene un hijo de 10 años que esta en la escuela en 5to básico.
Datitiza es secretaria en un bufete de abogados y también se dedica a la venta de perfumes y cosméticos.
Estudia en la universidad, y el dinero será destinado para la compra de una computadora. Es la primera vez que solicita el crédito y la primera que requiere el apoyo de kiva.
texts.en:
Datitza lives in the Alto Obrajes section of the city of La Paz. She is separated from her husband and has a 10-year-old son, who is in school.
