Datitza is a secretary at a law firm, and she sells perfumes and cosmetics on the side. She is also studying at the university, and the money from the loan will be used to buy a computer. This is the first time she has sought credit and the first time she has asked Kiva to help her.

Translated from Spanish by Ross Forman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a computer that will help her in her work at university.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia, de 60 años, es una madre de familia muy trabajadora, vive en su casa propia, junto  a su esposo y sus 2 hijas mayores. En un inicio se dedica a vender ropa, con el tiempo instaló una bodega en el interior de su domicilio, aunque pensó dejar el comercio de venta de ropa, no lo pudo concretar debido a la demanda que le hacen sus clientes. Hoy en día no solo vende ropas, sino edredones, cubrecamas, sabanas y demás artículos para el hogar. Le gusta todo tipo de comercio y le va muy bien; ya que ambos negocios son rentables, pero donde se siente mucho mejor es la venta de ropa, por ello no desaprovecha la minima oportunidad en entregar sus pedidos; mientras su hija atiende su bodega. En adelante desea ampliar su negocio, también quiere dedicarse a la  venta de comida. Es su décimo crédito con MFP, y se compromete en pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, como lo viene haciendo como hasta hoy en día. Con el crédito que solicita, va incrementar prendas casuales para damas, asimismo comprará mercaderías para el incremento de su bodega, de ese modo surtirlos con productos variados.
texts.en:
Julia is a 60 year old hard working mother who lives in her own home with her husband and two young daughters. She began selling clothing and eventually opened a store within her home. She was going to end her clothing business, but decided to keep it because she had so many customer requests. Today she not only sells clothing, but also down comforters, sheets, and other articles for the home. She likes all kinds of business activities and she is doing well. Both of her businesses are profitable, but she likes her clothing business the most and she doesn’t waste any time delivering her orders, while her daughter attends to the store. She wants to expand her business in the future and also wants to start selling food. This will be her tenth loan through MFP and she is committed to making her payments on time, as she has been doing up to now. She will use the money from this loan to buy casual ladies’ clothing and other merchandise for her store, in order to have a wider assortment of products.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Clothing for resale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, fish, meat and some sacs of water

loans.name: Novembrita

texts.en: Novembrita S. is from the village of Sepac, Sapang Dalaga. She is 51 years old, married and has 6 adult children. To make a living, Novembrita owns and operates a grocery store. Novembrita has been engaged in her business for over 18 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2000, Novembrita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Novembrita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. Novembrita is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used as additional capital for the store. This loan will be the 12th loan taken out by Novembrita from PMPC. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for grocery store

loans.name: Bunyod

texts.en:
H. Bunyod is a 29 year old businessman. He is married and, together with his wife, they have 3 kids. Bunyod is a farmer, like his wife. They started their work 5 years ago. The beginning was very difficult, because they needed to invest a lot of working capital. With much effort and the help of his wife he was able to move forward and today has a large plot of land. His vegetables are very good quality which he says is due to the constant irrigation they receive since the business has a complete underground irrigation system. They sell their products in the fruit and vegetable market of the city. Bunyod requests the loan for the purchase of fertilizer and seeds. This will allow him to better provide for his family.  

 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Towards purchasing the seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Linyonyi Wephukulu

texts.en:
Linyonyi M. is a 60 old landlord, charcoal dealer and green grocer in the Shanzu area of Mombasa. He has been in this business for the last thirty years. He is married and supports his grandchildren.

Linyonyi just joined KADET and he is now requesting his first loan to buy iron sheets for his rental houses and use the anticipated profits to build more rooms for renting.

Linyonyi hopes to own a large house in the future.

loans.use: To buying Iron sheets for roofing on his rental houses

loans.name: Moises Alberto

texts.es:
Don Moisés, un señor de 50 años de edad, dedicado a la venta de minutas de varios sabores, el reside en Jiquilisco, departamento de Usulután, él vive solo.
Él ya tiene 6 años de dedicarse al negocio de las minutas lo hace de forma ambulante por las principales calles de Jiquilisco, solicita un préstamo para la compra de los materiales para preparar las minutas ya que en este momento se ha quedado sin dinero para impulsar el negocio. Con este préstamo el podrá realizar sus ventas duna manera normal, ya que su inversión seria en Hielo, vasos descartables, miel de frutas y leche. 
Don Moisés quiere tener en los próximos meses un aumento en sus ventas para poder ahorrar y reparar su carretón de minutas,  también quiere con el préstamo ser buen cliente y realizar sus pagos puntualmente.
texts.en:
Moisés is 50 years old.  He sells 'minutas' (slushy frozen drinks) in different flavors.  He lives on his own in Jiquilisco, in Usulután department.

Moisés has been in the 'minutas' business for 6 years.  He sells his drinks around the main streets of Jiquilisco.  He is requesting a loan to buy materials to prepare his drinks since at the moment he doesn't have enough money to move the business forward.  With this loan he will be able to carry out his sales normally since the investment will be in ice, disposable cups, fruit syrup and milk.

Moisés would like to see a rise in his sales over the next few months so that he can save and repair his sales cart.  He also wants to be a good client and make his repayments punctually.

loans.use: To buy ice, cups and syrup

loans.name: Belly

texts.en:
Belly S. is a married woman who lives in Purok Pasayan, Brgy. Tomongtong, EB Magalona, Negros Occidental.  She earns her living by operating three business ventures: a tricycle, ready to wear clothes sales and avon dealer businesses.  Her husband Ramil, who is 36 years old, works as a driver to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have one child who is 12 years old. 

Belly joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family.  With the help of her past 7 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Belly has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow.  Her previous loan of PHP 17,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 5,500, increasing the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 8th loan, she is borrowing PHP 20,000, which she intends to use for the maintenance of the motorcycle and to buy stocks of clothing so that she could continue to save up for future education of her child and home repairs. 

Belly S. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 	

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. 

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To fund the operations of tricycle transport

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es: Rosario, de 32 años, es una madre de familia con ganas de salir adelante, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Con mucho esfuerzo se ha comprado su stand móvil, ubicado en la puerta de su casa, friendo salchichas, papas y pollos. Es así que lleva cerca de un año con esta labor, en lo que todos los días a partir de las 3:00PM, con mucha prisa sazona  los trozos de pollos y pela las papas listas para ferir, ya que a partir de las 6.00 de la tarde; solo se dedica freír y atender a sus clientes, quienes gustan de su sazón. Su negocio lo considera rentable, y con esas ganancias ayuda a cubrir parte de los gastos de su hogar. Es por ello que trabaja muy motivada, por lo que necesitará mas adelante comprarse una vitrina, con ella instalar una tienda dentro de su casa. Es su primer crédito con MFP y se compromete a pagar todas las cuotas oportunamente, de ese modo no generar complicaciones a los integrantes de su grupo comunal, quienes amablemente la invitaron en este crédito. Con el crédito que solicitó, comprará accesorios de cocina, y productos de primera necesidad para no tener problemas al momento de preparar éstos platillos.
texts.en:
Rosario, 32, is a mother with a strong desire to get ahead in life.  She lives in her own house with her husband and two children.  With much effort she managed to buy her food cart which is located at her doorstep to fry sausages, potatoes and chicken. 

She has been in business for about a year.  Every day starting at 3pm, she quickly seasons the pieces of chicken and peels the potatoes to have them ready to fry because from 6pm on all she does is fry and tend to customers who enjoy her tasty preparations.

Her business is quite profitable and she uses the profits to help meet household expenses.  This is why she is so motivated to work.  Soon she will need to buy a display case in order to set up a store in her house.

This is her first loan with MFP and she pledges to repay in a timely fashion so as not to cause any difficulties for her fellow group members who so kindly invited her to join in this loan.

She will use the requested loan to buy cooking utensils and basic need items so that she won’t have any problems at the moment of preparing the meals.

loans.use: To buy cooking utensils and basic ingredients to prepare her dishes.

loans.name: Claudia Lisseth

texts.es:
Claudia, reside en El Transito departamento de Usulután, tiene 24 años de edad, posee una tienda, vive con su abuela y un tío, es soltera. Esta tienda nació por sus padres y luego la cedieron a ella para que la administrara.
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de mercadería, productos como azúcar, frijoles, arroz, aceite y pollo que son parte de lo que ofrece a los clientes, con esta inversión espera aumentar el inventario y brindar un mejor servicio a los clientes.
El objetivo de Claudia es fortalecer el negocio y ser más competente frente a los demás negocios,  atender a un buen número de clientes y prosperar cada día junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Claudia lives in El Transito, in Usulután department.  She is 24 years old, single and owns her own store.  She lives with her grandmother and an uncle.

Claudia's store used to belong to her parents but they gave it to her to run.  She is currently requesting a loan to buy merchandise such as sugar, beans, rice, oil and chicken which are some of the products she offers her customers.  Through this investment, she hopes to increase her inventory and provide her customers with a better service.  Claudia's goal is to strengthen her business and become more able to deal with competing businesses.  She would like to serve a good number of customers and prosper every day together with her family.

loans.use: To buy sugar, beans, rice, oil and chicken

loans.name: Eyner Edgar

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “LOS ANDENES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Eyner Edgar; el tiene 36 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo como profesor y también trabaja en el area de turismo, el enseña a niños dando clases particulares, en forma independiente, el socio quiere tener una agencia de viajes. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar libros para enseñar y para invertir en turismo.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Eyner Edgar is a member of the "LOS ANDENES" community bank which is located in Cusco district, in Cusco province and department.

Eyner Edgar is 36 years old.  He lives with his partner and has 2 children.  He divides his time between his daily activities and his work as a teacher.  He also works in tourism.  He teaches children, giving private lessons.  He would like to own a travel agency.

Eyner Edgar is requesting this loan to buy books to teach his students and also to invest in tourism.  He is happy to be receiving a loan and pledges to make his repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy books for teaching and to invest in tourism

loans.name: Elvis Ruben

texts.es: El señor Elvis se dedica al transporte publico desde hace diez años, con movilidad propia, el señor es casado tiene un hijo que se encuentra en edad escolar, su esposa se dedica al comercio de calzado desde hace tres años, viven en casa de un familiar, este crédito lo están sacando para aumentar la compra de un mini bus y trabajar en las mismas líneas, ya que  el sindicato de su línea le permiten tener dos movilidades, el Sr. Es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable siempre pensando en el bienestar de su familia su deseo es poder ahorrar para comprarse una casita, esta  con la institución por el apoyo brindado en la otorgación del  crédito.
texts.en: Elvis has been working in public transportation for 10 years. He has his own vehicle. He is married and has a son of school-age. His wife has been selling shoes for three years. They live in a family member's home. They will use this loan to purchase a mini bus to work the same routes he currently works. The union in charge of his routes allows him to have two vehicles. Elvis is very hardworking and responsible and always thinks about the wellbeing of his family. His wish is to be able to save so that he can buy himself a small home. He is thankful to this institution for its support in granting this loan.

loans.use: Purchase a mini bus.

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina is a 59-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures: a general store and a vegetable garden business. She lives in Carmen, Cebu. She has been a member of Kiva partner, NWTF-Project Dungganon, since 2008 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts.
By working hard in her general store and vegetable garden businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 6,400 PHP. Avelina is borrowing 12,000 PHP so that she could purchase more stock to sell. This will be her fifth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 9,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Avelina aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure its future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means 'honorable'). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them 'Dungganon' – a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of the community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org.

loans.use: To purchase goods to sell

loans.name: Chat

texts.en:
Chat K., 30, resides with her family in Battambong province, Cambodia, an area known for quality rice products. K. is a tailor, earning an income of approximately $1.60 per day. Her husband is a farmer, earning an income of about $1 per day. Each month, the family has to spend $20 on food and $43 on the other necessary expenses. 

K. is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase a new sewing machine to improve her business. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: buy a new sewing machine to improve her business

loans.name: Mercedes Elvira

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Salud y Vida. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Mercedes, tiene 41 años de edad y es madre soltera de  una hija de 8 años la misma que estudia en escuela, ella vive en casa de los padres.
 
Es una gran madre que para obtener sus propios recursos y darle a su hija lo mejor  se dedica a la venta de ropa por catalogo. Además de productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas).  También vende bebidas en un pequeño local que tiene en su casa. Trabaja todos los  días de la semana, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana o cada quince de acuerdo a lo que quieran sus clientes. Lleva con sus negocios cinco años, primero empezó con la venta de Yanbal y luego con los otros negocios los mismos que le han ayudado a salir adelante.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos, ropa y bebidas. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 10 años y le gusta porque estos créditos le han ayudado mucho en sus neghocios. Sus sueños son seguir adelante.
texts.en:
Every fortnight the 'Salud y Vida' (Health and Life) community bank meets in the city of Charapoto.  This city is known for its traditional culture and for the fact that it is located just a few minutes from two of the best beaches in the province: San Jacinto and San Clemente.

Here we meet 41 year-old Mercedes who is a single mother.  She has one daughter, aged 8, who is in school.  Mercedes lives in her parents' home.

Mercedes is a great mother who, in order to make her own money and provide her daughter with the best, has a business selling clothes and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and ladies' accessories) through catalogs.  She also sells drinks from small premises located in her home.  Mercedes works every day of the week.  She leaves her products with her customers on credit and collects payment every week or fortnight, according to her customers' preference.  She has been in her businesses for five years.  She first started out selling Yanbal products and then added the other businesses which have helped her to get ahead in life.

Mercedes will use this loan to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics, clothes and drinks.  She has been a member of her community bank for 10 years and she likes being a member because the loans have helped her a lot in her businesses.  Her dream is to continue making progress.

loans.use: To buy perfume, creams, cosmetics, clothes and drinks

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama K. is married and has 11 dependants. She attained a senior high level of education. Ama sells palm oil at Abura near Watreso, which she has been doing for 50 years. Her husband is a farmer. Ama supports her husband in providing the basic needs of the family. She wants to expand her business and so is requesting a loan to produce more oil for sale. The new profit will be saved to buy an oil-extracting machine.

loans.use: to produce more oil to sell

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es:
Alberto nació en la ciudad de Cusco del departamento del Cusco, él tiene 44 años de edad y vive en la misma ciudad  donde nació junto con sus seis hijos. En la ciudad del Cusco hay hermosos paisajes, donde hay sitios históricos y donde hay centros arqueológicos de los antiguos pobladores del imperio Inca. 

Alberto tiene una pequeña agencia de viajes “Urcupiña Tours” donde ofrece a los turistas nacionales y extranjeros paquetes turísticos al Valle Sagrado de los Incas, Valle del Sur del Cusco, Machupicchu y otros tours. Ya son tres  años que se dedica a la agencia de viajes y le va muy bien gracia al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Alberto requiere el crédito para comprar útiles escolares para sus hijos 
  
Alberto es una persona responsable que pertenece al banco comunal “Puntualito” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. En la ciudad del  Cusco se encuentra la ciudadela de los Incas de Machupicchu, Cusco, Perú.
texts.en:
Alberto was born in the city of Cusco in the department of Cusco. He is 44 years old and lives with his six children in the same city where he was born. In they city of Cusco there are beautiful landscapes where there are historical sites and archaeological sites of the ancient peoples of the Incan empire.

Alberto has a small travel agency “Urcupiña Tours” where he offers tourist packages to the Sacred Valley of the Incans, the Valley of the South of Cusco, Machupicchu and other tours to national and foreign tourists. He has been working at the travel agency for the three years and it has been going very well thanks to the effort he puts into his work. At this time Alberto needs a loan to buy school supplies for his children.
  
Alberto is a very responsible person who belongs to the communal bank “Puntualito” of the Asociación Arariwa of the city of Cusco, Perú. In the city of Cusco you will find the fortress of the Incans of Machupicchu, Cusco, Perú.

loans.use: to buy school supplies for his children.

loans.name: Genita's Group

texts.en:
Genita S. is from the village of Poblacion, Sibutad. Genita is the group leader of a 4-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. 

Genita is 53 years old, married and blessed with three children of whom all are now adults. To make a living, Genita is presently engaged in making snacks to sell. She’s been engaged in this kind of business for 11 years already with a monthly net income of not less than Php 2500.

In 2009, Genita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. As an active member of Paglaum MPC under the PDP-LP, a microfinance program that reaches out to rural communities, Genita has successfully repaid a loan amount of Php 5,000. She is now requesting Php 4,000 as her 2nd loan which will be used to purchase a solar lamp.  

 About PMPC:
 Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a solar lamp.

loans.name: Bushra's Group

texts.en:
Bushra lives in Jaranwala which is a small city in Punjab, Pakistan and known for its agriculture industry. She recently got married and doesn’t have any children. She spends most of her time weaving carpets and doing her household responsibilities. She learnt the art of weaving carpets from her mother and started this to financially support her husband. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who is a vegetable vendor. His shop is located in the nearby market and he provides to his customers fresh seasonal vegetables at reasonable prices. Through the loan, he will buy fresh seasonal vegetables to sell and earn a good profit. 

Bushra is a new loan applicant and this is her first loan application through Asasah. She is confident about the future growth of her husband’s business after making a loan investment in it. 
 
Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Bushra.

loans.use: To buy fresh seasonal vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Revendeuse de produits de  premières nécessités (riz, sardine,….) depuis 2004, Akossiwa  est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Ses provisions se font au Grand marché de Lomé et ses environs et la revente dans sa boutique dénommée ‘’AMEGBEDJI’’. Elle se défend journalière ment pour ramener sa croûte à la maison. Ce second lui servira à acheter des marchandises vu qu'elle n'a plus de stock.
texts.en: Akossiwa is a vender selling basic needs products (rice, sardines, etc) since 2004. She married and the mother of three. She stocks up at the Grand market of Lomé and in the nearby areas and resells in a store called “Amegbedji.” Day to day, she struggles to bring an income home. This second loan will allow her to replenish the stock of products she has run out of.

loans.use: to buy basic needs products

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a married woman with three children all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past nine years, she has operated a beauty salon business. Her potential customers are friends, neighbours and brides. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Hellen dreams of expanding her business and becoming self-reliant in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase a dryer, hair chemicals and food oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase a dryer, hair chemicals and food oil.

loans.name: Marta

texts.es:
La Sra. Marta  es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, es una señora que ha luchado por sacar adelante a sus hijos, cuenta con su propio negocio el cual consiste en la venta de verdura, queso y crema la cual la ejerce de manera ambulante desde hace muchos años, también estos productos los ofrece en su casa de habitación.
Desde que inició su negocio se ha caracterizado por dar una buena atención a sus clientes y gracias al esfuerzo propio ha podido mantener su negocio, también le ha permitido sacar adelante a su familia y construir su propia vivienda. Una de las necesidades que tiene esta señora es contar con más capital para adquirir cerdos, verdura y leche para satisfacer en el menor tiempo posible a sus clientes, por tal razón decidió solicitar su séptimo crédito en Ceprodel con el objetivo de cumplir con su necesidad.
texts.en:
Marta is a native of the municipality of El Sauce.  She is a woman who has worked hard to get ahead with her children.  She has had her own business selling vegetables, cheese and cream on the street for quite a few years.  She also sells these products from her house.  

Ever since she started her business, she has been known for providing good service to her customers. Thanks to her efforts, she has been able to keep her business going, which has allowed her to get ahead with her family and build her own home.  She needs more capital so that she can buy pork, vegetables and milk to satisfy the demands of her customers as quickly as possible.  For this reason she has decided to request her 7th loan with Ceprodel.

loans.use: to buy pork, vegetables and milk

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is 30 years old. He is married to Lydia, and they have one child who is 7. For seven years, Michael has been in the taxi-transport business in Githurai, Nairobi. He gets a monthly income of 21,000 Kenyan shillings (KES).

He is applying for a loan of 60,000 KES from KADET LTD to service the car, buy spare parts, and get new tires. He plans to build his savings and buy another vehicle. This is his second loan from KADET LTD, after he paid his previous loan well and in good time. 

In the future, he plans to grow his business, build a home for his family, and own a fleet of vehicles in the transport industry.

loans.use: to service the car and buy new spare parts and tires

loans.name: Edilberta

texts.es: Edilberta tiene 60 años de edad, es viuda y vive en compañía de sus 3 hijos en su casa propia ubicado en el distrito de LLochegua. Se considera una mujer trabajadora, siempre se dedicó en la venta de productos de primera necesidad, pese que nunca tuvo educación, pero conoce perfectamente las operaciones a realizar para dedicarse en este negocio. En este negocio sus tres hijos la apoyan, ya sea en la atención hacía el cliente o encargándose del negocio mientras ella sale en busca de más mercadería para abastecer su tienda. Ella se siente a gusto con su negocio ya que le genera un ingreso económico rentable, pero no es lo suficiente, por eso desea ampliar su tienda para así obtener más ganancias y con ello pueda brindar un mejor bienestar para su familia. Este será su primer crédito con MFP, por tanto espera la colaboración de cada uno de ustedes para que pueda establecer su negocio. Con los 2.000 nuevos soles que solicita, Edilberta ampliará las instalaciones de su tienda y abastecerse de más productos.
texts.en:
Edilberta is 60 years old.  She’s a widow and lives in the company of her three children in her own house located in Llochegua District.  She considers herself a hard working woman.  She’s always sold basic need items. Despite not having an education she knows the operations needed to run this business to perfection.  Her three children help her with the business either taking care of customers or watching the store when she goes out in search of more merchandise to stock the store.  She feels comfortable with the business because if generates profitable income but it’s not enough.  She wants to expand the store to earn more profits to provide better wellbeing for her family.

This will be her first loan with MFP so she hopes to get collaboration from each one of you so that she can set up her business.  Edilberta will use the requested 2000 new soles to expand the store and stock up on more products.

loans.use: to buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en: Alma is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. Alma has a retail shop that sells fish, such as sardines & mackerel. She has had this business for 10 years. Alma has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy fish to sell. In the future, Alma hopes to improve her business. Alma is a new member of HSPFI.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es: El Sr. Luis es soltero, se dedica a la fabricación y venta de ladrillos crudo, viene realizando esta actividad toda su vida, siendo un negocio de toda la familia; pero hace 4 años que el Sr. Luis se independizo en el negocio lo cual ha hecho progresar poco a poco. Para Luis su principal desafío es madrugar todos los días para poder fabricar los ladrillos ya que a medio día con el sol no se puede trabajar en ello y sus  sueños es tener una ladrillera grande y formar una familia. El crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de materia prima para dicha fabricación. El Sr Luis está muy agradecido por la oportunidad recibida.
texts.en:
Sr. Luis is single and has been selling crude bricks throughout his entire life since his entire family in this business. Four years ago, Sr. Luis became independent and his business has advanced slowly. His main challenge is getting up early every day to make the bricks because by noon he is not able to work under the heat of the sun. His dreams are to have a large brickyard and to start a family.

This loan will be invested in the purchase of raw materials for making bricks. Sr. Luis is very grateful for the opportunity that he has received.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for making bricks.

loans.name: Ritchel

texts.en:
Ritchel is 29 years old and lives in Bañadero, Ozamiz City. She is married with two children. 
Ritchel has a mini grocery business and earns approximately 4,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. She has a requested a loan of 35,000 PHP to purchase grocery stock for her store. 
Ritchel has been a member of Kiva partner, PMPC, for one year. In the future, she hopes to improve her living conditions and enlarge her store.

loans.use: to purchase grocery stock.

loans.name: Franklin Michael

texts.es:
Franklin Michael tiene 21 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive con los papás en el  en el Cantón Ventanas
 Provincia de los Ríos.

Los miembros de la VCR Caminando Hacia el Futuro, Se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Jesús de gran Poder, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz.

Franklin se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz, Compra sus productos en el Comercial Marlín y las ventas en la misma localidad y en Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, insumos, líquidos, urea y fertilizantes para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades. Su sueño es poder tener su propio terreno para poder trabajar mejor.

En los tiempos libres le gusta salir a pasear y dedicar más tiempo al trabajo.
texts.en:
Franklin Michael, 21, is single and has no children; he lives with his parents in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.

The members of the “Caminando Hacia el Futuro” (Heading toward the Future) communal bank which is located in Jesús de Gran Poder are short cycle corn and rice farmers.

Franklin is a corn and rice farmer.  He buys his supplies at Marlín supply center and his sales are also there and in Ventanas.

He asks for the loan to buy seeds, supplies, liquids, urea and fertilizers for his crops.  Support from the loan will help him economically to meet his needs.  He faces challenges like crop diseases and infestations.  His dream is to be able to own his own land to work better.  In his spare time he likes to go on excursions and to dedicate more time to work.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: The pans behind Ama are sold by her to her customers. She is married and has five children. Her husband is a farmer. Ama has been selling pans for six years. She assists her husband to take care of the home. Her loan will be used to buy more pans to retail to her customers. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more pans to retail to her customers.

loans.name: Mary Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married lady with two children whom they hope to give a good education up to the university level. She operates an automobile spares parts sales business along the Jogoo Road in Nairobi. She has been in this business for 12 years now and has hired one person. She says the business is good and the only major challenge she has is financial constraints. However, she works hard to ensure that business is doing well.

She is using her loan of 50,000 KES to add to her stock of auto parts to grow her business and meet the demands of her customers. She hopes that in the future her business will grow to a wholesale business. She describes herself as hardworking and resilient.

loans.use: to buy automobile spare parts

loans.name: Sreyneang

texts.en:
Sreyneang, 34 years old, is a garment factory worker who earns $2.70 per day. Her husband is a chief construction worker and earns about $13 per day. They have three children, all of whom are in school studying. Every month, she has to spend $50 on food, $8 on electricity, and $40 on school fees. 

She would like to request a loan of $300 to buy dirt to fill her land which is flooding. This loan will allow her family to avoid flooding. She plans to extend her husband's career by helping him to buy more construction equipment and materials so that he can provide better service to the customers than now. She hopes to send all of her children to study at least until they finish high school.

loans.use: To buy dirt to fill around her house to avoid flooding.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es: María comerciante sus planes a corto plazo es mejora su vivienda. Con el préstamo anterior alcanzo mayor clientela y a su vez variedad de productos para vender que beneficio a su familia ya que recibió utilidades para seguir invirtiendo en el negocio y realizo un anexo en el porche de su casa para expandir la pulpería. Con este ciclo de préstamo lo utilizara para la compra de materiales de construcción como: cemento, arena, laminas de zinc ondulado, pelines, barría de soldar, coloso, platinas entre otros materiales para cambiar el techo de la casa que es de madera y las tiene en mal estado cambiándolos por perlines y nuevas laminas de zinc. Agradece a ala financiera por el apoyo al desarrollo de su negocio y al mejoramiento de su nivel de vida ya que obtendrá comodidad y seguridad.
texts.en:
María is a saleswoman whose short term plan is to improve her home.  She used her previous loan to reach more customers and increase the variety of products she sells.  This benefited her family as she made profits which she used to continue investing in her business and also added an extension to her house porch so that she could expand her grocery store.

María will use this loan to buy building materials such as cement, sand, sheets of corrugated metal, beams, a soldering iron, bolts, metal edging etc. so that she can replace the roof of her house which is currently made of wood and in a bad state of repair.  She will replace it with roofing beams and new sheets of metal.  She is grateful to the financial institution for this support in making progress in her business and improving her standard of living as it will provide her with comfort and security.

loans.use: to invest in buying building materials

loans.name: Biyabu

texts.en:
Biyabu is applying for another loan to expand her rental house. She will use this 40,000 KES loan to purchase iron sheets and pay the laborers for their services. In the future, Biyabu aspires to continue improving her business. 

Since taking her last Kiva loan, Biyabu has greatly improved her family’s standard of living. She hopes to continue accessing the financial services offered by Yehu and Kiva lenders, and thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to pay for the necessary materials and labor to expand her rental house.

loans.name: Sahar

texts.en:
Sahar is a 35-year-old married woman from Marka, Amman, Jordan and a mother of five children.

Sahar has a beauty salon and she is requesting a loan of 1,500 JD to do some new decorations for her salon in addition to purchasing new equipment.

Sahar is looking to add new lines for her salons such as skin treatment and renting wedding gowns.

loans.use: to purchase new equipment and do some new decorations

loans.name: Bayanmunh

texts.en:
Bayanmunh is 44-years-old and lives with her husband and six kids in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Uvs province, Mongolia. Her eldest 6 children are school students, another child goes to kindergarden and another one stays at home. 

She is planning to start a shoe-making business. She already has all the required equipment and she made two pairs of shoes which are quite stylish and comfortable. She is a sharp and hardworking women who says,"I used to run a grocery shop but it is not enough to support our children. Therefore I decided to make shoes which I am good at and it is more profitable." She is requesting MNT 1,600,000 to buy materials.

loans.use: to buy materials.

loans.name: Ananie

texts.en: Ananie is 31 years old and is married. He has one child. Ananie owns a boutique where he sells different kinds of body lotions, soaps, cooking oil,rice, soft drinks and so on. His business is well known and well organized and he has two years of experience in this business. Ananie has requested his first loan from Kiva, via Vision Finance Company, in order to purchase more quantities of soft drinks, body lotions, soap and cooking oil to sell. With this profit, Ananie will reinvest his profits in his business and save for his future.

loans.use: to buy more quantities of soft drinks, body lotions, soaps and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es: Maria Magdalena  de 59 años de edad es soltera, ha trabajado como docente durante 20 años, pero actualmente se jubilo y recibe mensualmente pension como maestra jubilada, ademas recibe el apoyo economico de sus hijos que trabajan pero que habitan con ella. Esta solicitando su 12vo credito con el objetivo de mejorar su vivienda construyendo una tapia que le permita dar mayor seguridad a su casa, ya tiene hecho los arranques y parte del material.  Cabe mencionar que Maria ha logrado mejorar su casa poco a poco con los creditos otorgados por AFODENIC pues con el credito anterior logro construir su cocina y hacer el pantry, la cual le quedo muy bonita y comoda.
texts.en: Maria Magdalena is 59 years old and single. She worked as a docent for 20 years, but now she's retired and receives a monthly pension as a retired teacher. She also receives financial assistance from her children who work but who live with her. She is asking for her 12th loan with the objective of improving her home. She is building a wall which will permit her to have more security in her home. She's already made the base and part of the material. It is worth mentioning that Maria has been able to improve her home little by little with loan awarded from AFODENIC. With the previous loan she was able to build her kitchen and make the pantry, which is very attractive and comfortable.

loans.use: to build a wall.

loans.name: Marcosa

texts.es:
Marcosa nació en el poblado de Lares de la provincia de Calca del departamento del Cusco pero actualmente vive en el poblado de Rumichaca Baja. Este pueblo se localiza en el distrito de Urubamba, provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco, Perú. 

Marcosa tiene 44 años edad y es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene  siete hijos, ella tiene diferentes actividades económicas como por ejemplo se dedica a la agricultura, a la preparación de chicha de jora y a la crianza de animales menores. Marcosa prepara dos veces a la semana chicha de jora, ella desde muy joven aprendido a preparar chicha pues sus padres también se dedicaban a dicha actividad y por lo tanto esta actividad se trasmite de generación en generación. Marcosa es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que saca adelante a su familia. En  esta oportunidad Marcosa requiere el préstamo para comprar maíz para preparar jora y también para comprar cerveza. 

Marcosa es integrante del grupo “Los Girasoles de Rumichaca Baja” lo conforman 19 socios que viven en el poblado de Rumichaca Baja y donde realizan sus actividades económicas.
texts.en:
Marcosa was born in the village of Lares in the province of Calca in the department of Cusco, but now lives in the village of Rumichaca Baja.  This town is in the Urubamba district, province of Urubamba and department of Cusco, Peru.

Marcosa is 44 years old and married, and has seven children from this relationship.  She works in different economic activities such as, for example, she works in agriculture, making "chicha de jora" [a corn beverage], and raising small farm animals.

Marcosa makes chicha de jora twice a week.  She learned to make chicha when she was very young since her parents also worked this job, so this work is transmitted from generation to generation.  Marcosa is an enterprising and hard-working woman who gets her family ahead.

This time Marcosa needs the loan to buy corn to make jora and also to buy beer.

Marcosa is a member of the Los Girasoles de Rumichaca Baja group, made up of 19 members who live in the village of Rumichaca Baja where they carry out their jobs.

loans.use: to buy corn to make "chicha de jora" and to buy beer.

loans.name: Jorge De Jesus

texts.es: Jorge, necesita invertir nuevamente en agricultura ya que su producción ha salido y debe procesarla, pagará mano de obra para sacar el maíz de la milpa y para qué se ha procesado en una desgranadora de maíz, dejando limpia la cosecha lista para el consumo familiar y para ponerla a la venta. Esta producción que está punto de sacar es producto del préstamo anterior ya que sus cultivos fueron beneficiados con los insumos agrícolas tener estos resultados.
texts.en:
Jorge needs another agricultural loan so that he can invest in his production and proceed with processing his output. He will pay the labor costs associated with harvesting the corn from his field so that it can be processed at the mill and prepared for sale and family consumption.

The corn that will be harvested is the by-product of his previous loan. His crops benefited from the farming supplies he purchased and he was able to achieve these results.

loans.use: to pay for labor so that the corn can be harvested.

loans.name: Juana Guadalupe

texts.es: La señora Juana  es cliente de nuestra institución trabaja con el banco de emprendimiento Nueva Vida ella vive en la zona de Coqueni en la casa de  sus papas ella tiene un pequeño hijo de  su esposo el Sr. julio es transportista, la Sra.  Juana se dedica a la venta de ajís y tunta los cuales los trae de la localidad de  Desaguadero frontera entre Bolivia y Perú,  reparte la mercadería en las comideras de los mercados de la zona ella esta solicitando el crédito para la compra de tunta y aji para las fiestas de fin de año y de carnavales ya que se aproxima esta festividad y ya tiene muchos pedidos, la Sra. Juana es una persona muy trabajadora se siente agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Juana is a client of our MFI. She works with the communal bank Nueva Vida. She lives in the area of Coqueni, in her parents' house. She has a small child with her husband Julio, who is a carrier. Juana makes a living selling ají (chilli) and tunta (dehydrated potatoes). She brings these items from the town of Desaguadero on the border of Bolivia and Peru and distributes the stock in the markets of the area. 

She is requesting this loan to buy tunta and ají for end of year celebrations and carnivals as these festivities is soon and she already has many orders. Juana is a hard working person. She appreciates the support offered by the MFI.

loans.use: to buy ají and tunta.

loans.name: Julio Dimas

texts.es:
Julio es un hombre de 21 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Chiclayo, en el distrito de Guadalupe con sus padres y hermanos, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar, Julio no ha podido estudiar la carrera profesional de Gastronomía, pero le gustaría poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar futbol con sus amigos y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pato para compartir con si familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Julio trabaja en como técnico en una taller de soldadura de su ciudad, él trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
 Julio se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una maquina soldadora, la cual le servirá de mucho para poder darle mejores acabados a sus trabajos, así pues Julio seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de poder convertirse en una buen profesional.
texts.en:
Julio is a 21 year old, single man who lives with his parents and siblings in the city of Chiclayo in the Guadalupe district. He is a very friendly, hard working and enthusiastic person who really wants to excel. Unfortunately, because of a lack of financial resources and the need to work, Julio has not been able to study to be a professional chef. He would like to be able to do that someday. In his free time he likes to play soccer with his friends and on occasion, cook a delicious dish of rice with duck to share with his family.

Through a lot of hard work, drive and dedication, Julio works as a technician in a soldering shop in his city. He works everyday for about 10 hours a day and believes that things are going well because of his good performance and because of the friendly way he treats others. 

Julio is very grateful for the Kiva micro loans as they will help him purchase his own soldering equipment to give his work better finishes. This will allow him to continue working to achieve his biggest dream of becoming a professional.

loans.use: purchase soldering equipment.

loans.name: Louise's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe a été crée le 02 novembre 1995. Il est composé de 9 femmes très solidaires et habitant toutes le même village. Leur principale activité est le commerce de bétail.

Debout à droite de la photo et levant la main, la vedette est âgée de 51 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 07 enfants dont 03 garçons dont le cadet a 15 ans.

Avec le prêt reçu, elle s’approvisionne au marché de sa capitale régionale  en petits ruminants que sont les moutons et compte en acheter 05 à 30 000 frs l'unité. Elle achète de la nourriture destinée à l'engraissement des sujets en embouche.  Le reste du prêt est utilisé en fond de roulement. 

Après 05 mois, elle revend l'unité à 75 000 frs toujours au marché d'approvisionnement. 

Les bénéfices lui servent à inscrire ses enfants à l'école et l'Université en même temps leur acheter des fournitures scolaires mais également améliorer les besoins alimentaires de la famille.
texts.en:
This group was established on November 2, 1995. It is made up of nine women who live in the same village and show great solidarity as a group. Their main business consists in raising livestock.

The featured borrower is standing on the right and rising her hand in the photograph. She's 51 years old, married, and the mother of seven children, including three boys. The youngest is 15 years old.

With her loan, she will buy small ruminants (sheep) at the market of her regional capital. She intends to buy 5 sheep for XOF 30'000 each. She will also buy animal feed to fatten them. The remainder of the loan will be used as working capital.

After five months, she will resell each animal, for XOF 75'000, at the same market where she bought them.

Her profits are used to register her children to school and university and buy them school supplies. They also improve the family's feeding conditions.

loans.use: to buy five sheep to fatten and resell

loans.name: Yeredon 3 Group

texts.fr: Les membres du groupe YEREDON 3  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  31 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à DJIDJENI, commune de FAKOLA, une des sous-préfectures de la 3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur premier prêt avec l’institution. La spéculation cultivée est: l’arachide et le mais avec KADIA la 2ème personne sur la photo de la droite à la gauche position debout. Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labours pour exploiter: 1/2 hectare. La production est vendue à FAKOLA après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 60 000F cfa qui la permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

loans.use: Achat d’intrants, de semences et frais de labours pour la campagne agricole.

loans.name: Eman

texts.en:
Iman is a divorced woman has a lot of will power can overcome all the obstacles in her life, and she lives with her parents ‎in Salt.‎
She decided to do her best and working hard to be able help her family and to be productive woman.‎
Iman is 35 years old divorced woman, she opened her small business which selling traditional dress for clothes which ‎called “Abaya”, she rented a shop in busy area in Salt and she is working hard to provide a living for her parents.‎
She is very ambitious and patient woman, now she wants to buy more “Abaya” and new kinds of clothes to sell but she ‎does not has enough money therefore she decided to apply for a loan to increase her incomes and to be able to cover the ‎treatment expenses for her parents also to improve the standards of living for her and her parents, Iman needs your ‎support.‎

loans.use: buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Rose would like to buy two bales of second hand shoes.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina lives in Buza area, on the outskirts of Dar es Salaam. She is married with four children. She sells maize flour to food vendors. She prepares the flour by herself. She buys the maize in retail, sends it to the milling machine and pack the product in packets of 5-10 kilograms each. She also sell leftover maize as animal feed.

She is planning to increase her stock of maize so she can avoid running out, a frequent problem. To meet her goal she needs a loan of USD 550.

loans.use: Expand business selling maize flour.

loans.name: Judith Eladia

texts.en:
My name is Judith A. and I sell roast chicken. I have been doing this for four years and I have a lot of clients as they like the flavour of my chicken. My aim is to buy more supplies and therefore sell more. I would use the earnings to renovate my business, buy tables and chairs and, most importantly, to feed my family.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Judith A. me dedico a la venta de pollo asado, actividad que realizo desde hace unos 4 años, mi clientela es muy buena ya que les gusta mucho el sabor de mi pollo, mi meta es incrementar mis inventarios y tener una mayor venta y con las ganancias que obtenga poder remodelar mi negocio, comprar mas mesas y sillas y lo mas importante de todo alimentar mi familia.

loans.use: To buy seasoning, chicken, coal, matches, tortillas, bags, disposable plates, soft drinks/compra de condimentos, pollo, carbon, fosforos, tortillas, bolsas, platos desechables, refrescos,

loans.name: Ayyub

texts.en: Ayyub B. is 49 years old, married, and has 3 children. Ayyub and his family live in the Khoshchobanli village near Imishli, which is situated in the southern part of Azerbaijan. Ayyub began his business in 2002, when he purchased a cow and started selling milk and yoghurt to the local people. The income from this small business was sufficient when his children were small, but today their expenses have become difficult to cover. To improve his family's living conditions, Ayyub has applied for a loan of US$1,200 from Aqroinvest CU to purchase another cow for US$800 and a calf for US$400 USD.

loans.use: Purchase of a cow and a calf

loans.name: Chingiz

texts.en: This 37-year-old man lives in Hasanli village, in the Salyan region. He is married, and has one child. Chingiz has had 5 years of experience in this business. Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy pesticides for improving his orchard farming.

loans.use: To purchase pesticides

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret B. is 40 years old and the mother of three children. She lives in the town Alaba, which is in the Lagos State of Nigeria. Her business is selling provisions and drinks. She has been in her business since the year 2000. She needs the loan of $800 to buy more drinks and provisions to sell. Mrs. B. is grateful for your support.

loans.use: To buy more provisions for sale

loans.name: Ualolo

texts.en: Ualolo is a 51 year old married mother of 7 children. Her husband is unemployed. This is Ualolo's 7th loan with SPBD and through her loans she had managed to develop many things for her family, especially her business. Ualolo is one happy mother in Moataa Centre and she is very thankful for such a great opportunity given that she had able to improve her family living.  She would like a loan to buy more supplies for her plantation.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her plantation

loans.name: Kasokoso A(Iii) Group

texts.en: Aisha, Christine and Claire all have brick laying businesses. Aisha is 48 years old and divorced with seven children. Norah runs a canteen and wants to use the loan to purchase more products. With the extra business profits, Aisha wants to pay school fees for the children. p>This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To invest in their businesses.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria lives on Luís Espinal Avenue, Street 4 in the Puerto Mejillones area of the city of El Alto. She lives with her 13 year old daughter, her husband works elsewhere in the state. Victoria sells fruit from a street stand located on the city’s main avenue. The loan is to purchase merchandise (fruit) and thereby increase her sales and her income. This is her first loan with Impro, and her evaluation qualifies her to receive the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Victoria vive en la avenida Luis Espinal, calle 4 de la zona Puerto Mejillones, de la cuidad de El Alto. Vive junto a su hija de 13 año, su esposo trabajo en el interior del departamento. Victoria se dedica al la venta de fruta en un puesto callejero, ubicado en la avenida principal. El crédito lo destinará a la compra de más mercadería (frutas) y así tratar de incrementar sus ventas y por lo tanto sus ingresos. Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: Buy fruit for her fruit stand

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy seeds, herbicide, fertilizer and other supplies for sowing his crop

loans.name: Maria De Jesús

texts.es:
Señora María A. is from the municipality of Somotillo, which is where she works very hard at her business of raising and selling pigs. She has a small corral at her home where she raises and feeds them so they develop in good conditions.

It's necessary to point out that because she is a hard-working mother, she receives the support of her two children in this business. They help her care for and feed the pigs to guarantee their efficient development. In spite of this, the underlying need for her is the urgency of purchasing pigs to raise and sell them in the place where she lives. This is why she is searching for support in Ceprodel to obtain the necessary credit that will give her the economic resources for said purchase.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La señora María A. es originaria del municipio de Somotillo que es donde se dedica muy esforzadamente al negocio de crianza y venta de cerdos en su casa de habitación teniendo un pequeño corral donde los cuida y alimenta para que se logren desarrollar en buenas condiciones.

Es necesario destacar que al ser una madre esforzada recibe el apoyo de sus dos hijos en el negocio los cuales le ayudan a cuidar y alimentar a los cerdos para garantizar su eficiente desarrollo. A pesar de esto, la necesidad atravesada por ella es la urgencia de la compra de los cerdos para su respectiva crianza y comercialización en su localidad donde habita. Por eso busca el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito necesario que le de lugar a la adquisición del recurso económico para dicha compra.

loans.use: Purchase of pigs

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Mr. Juan A. lives in a rented home with his wife and children in the street of Caopolikan, which is the neighborhood of Tembladerani in the city of La Paz. He has a taxi that he uses for providing transportation services. The loan he seeks is to convert his car to be natural gas compatible from gasoline in order to save costs by 50%. Compressed natural gas costs less than gasoline.

This former client of IMPRO has a good credit history that allows him to be granted a new loan. He has had a relationship with IMPRO since 2004.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Spanish Translator.

El señor Juan A. vive en casa alquilada con su esposa y sus hijos en la calle Caopolikan de la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz; tiene un taxi con el cual trabaja en transporte publico y el crédito que solicita es para transformar su vehiculo que actualmente es a gasolina convertirlo a Gas Natural Comprimido y de esta manera poder minimizar sus costos en un 50%, pues el gas natural comprimido cuesta menos que la gasolina.

Es cliente antiguo de Impro y su historial es bueno por lo cual puede acceder a un nuevo crédito. Su relación crediticia con IMPRO data desde el año 2004.

loans.use: to convert his vehicle to use compressed natural gas from gasoline

loans.name: Mouktarou

texts.fr:
Mouktarou I., 35, is married and the father of three children, all enrolled in school. He sells motor oil on the side of a road in Kpalimé, a town located about 120 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. He hopes to use this loan to buy more motor oil for resale. By doing this, he will earn more profit to cater for the needs of his family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Mouktarou I. est âgé de 35 ans, marié et père de 3 enfants tous à l’école. Il est revendeur d’huile à moteur au bord de la route à Kpalimé, une ville située à environ 120 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Il espère par ce crédit acheter plus d’huile à moteur pour la revente. Ce faisant, il gagnera plus de bénéfices pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use:
purchase more motor oil for resale

Acheter plus d’huile à moteur pour la revente

loans.name: Thy

texts.en:
Thy P., 30, and her husband, Sina Auk, 27, a construction worker, live on an island in the Mekong River, about 10 miles from Phnom Penh, Cambodia's capital city. They were married eight years ago have one son and two daughters.

For more than a decade, Thy has earned a living by weaving silk into cloth, a skill she learned from her parents. She sells her finished products to a man in her village, who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh's markets. In addition to weaving, entrepreneurial Thy also wants to start another business of selling vegetables in front of their home.

To help grow her businesses, Thy is requesting a loan of of $400 U.S. dollars to purchase more silk to weave and vegetables to resell. .

loans.use: To purchase silk to weave and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Winefred

texts.en:
Winefred B. is a fishmonger who buys fresh fish and then processes it for sale. She is married, but her husband's income is not sufficient for Winefred and her child. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits.

She is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: As additional capital to expand her business

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Nelly es una mujer emprendedora que inicio su negocio hace cinco años cuando se vio con un hijo que mantener, fue entonces que encontró en el comercio una actividad que le permitiría obtener ganancias que le ayudaran a sacar adelante a su pequeño hijo, ella vende ropa, calzado y por las noches vende hot-dogs y antojitos en un carrito.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $475 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar materia prima y poder continuar con su negocio. Con tu apoyo ella saldrá adelante.
texts.en:
Nelly is an enterprising woman who started her business five years ago in order to take care of her son. She found that her business allowed her to earn money that helped her provide for her son’s future. She sells clothing and footwear during the day. At night, she sells hot dogs and snacks from a cart.

She needs a $475 loan, which she would repay over 6 months, in order to buy the raw materials necessary to move forward with her business plans. With your support she will be able to realize her business goals.

Translated from Spanish by PULP Translators, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying raw materials

loans.name: Philomène

texts.fr: Philomène A. est revendeuse depuis plus de 5 ans, des habits et prêts-à-porter, à Danyi, un village situé à environ 175 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Agée de 42 ans, Philomène est mariée et mère de 4 enfants dont trois sont toujours sur les bancs de l’école. Elle exerce cette activité depuis  3 ans et demeure sa principale source de revenu. C’est ainsi qu’elle souhaite améliorer la capacité de son commerce en achetant beaucoup plus de marchandises, ce qui augmentera ses ventes et par conséquent ses profits afin de mieux répondre aux besoins de ses enfants
texts.en:
Philomène A. has been a retailer for over five years selling outfits and ready-to-wear clothing, in Danyi, a village located about 175 km from Lomé, the Togolese capital. Philomène is 42 years old, married, and the mother of four children, three of whom are still in school. For three years now, she has been in this business, which remains her principal source of income. This is why she would like to expand her business by buying much more merchandise, which will increase her sales and therefore her profits in order to meet the needs of her children better.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy outfits, ready-to-wear clothing, and 'pagnes' for retail sale

loans.name: Celina

texts.en:
Celina I. is 50 years old and she is a widow with 5 children. In this photo, Celina is standing with her third child, who is a graduate of the University of Benin. Celina is a caterer and she bakes cakes for social ceremonies. She also provides outdoor catering services to her customers. 

Celina needs the loan amount of N52,000, US$450, to purchase more catering materials like flour, sugar, and cooking pots. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders and LAPO MICROFINANCE. She says that God will continue to bless Kiva lenders because they are putting smiles on the people's faces.

loans.use: To purchase more catering materials for cooking and baking

loans.name: Lastenia

texts.es:
Lastenia forma parte del Banco Comunal “Señor Del Cautivo II” del distrito y provincia de Huaraz, departamento de Ancash.

Lastenia tiene 56 años de edad, es casada y tiene un hijo. Menciona que no ha tenido problemas difíciles en su vida familiar, que todo ha sido tranquilo hasta ahora. Su logro mayor ha sido tener una familia constituida. Tiene una bodega en su casa, en L. Av. Atusparia 783 desde hace 20 años. Comenta que en su negocio a veces le va muy bien y a veces pierde en sus productos perecibles, siendo ello su principal dificultad. En L. actualidad se encuentra tranquiL. y sigue adelante con su negocio para lo cual recibe L. ayuda constante de su esposo que es cesante (recibe una pensión por haber servido laboralmente al país).
 
Con este préstamo de S/. 500, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, invertirá en L. compra de abarrotes, arroz, azúcar y leche.
 
Lastenia sigue adelante y le gustaría aprender para mejorar el crecimiento de su negocio.
texts.en:
Lastenia is a member of the communal bank called “Señor Del Cautivo II” in the district of Huaraz in the state of Ancash. Lastenia is 56 years old. She's married and has one child. She tells us that she has never had any major family issue/difficulty and that everything has been running smoothly up until now. Her biggest accomplishment has been to have a good, solid and close family life. She has a small store which she runs out of her home, located in the Avenue Atusparia 783, which she has been running over the past 20 years. She tells us that some days are good and then there are some days when she looses all her perishables which is her biggest problem. The business is running o.k. and everything is running smoothly with the help of her husband's pension. Lastenia's husband is deceased and he gets a pension for having served his country. With this loan, which she will repay within 4 months, she will purchase rice, sugar, milk and other groceries. Lastenia just moves ahead and puts her problems behind her. She would like to learn how to better manage and grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar and milk

loans.name: Marisol Felipa

texts.es:
La señora Marisol es socia del Banco Comunal “Dulce Amanecer” del distrito, provincia y departamento de Puno. Tiene 42 años de edad, es casada y madre de 2 hijos. 
Con su primer préstamo de S/. 300 compró prendas de vestir para venderlas en su puesto de trabajo. Tiene casi 2  años trabajando con el banco comunal y nos cuenta que ha aumentado sus ingresos al vender mayor cantidad de ropa. 
Con este préstamo de S/. 1,200, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará ropa para bebe para venderla en su puesto. 
Agustina desea continuar trabajando para apoyar a su familia.
texts.en:
Marisol is a member of the 'Dulce Amanecer' Community Bank in the district, province and department of Puno. She is 42 years old, married and the mother of 2 children. With her first loan of S/. 300 she bought clothing to sell in her stall. She has worked with the community bank for almost 2 years and she tells us that she has increased her income by selling a greater quantity of clothes. With this loan of S/. 1,200, to be repaid in 4 instalments, she will buy baby clothes to sell in her stall. Marisol wishes to continue working in order to support her family.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase baby clothes

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es: Maritza tiene 21 años de edad, muy pronto será madre, actualmente está viviendo en la casa de su madre con sus 6 hermanos y sus padres. Maritza trabaja en la chacra de sus padres conjuntamente con sus hermanos, siembran papa, a ella le agrada sembrar este tubérculo porque es muy rentable, se vende el saco a 60 ó 65 soles, pero tienen que pagar el transporte que es 3 soles por saco, por ello Maritza prefiere esperar a que los compradores pasan por su chacra y así ahorrar el transporte, porque el que compra se lleva el producto. Luego de la cosecha de la papa hecha los granos de arvejas para aprovechar el abono que tiene la chacra y está rica en sustancias que fertilizan la tierra, por ello es que procede a sembrar los granos de arvejas rápidamente, entonces para el proceso de maduración de este producto ya no requerirá mucha inversión, solo estar pendiente de las plagas. Maritza tiene casi 3 años en MFP, este es su 6to préstamo, y está comprometida a seguir con la misma dinámica de trabajo y de pagos puntuales. El dinero que está solicitando es para la compra de fertilizantes, asimismo bolsa de semilla de arvejas para sembrar en la chacra donde va cosechar la papa, con la finalidad de ir incrementando su producción.
texts.en:
Maritza is 21 years old. She will become a mother very soon. At present she is living at her mother's house with her 6 brothers and sisters. Maritza works at her parent's small farm along with her brothers. They sow potatoes and she likes it because it is very profitable. The sack of potatoes sells for 60 to 65 soles ($18-20), but they have to pay 3 soles ($1) per sack for transportation; for this reason Maritza prefers to wait for the buyers to come to her small farm and this way to save on transportation, because the buyer takes the product. After they harvest the potatoes, they sow pea grains because the land is quite rich in substances that fertilize the ground, therefore they don't need a big investment. They only need to look after it to prevent plagues. Maritza has been a member of MFP (Kiva's partner) for almost 3 years. This is her 6th loan, and she is committed to continue with the same dynamics of work and of punctual payments. The requested money will be use to buy fertilizers, also a bag of pea seeds to sow at the small farm where they will harvest potatoes, in order to increase her production.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Maria Olga

texts.es:
Olga inició el negocio por que años anteriores también manejo el negocio de venta de ropa por un periodo de 3 años, lo dejo  pero después quiso volver con la ventas ya se había acostumbrado a tener un  ingreso adicional además que conoce mucha gente pero  se decidió por la venta de cosméticos y le agrado mas este negocio y siente que además que lo maneja mucho mejor  le va muy bien y tiene mucha facilidad para vender. 
Comenzó el negocio hace 5 años primero quería surtir algunos perfumes y cremas solamente ayudándole a una persona para así ver ella  como se sentía siguió metiendo pedidos pero ya por su cuenta viendo que la gente respondía y pasaron alrededor de 8 meses y de repente vio que tenia muchísima clientela  y le pedían de todo cremas cosméticos perfumes tratamientos  para darse abasto pidió el crédito para tener existencia de mercancía antes tenia que ofrecer a diario por las casas de la gente que conocía pero ahora en la actualidad los mismos clientes llegan solos.
El negocio de la Sra. Olga ha crecido gracias a  sus familiares y vecinos que la Han ido recomendando.

Ella necesita un préstamo por MXN $10,000 que pagara en 12 catorcenas para comprar mercancía y  tener  perfumes ya que por la temporada la línea para la que vende ofrece paquetes a precios accesibles y así ella ya los tiene en existencia.
texts.en:
Olga started business because before she had been operating a business selling clothes for 3 years, and when that ended she wanted to return to retail. She had been used to additional income and she started selling cosmetics. She liked this business a lot and she felt like she could do it much better. She very happy to be in retail.

She started business 5 years ago to sell some perfumes and creams, just as an assistant to a person and she could see how to do the work. She felt like following orders and about 8 months passed. She saw that she was suddenly getting a lot of customers and they were asking for a lot of cosmetic creams, treatments and perfumes. She sells to her friends who now come to her on their own. Olga's business has been beneficial for her friends and neighbors, and she is often recommended.

She needs a loan of 10000 Mexican pesos that she will pay in 12 2-week periods. It will be used to buy merchandise. She will have perfumes of limited lines to offer in packets at accessible prices and this way she will stay in business.

Translated from Spanish by Caitlin Brooks, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet Y. is a rice grower. Everyday, she checks her farm, removes the weeds, works under the heat of the sun to ensure enough food for the family. She is 47-years old and has six children. Her husband, Leo Y., helps her  manage the farm. Their harvest is mainly for family use, and what is left over is sold at market for additional income.

She is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers like Ammonium Nitrate, and Urea. She will also buy insecticides to ensure a good harvest form her farm. Juliet is also interested in finding other ways to earn income. She hopes to grow pigs in her backyard when she has the capital.

CEVI helps her sustains her business. CEVI provides her not only credit assistance but trainings and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, ammonium nitrate, urea and herbicides

loans.name: Jesús Del Carmen

texts.es:
Jesús del Carmen O. es una dama muy esforzada el cual se dedica a su actividad de venta de productos varios teniendo su propia pulpería donde a diario la atiende con el fin de mejorar las condiciones de vida de su hogar.

Actualmente ella se ha destacado por ser una excelente trabajadora y ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de la mercadería y así ofrecerla en su locaildad.
texts.en:
Jesús del Carmen O. is a very hardworking woman who sells a variety of goods in her convenience store. She is open every day in order to improve her family's living conditions. She stands out as an excellent worker and has approached Ceprodel for a loan to buy merchandise and retail it in her neighbourhood.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy goods to retail

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.en:
Trí Phạm (630071669) is a 52 year-old female living in the town of Hưng Nguyen.  She is married and has 4 adult children. To making a living, Trí works in a family member's business venture in the manufacturing sector operating a manufacturing business.
