While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from manufacturing & selling wood products to local businesses and community members.  Trí has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately (~US$280) 5,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2007, Trí joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Trí has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund.  This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Trí is now requesting a new loan of 15,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products  This will be the second loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund. Trí plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the her family.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for manufacturing business.

loans.name: Sem

texts.en:
Sem N., 39, is married and lives with her husband in the Kampong Cham province. She supports her family by selling vegetables in the market and is able to earn US$6 of profit every day. Her husband is a construction foreman and makes US$10 per day. This couple has one little child.

Mrs. Sem N. would like to take out a loan to purchase construction materials for her husband.

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Darling Aracely

texts.es: Darling Aracely Rodríguez Martínez tiene la edad de 26 años, su estado civil es soltera. Darling tiene 1 hijo y asiste a una escuela. La actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 8 años que se dedica a este negocio. Darling es una joven muy trabajadora y siempre le ha gustado trabajar, ya que tenia que hacerse cargo de su hijo, es por eso que decidió ingresar al mercado con este negocio. Los propósitos de Darling son que su clientela aumente para que tener una variedad de gustos. El dinero solicitado es para capital de trabajo en la compra de cosméticos, calzado, ropa interior entre otros. Los sueños de esta Joven son de seguir trabajando con fundación león 2000 ya que es por medio de ella que recibe la ayuda de las organizaciones amigas.
texts.en:
Darling Aracely Rodríguez Martínez is 26 years old and is single. Darling has a son and attends school. She makes money in general by selling merchandise. She has dedicated herself to this business for more than 8 years. Darling is a hardworking young woman, and she has always liked to work, since she has had to take care of her son. It is for this reason that she decided to enter the market with this business. Darling's goals are to expand her clientele so that she will have a variety of tastes. The money that she is requesting is for working capital to buy cosmetics, footwear, underwear, etc. This young woman's dreams are to continue working with Fundación León 2000 since it is through it that she receives the help of the partner organizations.

Translated from Spanish by Anne R., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics, footwear, underwear, etc.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 24-year-old man living in Jnah, Mount Lebanon. He has been working in car electric repair since 2006. Today, Ahmad is requesting to borrow $1,200 to buy equipment and car batteries for his shop.

loans.use: To buy equipment and car batteries.

loans.name: Yasmin

texts.es:
Yasmín es socia del Banco Comunal Legioncito.
Yasmín es conviviente, tiene 39 años y 3 hijos, de profesión Obstetriz, Yasmín junto a su esposo tienen Consultorios Obstétricos que se llama Clínica de la Mujer y Familia Los Jazmines, para lo cual cuenta con personal técnico que trabajan con ella, tiene 3 sucursales los cuales están equipados.
Yasmin necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de medicamentos.
Los sueños de Yasmin son que sus hijos sean profesionales y construir una clínica.
texts.en:
Yasmín is a member of the Legioncito communal bank group. She is 39 years old, has 3 children, and lives with her partner.

Yasmín is an obstetrician. She and her spouse have an obstetrics practice called “Jasmine’s Clinic for Women and Families”. They have 3 fully-equipped locations and employ technical staff to assist them.

She needs a loan of 600 soles so that she can purchase medicines. Yasmín dreams of building a clinic and that her children grow up to become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase medicines

loans.name: Florencia

texts.es:
La señora Florencia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Santiago Apóstol”  que esta ubicado en el del distrito de Paucarcolla, Provincia de San Román, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 40 años de edad, estado civil casada, es madre de 03 hijos y tiene estudios de primaria completa,  vive en jr. Santa Bárbara 314.

Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 2 años,  con un préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, para su negocio de preparación de comidas. 

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo de S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de azúcar, arroz, leche, fideos, gas y verduras para su restaurante.

Su deseo es agrandar su restaurante.

A ella le gusta la facilidad en los préstamos  y los encuentros.
texts.en:
Florencia belongs to the “Santiago Apóstol” Communal Bank located in the Paucarcolla district, San Román province, Puno department. She is 40 years old, married with 3 children, and has completed primary school. She lives at Santa Bárbara 314. She has worked with Manuela Ramos for 2 years. Her first loan for S/.300.00 soles was used for her food business. Today she needs a loan for S/.500.00 Nuevos Soles to buy sugar, rice, milk, noodles, fuel, and vegetables for her restaurant. Her wish is to enlarge her restaurant. She likes the support she receives from her loans and the Communal Bank’s meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sugar, rice, milk, noodles, fuel, and vegetables for her restaurant.

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle O. is the wife of a fisherman. The two have three children ranging in age from eight to three years old. Anabelle is 32 years old and lives with her family in a distant village in the province of Antique surrounded by the sea and mountains. 

People in their village do not go to market very often, because they try to avoid spending too much on transportation. Instead, people put up mini variety stores that sell basic necessities to fellow villagers. Each one tries to offer convenience to each family in their village. 

Annabelle has her own business. She cooks and sells noodle soup. She also sells fish that her husband catches from the ocean. Since she started her business in 2006, she realized that food is the most salable product in their village. When she joined ASHI in 2007, she used the loan she received to finance the business she had started. Because she had demonstrated to ASHI her good performance in repayment, attendance and business, she qualifies for larger loans. Now she wants to buy her husband a fishing boat of his own to catch more fish so she can sell more fish. 

Annabelle wishes that, someday, she can purchase more fishing boats to have more fish to sell throughout the municipality, not just in their village. She wishes that she can give her children a good life, bring out her children of poverty, and send them to college.

loans.use: To buy the materials needed for a fishing boat .

loans.name: Anna Ndinohabwe ‘S Group

texts.en:
Anna is a leader of 5 members of a group.  She is a 26 year single mother of two children aged 3 Anna Anna is is a leader of 5 members of a group.  She is a 26 year single mother of two children aged 3 years and 2 months. All her children go to school. She resides and rents a one roomed house where she is staying with five people. Anna doesn’t take care of any additional family members There is electricity and no piped water at her home.  The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in a semi urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala. Anna stays in Makerere Kikoni owning a Stationery shop in one of Kampala suburbs.  She incurs extra transport costs to and from shopping. Anna sells to an average of 20 people a day and sells to all categories of people. She works six days a week. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.  She has been in this business for the last three years Anna has been with MCDT for one and half months and servicing her first loan, working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy to stationery like reams of papers and box files and pens .Anna is aspiring of seeing her business grow bigger and owning a Book shop. 

.

loans.use: To buy more stationery for her  shop

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Even before Helen A., 54 years old, became a member of ASHI in 2008, rice production (rice farming) was already her business. When she joined ASHI, she started a hog fattening (pig raising) business while she was waiting for her rice crop to reach the harvesting stage. Through hog fattening Helen also felt that she could have a source of capital for her rice production business. She would use the funds from selling her pigs towards the rice farming. She would also be able to run her rice production business independently from the allowance given to her by her two single sons.

Helen has four children and a farmer husband. Her two eldest children have their own families now, while her third son has been working abroad for a year. Her youngest son works in a factory in Manila. Helen and her farmer husband work their farm and hire farm laborers only during planting season. Every planting season, Helen worries about the expenses that her farm requires to produce rice. She doesn’t want to oblige her children to provide for her financial needs. For this reason, she wants to expand her hog fattening business. In the hog fattening business, profit can be as much as double the amount of capital after only four months of raising pigs. The more pigs she has to sell, the more Helen will profit. With the loan Helen is presently requesting, she will buy more pigs and she will also finance the planting of rice.

When Helen’s business becomes stable, she would like to help her children to send their children to school until graduating from college.

loans.use: Will be used to finance her growing hog fattening (pig raising) business and rice production (rice farming) business.

loans.name: Illimani Group

texts.es: Hace diez años aproximadamente, en el centro focal Senkata se reúne la asociación “illimani” esta formada por trece socias muy trabajadoras que se dedican principalmente a la elaboración de comida y en algunos casos al comercio de distintos productos (plásticos, ropa interior, carteras, sombreros y otros), algunas cuentan con pensiones propias, y en otros casos tienen puestos en vías publicas. Ellas precisan de capital para poder comprar mercadería o insumos esto hará reactivar sus negocios.
texts.en:
About ten years ago, thirteen hard-working women from Senkata formed the Illimani group. Group members mostly sell food, though some of them deal in plastic goods, underwear, wallets, hats, etc. Some members have their own storefronts, while others are set up along public roads. The Illimani group will use this loan to invest in and re-invigorate their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Corinne Gilroy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying merchandise

loans.name: Juvie Ann

texts.en:
Juvie Ann E. is a resident of Barangay Villa Coloma in Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 25 years old and she has an elementary-school education. Due to financial difficulty, she married without thinking about the consequences of early marriage. She is married to Oscar E. and they are blessed with three children. Due to our economic crisis, she realized that getting married early is not easy if you are not ready for it. She regrets her decision, but she can do nothing but fulfill her responsibility as a mother.

Since they don’t have a profession, her husband grows a variety of vegetables in their garden. Juvie opened a small store and eatery in front of their house to help her husband to earn enough income to suppport their children. She started her business with little capital and it earns a net income of Php 700 per week. Due to high cost of commodities and school expenses, she needs to increase her income to meet their needs. 

She wants to borrow money from Alalay sa Kaunlaran, Inc. (ASKI) to develop her business and increase her income. She has applied for Php 5,000 to improve her small store. She believes that she can able to improve her small business and support the education of their children with ASKI's help.

loans.use: Additional capital to improve her store

loans.name: Glace

texts.en:
Glace V. is from the village of Tuod, Manticao Misamis Oriental. She is 24 years old. Glace is single. To make a living, Glace is starting a business venture operating a specialized retail business. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling personal beauty products, such as lotion, cologne and others in the local community. Glace is just starting this business.

In September 2009, Glace joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Glace is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Glace from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
Hong S., 29, is married with two school-aged children. She resides in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, with her husband (pictured) and children. To make a living, she and her husband are engaged in a business of raising pigs for sale, earning collectively an income of US$ 10 per day as a primary source of income for the family. This is her second loan from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner.

Mrs. S. and her family members are seeking to improve their standard of living and to generate a better income. Therefore, S. is asking for a loan of US$ 1000 to purchase more pigs to raise for sale.

loans.use: buy pigs to raise

loans.name: Jeanna

texts.en: Jeanna C. is from the village of Camanga,Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 41 years old, is married, and has four school-aged children. Jeanna owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Jeanna joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from PMPC. Jeanna is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be her 5th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida S. is from the town of Turod Norte in the municipality of Cordon on Luzon. She is 59 years old, married and has four school-aged children. Leonida raises pigs to sell. She has been in business for over ten years and earns approximately 2500 PHP whenever she sells her pigs.

In 2009, Leonida joined ASKI to gain access to its financial services. She is requesting a loan, her first, of 5000 PHP that will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. She plans to use any additional revenue to grow her business.

About ASKI (Alalay sa Kaunlaran, Inc.):

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and –women, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy pig feed and other supplies.

loans.name: Arline

texts.en:
Arline R. G., 31, was born on December 6, 1977. She is married to Victor G. and they are blessed with one child who is in elementary school. She and her family live in Silang, Cavite, a province just South of Manila.

Arline has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for three years. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow twelve times from CCT’s Cooperative. The reason why she was consistent in paying her loans was because she used almost all of the money she borrowed to buy and sell assorted feeds to her increasing consumer base.

Now with your help, she would like to apply for a PHP 26,000 loan. This amount will be mostly used to buy additional stocks of rice, different beverages and assorted canned goods for her variety store.

She prays that her business will continue to grow so that one day it will become a mini-grocery. She hopes that some day they will have enough money to send their child to college and that they will have a chance to travel around the world.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy additional stocks of rice, different beverages, and assorted canned goods for her variety store.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan es soltero, tiene 34 años de edad, y vive junto a sus padres en el caserío La Pava, distrito de Mochumí, ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar como obrero agrícola desde que era muy joven, trabaja en diversos campos de cultivo de la zona. Esta actividad no le ofrece la estabilidad suficiente para solventar sus gastos personales y para ayudar a sus padres, por lo que desde hace un año empezó a trabajar adicionalmente en la crianza de animales y en la comercialización de leña.

Juan compra troncos de algarrobo recien talados a comercializadores de la zona y lo corta en trozos para ofrecérselos a sus clientes en “armadas” (atos de leña) de 30 unidades. Además también cría animales de corral para venderlos a los comerciantes que visitan la zona eventualmente.

El negocio de la venta de leña es de utilidad en la zona donde vive ya que la mayoría de familias cocinan sus alimentos con este producto, por lo que Juan está planeando ampliar su negocio, por este motivo está solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles para invertirlos en la compra de más troncos de algarrobo con los cuales pueda  captar más clientes.

Juan es un hombre muy conocido en la zona donde vive, sus vecinos y clientes le tienen mucha estima. Su más grande anhelo es sacar adelante a sus padres y ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Juan is single and 34 years old. He lives with his parents in the small town of La Pava, Mochumí district, located an hour from the city of Chiclayo. He has worked as a farmworker since he was very young, and he works in various fields in the area. This work does not provide enough stability to cover his expenses and also help his parents. For this reason, for a year he has also been working selling firewood and raising animals. Juan buys the trunks of recently cut carob trees from sellers in the area and he cuts them in smaller pieces so that he can offer them to his customers in “armadas” (bundles of firewood) containing 30 units. He also raises barnyard animals to sell to merchants who visit the area from time to time. His firewood business is useful in the area where he lives because the majority of families there use firewood for cooking. For this reason Juan is planning to expand his business, and is requesting a first-time loan of 1000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa. He will invest the money in the purchase of more carob tree trunks with which he can get more customers. Juan is well known in the area in which he lives. His neighbors and customers hold him in great esteem. His greatest wish is to help his parents get ahead and to offer them a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of carob tree trunks in order to sell firewood.

loans.name: Digna Esperanza

texts.es: Digna Esperanza tiene 63 años, tiene 3 hijos y todos trabajan de manera independiente. Su actividad económica es la venta de repostería y comida. Hace más de 18 años que se dedica a este negocio, ella se levanta temprano todos los días pues tiene que limpiar su hogar y además su negocio, ya que la mayoría de sus clientes asisten muy temprano a su local para realizar la compra de sus deliciosas reposterías. Ella solicita este financiamiento específicamente para capital de trabajo ya que invertirá en materia prima necesaria para su negocio. su deseo es proporcionarle mejoras a su humilde vivienda.
texts.en:
Digna Esperanza is 63 years old and has three children who all work independently. She sells baked goods and food. Her business has been in operation for more than 18 years. Digna wakes up early every morning to clean her house and then proceeds to her business. Most of her customers arrive at her shop early to purchase her delicious pastries.

She is requesting a loan specifically to use as operating capital to buy raw materials for her business. Her wish is to make improvements to her modest home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw materials for her business

loans.name: Burikhon

texts.ru: Нурматов Бурихон проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 24 года. Женат, имеет 2 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Он живет вместе с радителями. Брат, строитель а отец занимается растениеводством. Сам Бурихон более 5 лет занимается животноводством. Он разводит скот. Кредит берет для закупа крупно- рогатого скота. Бурихон хочет купить молодого бычка и увеличить количество скота.
texts.en:
Burikhon N. lives in the area of Javan. He is twenty-four, married and has two children. His wife is a homemaker and they live together with his parents. His brother is in construction and father is in agriculture. Burihon has raised cattle for more than five years. He is asking for a loan to purchase additional cattle. Burihon would like to buy a young bull for breeding and increase the number of his cattle.

Translated from Russian by Susan Savkov, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Gene

texts.en:
Gene C. joined ASHI recently to request for a loan which will enable her to grow her small “sari-sari” (variety) store business. Her family - including her three children ages 7 to 10 years - is ble to enjoy the profit of her business.  However, she has been unable to grow the business quickly due to lack of capital. In this case, Gene now is requesting for a loan from ASHI. Hopefully she will be able to increase the inventory of her store and will gain more customers.

Gene dreams of graduating her children from college in the future. Therefore, she wants to support them in all of their needs for the enhancement of their growth as a person and as human beings through the proceeds of her business.

loans.use: To purchase goods to sell in her store.

loans.name: Theany

texts.en:
Mrs. Theany D., age 31, (shown with her son) and her husband, Mr. Min Men, age 37, live along National Road Number Six about eighteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2004 and have three children: two sons and one daughter. One of their children attends school and the other two are still too young. Besides her children, Theany also has her elderly parents living with her.

Theany has been selling coconuts for two years. She buys them from Kampong Thom province and transports them to sell in Phnom Penh market. Her husband has been a fisherman since they married.

Theany hopes to start a new business selling rice and she will be able to generate more income as well. Therefore, she is asking for her first loan of US$1,100 to purchase rice to sell.

loans.use: To purchase rice to sell

loans.name: Nicanor

texts.es:
Nicanor, de 55 años, es un padre de familia muy responsable y trabajador. Vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Marina de 50 años, quien le apoya en la chacra, y con 3 de sus 8 hijos, a los cuales desea brindar una buena educación para que tengan un buen futuro al igual que sus hermanos mayores.

Sus tierras son de las mejores cultivadas en el poblado de “Yanama”, tiene sembrado papa, alverja, maíz y choclo, productos que son rápidamente comprados por los comerciantes mayoristas en el mercado de la ciudad, ya que saben de la buena calidad de sus cultivos.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar sus tierras y lo hace con mucho cariño, lleva 40 años realizando esta actividad, motivo por el cual es considerado uno de los mejores agricultores de su pueblo. Por otro lado, cree que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de las plagas que pueden afectarlos. Con el tiempo, espera comprarse un carro con el cual pueda transportar el mismo sus productos.

Este es el sexto préstamo de Nicanor con MFP y se siente en la capacidad de pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo. Él es uno de los miembros más activos de su banco comunal, por eso es muy querido y respetado. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará abono y fertilizantes para volver más productivas sus tierras.
texts.en:
Nicanor is 55 years old. He is a very responsible and hard working father and husband. He lives in his own home with his wife, Marina, who is 50 years old. She supports him in the field. He also lives with 3 of his 8 children, to whom he wishes to offer a good education so that they can have a good future like their older siblings. His land is among the best cultivated in the town of “Yanama”. He has planted potatos, peas, and corn. These products are quickly bought by wholesalers in the city market, since they know the high quallity of his crops. What he likes the most about his work is planting his land. He does this with a lot of affection. He has been doing this for 40 years, and he is considered one of the best farmers in his town. On the other hand, he thinks that the hardest thing is protecting his crops from the diseases that can affect them. With time, he hopes to buy himself a car with which he can transport his products himself. This is the sixth loan that Nicanor has had with MFP and he feels able to make all of his payments on time. He is one of the most active members in his communal bank, and because of this he is very well liked and respected. With the thousand nuevos soles he has asked for he will buy fertilizers to make his lands more productive.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Milena Margarita

texts.es:
Milena Margarita O. Guzmán tiene 24 años y vive con su cónyuge y su hijo de 3 años,  en el  populoso barrio El Bosque, uno de los más extensos de Barranquilla  y está ubicado en el suroccidente de la ciudad, con una población de 50 mil habitantes.   Milena comenzó su negocio  de venta de perfumes, ropa, calzado, cosméticos, mediante guía especializadas de productos y de manera independiente hace 5 años, ante la necesidad de generar ingresos propios, con lo que pidió dinero prestado a un familiar y debido a que es muy organizada su actividad creció a través del tiempo y ahora solicita un crédito por valor de $2.000.000, que invertirá en la compra de calzado y ropa femenina y masculino, también en productos que exhibe en su catálogo como accesorios femeninos e infantiles y perfumes. 
Está vinculada a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo hace más de un año, en el que ha aprovechado muy bien  su  financiamiento,  pues logró  aumentar su capital de trabajo y sus utilidades,  y con ello su acceso  a nuevos bienes y servicios;  de esa manera  ha mejorado su nivel de vida.
Su meta principal es destacar su negocio teniendo una infraestructura  que le permita exhibir los productos que vende, es decir crear su propio punto de venta. Su sueño es que su pequeño hijo tenga la mejor educación posible y está trabajando para ello; ahora el mayor desafió de Milena es el otorgamiento de créditos de fácil recuperación, porque con algunos  clientes ha tenido que llenarse de paciencia y renegociar su deuda, por eso ahora está más atenta a su mercado de trabajo.
texts.en:
Milena Margarita is 24 years old and lives with her husband and her three children in the populous El Bosque neighborhood, one of the most extensive in Barranquilla. It is located in the south-east part of the city and has a population of 50 million. Milena began her business of selling perfumes, clothing, shoes, and cosmetics five years ago because she needed to earn her own income. She got a loan from her family and since she is well organized, was able to grow her business over time. Now she is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 COP ($1,050) in order to invest in shoes, men’s and women’s clothing, and other items that she features in her catalog, such as children’s and ladies accessories and perfumes. She’s been working with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo for the past year, where she has made good use of her loan. She was able to increase her working capital and its usefulness, which gave her access to new services. This enabled her to improve her quality of life. Her primary goal is to make her business stand out by creating an infrastructure that will allow her to showcase her products. In other words, she would like to have her own point of sale. Her dream is that her young son gets the best education possible and she is working toward that. Now her only challenge is collecting the money that some of her customers owe her, because some have not kept up with their payments and she has had to be patient and renegotiate their debts. This is why she is so attentive to her market.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn L., 36 years old,  is managing a small rice field. She is childless. Her husband is a farmer and they work together to improve their harvest to supplement their needs. She joined the CEVI program in 2009. She likes the CEVI services and feels secured of its insurance policy . Now, the family is preparing the farm for another planting. They need additional money to buy all the farming materials. She would like to apply for a loan of PHP 9,000 at Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies and fertilizers.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Medina

texts.en:
37-year-old Medina C. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She has two school-aged children. To make a living, Medina owns & operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. Medina has been engaged in her business for over eight years already.

Medina joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Medina has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Medina is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Medina from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children and improve her farm.

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training, which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en: Jessie N. is from the village of Holy Friday. She is 38 years old. Jessie is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Jessie runs a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Jessie has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2006, Jessie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jessie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI, a Kiva partner. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Jessie is requesting a new loan of 16,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be the ninth loan taken out by Jessie from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. About ASKI ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Noeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Noeun N. is a widow with three children who attend local public school. The family lives in Tuol Kandal village in Takeo province. She was born in 1968 and she is a farmer who owns 2.3 hectare of land where she cultivates rice to sell to support her family. She is also a farm laborer.

Now she has some problems because her field is ready to grow rice but she did not have enough money for supplies. To improve her production Mrs. Noeun N. is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide, and gasoline.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide, and gasoline.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly C. is from the village of Acad in Aurora Zamboanga del Sur. She is 31 years old and married with 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Nelly raises crops, primarily corn, for selling. Nelly has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Nelly joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nelly has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. Nelly is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Nelly from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Neysi Nadin

texts.es:
Neysi de 26 años de edad es madre soltera de una niña, actualmente se desempeña como pequeña comerciante de productos lacteos en Nueva Guinea. Cuenta con la ayuda economica del padre de su hija quien le pasa una pension que le permite solventar los gastos del hogar.  

Esta solicitando refinanciamiento de su 6to credito para invertirlo en la compra de compra productos lácteos para posteriormente venderlos en todas la colonias de Nueva Guinea y finaliza la comercialización entregando en Managua.  

Su mayor sueño es tener su propia empresa y tener su propio capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Neysi, age 26, is a single mother of one daughter. She currently works as a small merchant selling dairy products in Nueva Guinea. Her partner helps her financially; he receives benefit payments that allow him to cover household expenses. Neysi is applying for her 6th loan to invest in the purchase of dairy products to sell in the neighborhoods of Nueva Guinea, finishing her sales in the capital city of Managua. Her greatest dream is to have her own business and working capital.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of products.

loans.name: Andriy

texts.en:
Andriy is single and owns a clothing sales business in his home town of Mukachevo. Andriy sells blouses, tops, skirts, jackets, purses and accessories in a store called "Scarlet". He inherited this business from his parents who started it as their family venture. Andriy has been running the store on his own for 3 years. Currently, he has 36,000 Grivnyas worth of inventory and his gross income is 18,000 Grivnyas.

Andriy is seeking a loan of 9,500 Grivnyas to refresh the assortment of merchandise he offers for sale in his store. His long term goal is the continued expansion of his business and increase in sales which will result in a stable income and improvement of living standards for Andriy himself and his family.

loans.use: to increase his turnover capital

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia L. is a married woman who lives in Purok Mangga, Brgy. Sangi Riverside, Toledo City, Cebu. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: a sari-sari (general) store and a house for rental. Her husband Pablo L. is 58 years old and helps in his wife's business activities. They have three children who are 31 to 35 years old. 

Nelia  joined NWTF - Project Dungganon in 1999 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 17 cycle loans from NWTF - Project Dungganon, Nelia  has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 25,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 26,400, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 18th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 29,500, which she intends to use to fund her business operations so that she can continue to save up for the future of her family. Nelia is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. 

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To help fund her business operations

loans.name: Norman

texts.en: Norman is a 24-year-old member of Unique 09 group of Faulu Kenya. He supplies bread and cakes in Kayole town in Nairobi East. His business is located in a very competitive environment. He supplies cakes and bread to shops, schools and hospitals. He also works as a housing agent to boost his income. Norman has been in business for three years. He has managed to expand his business and has become one of the major suppliers of cakes and bread. He hopes to expand his business to other territories in the future. He has requested 80,000 Kenyan shillings to purchase a motorbike for transporting his products.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en: Antonio F. is from the village of Sepac, Sapang Dalaga. He is 51 years old and a widower with five adult children. To make a living, Antonio is a fisherman. The main source of income for the business comes from selling his ocean-caught fish in the local community. Antonio has been engaged in his business for over eight years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2008, Antonio joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Antonio has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,000 PHP from PMPC. Antonio is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fishing materials. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Antonio from PMPC. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fishing materials

location.town: Calamba-Sapang Ama Sapang Dalaga Misamis Occidenta

loans.name: Damira's Group

texts.en: Damira G. is the leader of the group. She is 26 and divorced. She has to bring up her 3-year-old son alone. She makes her living by sewing national costumes: dresses, gowns and trousers. Three years ago, her mother passed this business to her, and out of the profits she has managed to purchase a set (18000 soms). In order to buy fabrics and materials for sewing warm gowns to sell, Damira hopes to get a loan. In the future, she is planning to open her own dressmaking and tailoring establishment and to provide village girls with an appropriate kind of work. Orunbai K., 30, is married. His family has two children in it. The main source of income for the family is from his own business: He bakes national bread and sells flour. His business was started two years ago, after he had been working as a baker in the capital. Out of the business profits, he has managed to obtain a car. In order to purchase 20 bags of flour, Orunbai needs to get a loan. By now he has two bakeries and in the future, he is planning to open one more in the next village. Taalaibek K., 30, is married. He runs his own business of reselling foodstuffs and household goods in his own shop, where his wife also works as a saleswoman. Five years ago, Taalaibek’s parents sold hardware, then they passed the business to him. Out of his profits, he additionally has managed to begin car reselling. The loan purpose is to purchase a car (120,000 soms), taking into account the fact that he has 90,000 soms already. In the future, he is planning to open his own mini market in the village. Altynai S., 24, is married. Together with her husband, who raises money by working as a driver, she is bringing up a daughter. Altynai has a profession as a seamstress. Today, she makes her living by sewing national costumes: dresses, gowns, blouses and so on. She also restores clothes on order. Out of her earnings, she has managed to purchase a calf. The purpose of her loan is to purchase stuff for sewing dresses. In the near future, Altynai wants to dedicate more time to her hobby; that’s why she is planning to open her own sewing shop in the village. Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple "P" bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics and materials

loans.name: Abass

texts.en: Abass is 47 years old, married and the father of two children. Abass has worked as a shirt tailor for the past 15 years. Abass is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua to buy a new sewing machine which is necessary for his business. His clients are tailoring factories, friends, neighbors, and villagers. Abass hopes to expand his business by owning a factory of his own.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Hak's Group

texts.en:
Four members living in Peam Reang Kraom village in Kandal province make up this group loan. Their portion of the loan can improve their standard of living. Mrs. Hak P. is 44 years old and was selected by the other members as the group leader. 

She and her husband, Mr. Vanna Sor, are farmers who own a five-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support their family. Now she has some problems because her field has infertile soil. So, to improve rice production, Mrs. Hak P. is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer and rice seed. She is the mother of three children, one of whom is a farmer, another is selling groceries in the local village, and the last is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seed

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita M. is from the village of Colambutan Settlement, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 50 years old, married and has 4 adult children. She owns & operates an agricultual business, planting and harvesting coconut for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2006, Nenita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Nenita is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be her seventh loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.es: Lorenzo, de 26 años, vive con su mamá Julia y su abuelita Alicia. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad nativa de Ñagazu (selva central peruana). Este dichoso y emprendedor joven, se dedica a la agricultura; sus principales sembrío son de plátano, café, los que cuida y aplica abono constantemente. Pero como buen agricultor él práctica todo lo que aprende en sus clases de Agronomía, su mayor objetivo, desea terminar con éxito su carrera profesional, para poder abrir una consultoría y así ayudar a los agriculturas de la ciudad de Villa Rica. En todos estos 3 años de trabajo arduo, aprendió a comercializar sus cosechas, y los comerciantes intermediarios conocen de la buena calidad de sus cultivos, por ello en cada cosecha visitan sus terrenos agrícolas para comprarlos. Esté es el quinto crédito con MFP, y como socio antiguo de su banco comunal, agradece el apoyo que recibió durante todo este tiempo. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará varios sacos de abono para esparcirlos en sus sembríos de plátano.
texts.en:
Lorenzo, age 26, lives with his mother Julia and his grandmother Alicia. This family lives in their own home located in the indigenous community of Ñagazu (in the central Peruvian jungle). This fortunate and enterprising young man is a farmer who grows mainly bananas and coffee. He cares for these crops and applies fertilizer on a regular basis. Like any good farmer, he practices everything he learned from his agronomy classes. His greatest goal is to successfully finish his professional degree so that he can open a consultancy practice and help farmers in the city of Villa Rica. After three years of hard work, he learned how to sell his crops and became known among the commercial brokers for the quality of his products. During each harvest they visit his farmland to buy his crops.

This is his fifth loan with MFP. Being a long-time member of his Communal Bank, he is grateful for the support he has received during this time. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy several sacks of compost to apply on his banana crops.

loans.use: Purchase sacks of compost

loans.name: Edwin Alexander

texts.es:
Edwin, de 22 años de edad, reside en El Transito departamento de San Miguel, vive con su abuela y está soltero, él administra una tienda  de donde obtiene ingresos para los gastos de él y su abuela, Edwin desde pequeño aprendió a vender lo que le ha permitido mantenerse con la tienda y cuenta ya con experiencia.  Él necesita invertir en mercadería ya que por momentos su inventario se vuelve débil y no alcanza a cubrir la demanda de los clientes, por lo que solicita un préstamo para la compra de productos para el hogar como, aceite, azúcar, arroz, pastas, detergentes, estos son algunos de los productos demandados en su negocio, por tal razón a decidido realizar compras y aumentar el inventario.
Su objetivo es tener los recursos necesarios para evitar que su negocio decaiga  y que por el contrario pueda mantenerse surtida de productos para los clientes y mejorar su servicio.
texts.en:
Edwin is 22 years old and resides in El Transito, San Miguel department.  He is single and lives with his grandmother. Edwin operates his own store and obtains income for his and his grandmother's expenses. Since he was little he has been learning to sell, and that has permitted him to maintain himself with his store. He can count on that experience.

Edwin needs to invest in merchandise. At present, his stock is weak and insufficient to meet the demands of his customers. For that reason, he is requesting a loan to buy household products, like cooking oil, sugar, rice, pasta, and detergent. These are just some of the products in demand at the store, for which reason he wishes to make purchases and increase inventory.

Edwin's objective is to have the resources necessary to avoid the store's decline. On the contrary, he intends to maintain the supply of products for his customers and improve his service.

loans.use: TO BUY COOKING OIL, SUGAR, RICE, PASTA, AND DETERGENT TO SELL

loans.name: Gantsetseg

texts.en: Gantsetseg B. is 31 years old and lives with her husband and two sons in a ger, a traditional Mongolian housing tent, in the Yaarmag of Han-Uul district of UlaanB., the capital city of Mongolia. Her two sons both attend a local secondary school and her husband works as a driver for the "Auto Speed Company". Gantsetseg is self-employed, making a variety of knitted and woven products in her home. She started her business in 2001 with working capital of 100,000 MNT and has built a stable operation. At first, she started her business with only one sewing machine. After many years of hard work, she managed to expand her business and today her working capital exceeds 2,500,000 MNT with 4 sewing machines. For the future, she plans to establish her own knitted clothing factory. She also needs to hire 3 workers for her 3 sewing machines. Gantsetseg is a hardworking and modest person. She is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan in order to purchase more fabrics, wool yarns and a knitting machine for producing her woolen clothes.

loans.use: to purchase more fabrics, wool yarns and a knitting machine

loans.name: Felix

texts.es: Félix, es un hombre valiente y trabajador, de 36 años; que junto a su esposa Dina, cuidan de sus 3 menores hijos; Fresia, Frank, y Denis. Los que en armonía familiar viven en su casa propia, ubicada  en el caserío de Yanama Alto. Hace 15 años esté sorprendente hombre comenzó su camino de desarrollo económico por la agricultura; donde siembra diversos productos oriundos como papa, arveja y flor de gladiolo. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poder invertir, pues su secreto es; la siembra escalonada, que consiste en sembrar diversos productos, para poder contrarrestar las variaciones de  los precios en el mercado. Ahora después de su próxima cosecha, comenzará a sembrar habas, adelantándose a la temporada, de esa manera estabilizará su economía. Los planes de Félix, son adquirir un auto con el que pueda dedicarse al transporte público en sus días libres. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Manantiales de Yanama”, y esté es el quinto crédito con MFP, donde es un socio activo y comprometido con el trabajo que desempeñan los integrantes de su banco. Félix, cosechará flor de gladiolo dentro de unos días, por ello está pensando invertir el aporte que recibirá en la compra de abono orgánico, asimismo en el salario de los peones para que le ayuden en su cosecha.
texts.en:
Félix is a courageous and hard-working man of 36 who, together with his wife Dina, cares for his three dependent children: Fresia, Frank and Denis.  He and his family live together harmoniously in their own home which is located in the village of Yanama Alto.

15 years ago, this surprising man set out on his path to economic development in the field of agriculture.  He grows a variety of native products such as potatoes, peas and gladioli.  What he most likes about his work is being able to invest.  His secret is staggered planting.  This consists of sowing different products so that he can counteract the ups and downs of market prices.  Following his next harvest, he will begin to sow beans, getting a jump start on the season.  In this way, he will stabilize his finances.

Félix's plans are to buy a car which he will be able to use to provide a public transport service on his days off.  He is a member of the "Manantiales de Yanama" (Yanama Springs) community bank and this is his fifth loan with MFP.  He is an active member of his community bank and is committed to the work that the members of the bank carry out.  Félix will harvest his gladioli in a few days' time.  For this reason, he is thinking of investing his loan money in buying organic manure and paying the salary of the laborers who will help him with his harvest.

loans.use: To buy organic manure and to pay the salary of the laborers who will help him with his harvest

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine is a 35-year-old married lady.  She is blessed with two children aged 2 and 3.  She sells second-hand clothes.  She also owns a salon which she was previously operating before she started selling clothes.  She hopes to start selling clothes wholesale in the future.  She is very grateful to Faulu Kenya for her previous loan because she was able to boost her business.  She has also been saving her money with Faulu Kenya.  She has requested a loan of 60,000 Kes to add to her used clothing inventory.

loans.use: To add stock of clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a new laser photocopier for his shop

loans.name: Ryskul's Group

texts.en:
Ryskul T., 24, is the leader of this group. Ryskul lives in a town called Karabalta with her husband and two children ages 5 and 3. Ryskul started her business career at a very young age and by this time has reached impressive outcomes. The couple has been involved in cattle breeding since they started living together. But three years ago they decided to quit this business and start something new. After reviewing the best options, and their own skills, Ryskul and her husband opened a small café.

The first challenge in making a business plan was choosing the location. There were too many cafes in their hometown, so they looked for a less competitive environment. The perfect spot was the busiest route in the country, connecting two major centers, Bishkek and Osh. Every day thousands of passenger buses and cars take this route. There are picturesque views and sightseeing, but the passengers complain of having a lack of places to stop for lunch. Ryskul and her husband sold all of their cattle and invested the revenue in building a café. It has been three years, and Ryskul’s expectations turned into reality. Ryskul is the chief cook and her husband is the manager and a caterer of all necessary supplies. The family was able to buy new furniture for their house and an automobile. The profits from the business have reached 40,000 monthly, but along with it the inflation and transportation costs have increased the café’s expenses. Ryskul is requesting a loan in order to buy some inputs and raw materials for running the café. If everything goes well, Ryskul dreams of opening another small shop near her café. 

       --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase inputs and raw materials for her cafe

loans.name: Valeryi

texts.en:
Valeryi is married with a grown son, Oleg. Valeryi is a farmer from the small town of Vodyanoye. He owns 6 greenhouses and 3 separate ones for seedlings. In addition, he also has a propagating frame for seedlings. Valeryi has invested about 200,000 UAH in his venture. He has been in this business for 22 years. 

Valeryi is seeking a loan of 15,000 UAH to construct a new greenhouse to expand his farming business. He is planning to use the loan as follows: 4,000 UAH to purchase polyethylene film; 1,000 UAH for metal wires; 1,500 UAH for cucumber seeds; 2,000 UAH  for fertilizers; 6,500 UAH for engineering and building expenses. Thorough management of funds received will ensure greenhouse construction that will be neither expensive nor time-consuming.

loans.use: to construct a greenhouse

loans.name: Elsa Gregoria

texts.es:
Elsa nació en la ciudad D. Macusani D. Carabaya del departamento del Puno, ella tiene 47 años D. edad y vive en la ciudad D. Anta, ella es casada y fruto D. esta unión tiene cuatro hijos. 

Elsa es docente y trabaja en el colegio “50109” D. la comunidad D. Huayacocha. Ya son cinco años que trabaja en ese colegio y le va muy bien gracia al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Elsa también se dedica a la venta D. cosméticos D. la marca “Avon”. En esta oportunidad Elsa requiere el microcrédito para comprar más mercadería como por ejemplo joyas,  perfumes y otras cosas más. 

Elsa es una persona responsable que pertenece al banco comunal “Warmicuna Llanqanchis” D. la Asociación Arariwa D. la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. En la ciudad del Cusco se encuentra ubicada la ciudadela D. los Incas D. Machupicchu, Perú. La palabra “Warmicuna Llanqanchis” proviene D. la lengua Quechua que traducido al Castellano significa “Mujeres que Trabajamos”.
texts.en:
Elsa was born in the city of Macusany D. Carabaya, Puno Department.  She’s 47 years old and lives in the city of Anta.  She’s married and has four children.

Elsa is a Teacher and works at the 50109 School in Huayacocha.  She’s been working there for five years now and does well thanks to the effort she puts into her work.  She also sells Avon brand cosmetics.  On this occasion, Elsa wants the micro loan to buy more merchandise like jewelry, perfume and others, for example.

Elsa is a responsible person who is a member of Asociación Arariwa’s “Warmicuna Llanqanchis” communal bank in the city of Cusco, Perú.

The Inca citadel, Machupicchu, is located in Cusco and the word “Warmicuna Llanqanchis” comes from Quechua and means “Women Who Work.”

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise.

loans.name: Vilma Curambao's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Vilma C. is 39 years old and married with four school-aged children. She is from Cogon, Ozamis City. Vilma is the leader of a two-member loan group with PMPC called Vilma C.’s Group. While each member receives an individual loan, they are all responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. 

Vilma owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store, selling a variety of products to local community members. This is a new business for Vilma and she earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. Vilma joined PMPC in 2010 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC and is now requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase additional inventory for her business. This will be her third loan with PMPC. Vilma plans to use the additional revenue generated from her loan to improve the general living conditions of her family.


About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase inventory for general store

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Mrs. Ann K. (pictured here), 59, is a widow with one daughter who is a garment factory worker. She also has one niece and one nephew living with her. They live in a village on National Road number 2, about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City.  

Ann is a rice farmer. She is asking for a loan of $1,200 to purchase a motorbike for her daughter to drive to work.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her daughter to drive to work.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.es:
Lilia es una mujer de 53 años de edad que se dedica a la venta de papelería, juguetería, ropa, medicamentos y delantales en general, ella es casada y tiene 5 hijos en las edades de 16 a 34 años. Lilia es una mujer con mucha capacidad de riesgo  en cuando a emprendimiento se refiere y desde  el año 1992 ha estado trabajando en diversos negocios,  primero vendió gallina en los restaurantes, en el 1993 ya había arrendado un restaurante y se dedicó  a la venta de comidas y en el 1994 comenzó con un negocio de comercialización de mercancía especialmente calzado que traía desde Bucaramanga y  cuando su esposo comenzó a trabajar en una empresa, emprendieron un punto comercial , compraron poco a poco vitrinas que surtieron y diversificaron la mercancía haciendo una buena exhibición de ella,  negocio que en el día de hoy maneja una rentabilidad no menor de un 7% vendiendo papelería, útiles escolares, medicina natural, juguetería, accesorios y detalles para el hogar. Sus clientes son principalmente sus vecinos a quienes vende de contado y tiene una cartera de clientes selectos a los cuales vende a crédito. Su credikiva es el segundo financiamiento que hizo a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con él comprará de contado y en mayor volumen, papelería que es la mercancía de mayor rotación y adquirida en mayor cantidad, le representará una utilidad adicional por los descuentos que trae este sistema.
Desde que recibió su primer financiamiento ha logrado legalizar su negocio en la Cámara de Comercio del Municipio, ahora su meta más adelante es adicionar a su negocio un restaurante de comida Santandereana y seguir apoyando la gestión de su hogar,  con el que sueña verlo prosperar cada día.
texts.en:
Lilia is a 53-year-old woman who sells stationery, toys, clothes, medicine and aprons in general.  She’s married and has five children ranging in ages from 16 to 34.  Lilia is a woman with much risk capacity in business, she says.  Since 1992 she’s been working in various businesses.  First she sold chicken in restaurants.  In 1993 she had rented a restaurant and went into food sales.  In 1994 she started a business selling merchandise, especially shoes that she’d bring from Bucaramanga and when her husband started working for a firm they opened a store.  They bought display cases that they stocked with a variety of products displaying them well, a business that today she runs with a profit margin no less than 7% selling paper goods, school supplies, natural remedies, toys, accessories and home decorations.  Her customers are primarily her neighbors that she sells to for cash.  She also has a select group of customers that she sells to on credit.

Her Kiva loan is the second loan she’s gotten from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use it to pay cash for a large volume of stationery supplies, which is the merchandise with the highest turnover rate.  This will mean a higher profit margin for her thanks to the discounts she’ll get paying cash.

Since getting her first loan she’s managed to regularize her business in the municipal Chamber of Commerce.  Now her goal for later on is to add a restaurant specializing in the food of Santander to her store and to continue running her household with the dream of seeing it prosper more each day.

loans.use: to buy stationery supplies for cash and in larger volume.

loans.name: Roberto Carlos

texts.es:
Roberto padre de familia de 29 años de edad, vive con su esposa y su hijo en su  casa propia; no cuenta con los servicios básicos, ubicada  en la zona rural del distrito de Olmos, a una hora de distancia del departamento de Lambayeque.  Los pobladores de éste distrito se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y artesanía.
Roberto  se dedica a manejar su mototaxi (transporte que se utiliza para movilizarse en distancias cortas, con un cupo máximo de 3 personas) desde hace 4 años, actividad que realiza en su mismo distrito llevando personas a los diferentes caseríos de la zona, cuenta con algunos clientes fijos, a pesar de la competencia que existe, trata en lo posible de movilizar la mayor cantidad de pasajeros, con los ingresos que deja su actividad trata de solventar sus obligaciones familiares.

El crédito que ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa es de 1500 nuevos soles y su destino será para comprar un nuevos motor a su mototaxi, ya que por el constante uso que le da está presentando algunos desperfectos mecánicos y necesita brindarle mantenimiento para que pueda seguir dando un buen servicio a sus clientes, lo que permitirá tener mayores ganancias para tener una mejor calidad de vida.

Roberto es un hombre muy respetado y conocido en la zona donde vive  por ser trabajador, responsable y buen padre, con el único fin de que a su familia no le falte nada.
texts.en:
Roberto padre de familia de 29 años de edad, vive con su esposa y su hijo en su  casa propia; no cuenta con los servicios básicos, ubicada  en la zona rural del distrito de Olmos, a una hora de distancia del departamento de Lambayeque.  Los pobladores de éste distrito se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y artesanía.
Roberto  se dedica a manejar su mototaxi (transporte que se utiliza para movilizarse en distancias cortas, con un cupo máximo de 3 personas) desde hace 4 años, actividad que realiza en su mismo distrito llevando personas a los diferentes caseríos de la zona, cuenta con algunos clientes fijos, a pesar de la competencia que existe, trata en lo posible de movilizar la mayor cantidad de pasajeros, con los ingresos que deja su actividad trata de solventar sus obligaciones familiares.

El crédito que ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa es de 1500 nuevos soles y su destino será para comprar un nuevos motor a su mototaxi, ya que por el constante uso que le da está presentando algunos desperfectos mecánicos y necesita brindarle mantenimiento para que pueda seguir dando un buen servicio a sus clientes, lo que permitirá tener mayores ganancias para tener una mejor calidad de vida.

Roberto es un hombre muy respetado y conocido en la zona donde vive  por ser trabajador, responsable y buen padre, con el único fin de que a su familia no le falte nada.

loans.use: Compra de motor y brindar reparaciones a su mototaxi

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 33 years old and has four children. Alma is married and three of her children are in school. She is in the agricultural business, farming fish in the Philippines. Alma requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and pay for the expansion of her fishpond.

Alma has been operating the fishpond for five years now and has borrowed 11 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Alma would like to save enough money so she can send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase feed and pay  for the expansion of her fishpond.

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: Résidant à Avédji, (un quartier qui est situé à quelque kilomètres de la ville de Lomé). Mme Yawa est  âgée de 40ans, mariée à un cultivateur- éleveur, elle est mère de 03enfants. Elle se donne à cette activité depuis 2004 de façon ambulante. Elle sollicite ce deuxième prêt pour acheter 10 pièces de pagnes Hitarget, 08 pièces de pagnes Deluxe  pour revendre  pour avoir de bénéfices, afin d’avoir  sa propre boutique pour éviter de marcher à chaque fois pour vendre et pour assurer un avenir meilleur à ses enfants.
texts.en: Resident of Avedji (a neighborhood situated a few kilometers from the city of Lome), Mrs. Yawa is 40 years old and married to a farmer-rancher. She is mother of 3 children.  She has been in business since 2004, selling from place to place.  She is asking for this second loan to buy 10 pieces of Hitarget pagne (traditional cloth) and 8 pieces of Deluxe pagne, for resale to earn a profit in order to have her own store so that she can avoid walking for each sale and to offer a better future to her children.

loans.use: to buy pagne (traditional cloth).

loans.name: Rosas De Franz Tamayo Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ROSAS DE FRANZ TAMAYO” iniciará su tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Los Andes, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Cinda. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de comida, venta de condimentos, salón de belleza, chofer, tejido de chompas, venta de mantas, y tienda de barrio 

La señora Cinda,  indica que hace un año que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de su comadre. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de condimentos, que viene trabajando desde hace cinco años aprendiendo el mismo de su hermano. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de condimentos) que adquirirá comprará del Desaguadero y lo comercializará los días miércoles y viernes a pedido. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es soltera y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los ahorros
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Rosas de Franz Tamayo” (Roses of Franz Tamayo) is starting its third loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes Community Center. The group consists of nine members and is led by a Board of Directors headed by Sra. Cinda. The members of the Communal Bank engage in various business activities such as selling food, selling condiments, managing a beauty salon, working as a chauffeur, knitting sweaters, selling blankets, and managing a store.

Sra. Cinda says that she has worked with Pro Mujer for one year and joined the organization after being invited by the godmother of her child. She currently has a business selling condiments. Cinda started working five years ago and learned the business from her brother.

The loan she is currently taking out will increase her capital for buying condiments. She acquires her goods in Desaguadero and sells them on Wednesdays and Fridays by request. Through her work, Cinda is able to generate income to support her family. She is single and has one child.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Cinda said she enjoys the savings.

loans.use: to purchase condiments.

loans.name: Sim

texts.en:
Mrs. Sim, 43, is living in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. Her husband is a Khmer musician, playing traditional music of Cambodia. 

Mrs. Sim takes time to work as a fish seller in one market near her village. Together, this couple earns a profit of about $5 per day. They have five kids in their care. Now one of the five is working in Phnom Penh, getting a suitable salary per month. To improve the happiness of their big family, Mrs.Sim would like to request a loan in the amount of $ 600 in order to purchase a new motorbike. In the future, she will send all of her children to study at high levels, as others.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorbike.

loans.name: Pilar

texts.es: Pilar de 36 años es una mujer amable y trabajadora. Vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo y sus cinco hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida y una buena educación para el futuro.Ella se dedica al alquiler de bicicletas. Normalmente, espera en su casa a que vengan los niños o señores en busca de un poco de diversión y sano ejercicios o quizás por alguna necesidad de transportarse. Cuenta con 10 bicicletas las que alquila en su mayoría a los chicos en edad escolar.Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que siempre hay clientes además de poder estar en casa cerca de sus hijos. Lo que no le agrada es que a veces los niños se caen o maltratan a las bicicletas y tiene que pagar ella con los repuestos. Sin embargo ella continua perseverante porque es una actividad que le genera ganancias suficientes para poder cumplir con las necesidades básicas del hogar, ya que su esposo se dedica a otras actividades. Le gustaría poder comprar más bicicletas y mandar a arreglar los que presentan algún deterioro por el tiempo.Este es el segundo préstamo que realiza Pilar con MFP y espera poder seguir cumpliendo con la misma responsabilidad que lo ha hecho hasta ahora, se siente muy cómoda en su grupo ya que todos son vecinos y siempre están al pendiente de lo que le pueda suceder a la otra.Con el monto solicitado 1000 soles ella mandará a pintar y arreglar sus bicicletas.
texts.en:
Pilar, age 36, is a friendly and hardworking woman. She lives in her own home with her husband and five children, for whom she wants to provide a better quality of life and a good education for their future. Pilar has a business renting out bicycles. Normally, she waits at home for children and adults who are looking to have a little bit of fun and healthy exercise. Some of them may need a mode of transportation. Pilar has 10 bicycles for rent and most of her customers are school-age children. What she likes most about her job is that she always has customers and can be at home so that she is near her children. The part that she dislikes is whenever the children fall off the bicycles or damage them because she has to pay for replacement parts. Nonetheless, she continues to persevere because this business generates sufficient income for her to cover basic household needs. Her husband engages in other activities. Pilar would like to buy more bicycles and repair some of those that have deteriorated over time.

This is her second loan with MFP. Pilar hopes to continue fulfilling her commitments in the same responsible manner that she has done to this point. She feels very comfortable with her group since all of them are neighbors and always looking out for one another. The amount of 1000 PEN that she requested will be used to paint and repair her bicycles.

loans.use: to paint and repair her rental bikes.
